Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: They are coming. Atom by atom they will coil around us and take all that we are. There is only one way to confront this threat. By reuniting the twenty four warring houses of our empire. We have forgotten the unforgettable, the last to unify our tribes, Kahless. Together under one creed, remain Klingon. That is why we light our beacon this day. To assemble our people. To lock arms against those fatal greeting is...(in English) We come in peace.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We come in peace. That's why we're here. Isn't that the whole idea of Starfleet?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Hey, I taught you that.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You don't trust me, Captain?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I trust you with my life, Commander Burnham, but it doesn't change the fact that you're lost. Very lost.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Technically, we would be lost.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: How long until that storm comes crashing down on us?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I estimate one hour, 17 minutes, 22 seconds. Which is why I've made sure we're not lost. The map says the well is this way, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: This drought's going to last 89 years. The Crepusculans are facing extinction as a species. See those egg sacs? Those are their offspring.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: They've survived here for over a thousand years, Michael.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Right, and if we don't do something now, they won't live another thousand hours. The ambient radiation from a nearby drilling accident dried out their water table. If we can get in and out without making contact, we can steer clear of General Order One. And there is the well.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I stand corrected.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Ye of little faith.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Oh, never had a doubt. (powers up phaser rifle) Tell me what I need to break through this bedrock.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Point 7 second field burst at level setting 13.5.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Georgiou to Shenzhou. Two to transport.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The storm is moving faster than I thought. The ship won't be able to pick up our signatures. Unless we can contact Lieutenant Saru, we could be trapped here until it's over.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Let's take a walk.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Follow my footsteps, Michael, even lines.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Why? Captain, where are we going?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It's your turn to trust me, Number One.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: But now we're really lost. We're far too small to be seen with the naked eye. And you can't set a course without a star. Is it wise to be heading away from the village?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It's hard to imagine you've served under me for seven years. I think it's time that we talked about you having your own command.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm grateful, Captain. Though I would be significantly more so if I thought we had any chance of ever returning to the ship.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Just keep walking, Michael. What will you do if you were stuck here for 89 years?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: A likely scenario unless we die here in the desert.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: But say you lived.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: As a xenoanthropologist, I could reveal myself to the natives, learn their culture, try to fit in, if possible. And you, Captain? What will you do if we're trapped here for 89 years?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: That's easy. I'd escape.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: These are our footprints. You've walked us in a circle.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Not exactly a circle.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: How did they find us?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I set a star.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: First Officer's Log, Stardate 1207.3. On Earth, it's May 11th, 2256. A Sunday. The crew of the USS Shenzhou has been called to the edge of Federation space to investigate damage done to one of our interstellar relays. Blast burns around the hole are inconclusive. Were they caused by an asteroid, or was it deliberately destroyed to limit Starfleet communications? And if so, by whom? Despite the risks of our mission, I remain optimistic. It's hard not to be in the face of such beauty. In this case, a binary star system. Around these two suns, ice, dust and gasses collide to form the planets future generations will call home. A humbling reminder that all life is born from chaos and destruction.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Based on initial readings, I would say the relay doesn't appear to have been damaged naturally. I don't like the look of that.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Well, keep looking.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Well, the comment was figurative. I'm expressing concern.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Finish your scans so you can express facts instead. The bridge is yours, Mister Saru.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Yes Commander.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Yes, Number One.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Your Chief Science Officer is worried. Something took a bite out of our relay. Saru thinks it was malicious.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Saru's Kelpien. He thinks everything's malicious. What do you think? Any idea what it is?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: By all indications, nothing intelligent.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: But?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Starfleet's reputation for tech hygiene is exemplary. When a relay goes down, the Federation sends a ship to fix it.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You think someone's trying to get our attention?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: If they are, they have.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Lieutenant Saru, what do we have?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Ah. I have taken the initiative of keeping us at maximum scanning distance in case of anything threatening out there, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Yes. Number One tells me you suspect foul play.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Despite the First Officer's constant need to dismiss my ideas...

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She apparently agrees with you.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Really?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm shocked as well. Ensign Connor, agreement between my senior officers. Note the date and time.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Noted, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Is this amount of sarcasm always necessary?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Necessary, no. But I do like it.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: There is something else out there.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: What do you have, Saru?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Recalibrating sensors.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Electronic alignment in process.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Active scans are being deflected. I'm having trouble locating the source.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: So something's out there, but no one can tell me where or what it is.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Ah, wait. I have it. No. Recalibrating.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Any time now, Mister Saru.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I have it.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Magnify. Is that what damaged our relay? What am I looking at?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Object of unknown origin.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Let's get more specific.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm unable to bring it into focus.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Number One?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Range is 2,000 kilometres. Bearing 358 mark 269. Roughly 150 metres long, tucked into that accretion disk almost directly below us. It's in a sensor dead zone. Some kind of scattering field is confounding the ship's ability to translate the image.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: As Science Officer, I can provide a far more concrete and in-depth analysis than simply reading data off a monitor, but considering it's scrambling our optical processors, how are we going to be able to see it?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Thoughts, Number One?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: With such little data, I'd prefer not to speculate.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I will. It's lurking. The scattering field it's emitting suggests intent. BURNHAM> We see something we don't understand and instantly cast judgment? Maybe it's lost. Maybe it's afraid to show us its whole self.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Hiding, but maybe hoping to be found.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Here we are, speculating.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I respectfully recommend we leave it alone.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm not sure we have much choice. We can't lock on to it, and we don't have a shuttle maneuverable enough to navigate the ring.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'll go. All I need is a thruster pack.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: With the high levels of radiation kicking off those binaries, she'll have 20 minutes until her DNA starts to unravel like noodles.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Like noodles? I'll be back in 19. A flyby.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It seems a waste of the ship's resources. What will be gained?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You do understand that being afraid of everything means you learn nothing. There's no opportunity to discover, to explore.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: And here I thought we were doing a deep-space communication relay audit.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You're both right. Saru, go with her.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain!

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Best to keep variables to a minimum. I wouldn't want to put my colleague at risk.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: And you, Mister Saru? Are you equally happy not to be put at risk?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Oh, on any occasion, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You realise, once you reach that scattering field, you could be cut off from all communication.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We've come all this way, Captain. It would be irresponsible to leave whatever that is unknown.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Just a flyby.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Just a flyby.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commencing airlock depressurisation sequence.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander Burnham, this is Ensign Danby Connor.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: On behalf of Captain Georgiou and the entire crew of the USS Shenzhou, we'd like to welcome you to flight 819 with non-stop service to the object of unknown origin.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: This is Commander Burnham. Commencing reconnaissance mission to field void and unknown object. Data collection is on and nominal. All lights are green.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Establishing interlink frequency with Commander Burnham's EV. Channel clear and ready to transmit.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Confirming six second directional thrust for saucer realignment.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commencing final prelaunch system checks. Life support nominal. Oxygen nitrogen saturation nominal. Air pressure and flow nominal. Communication module active. Filters at 0.01% saturation.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Preflight checklist complete.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The object is 2,000 kilometres bearing...

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Computer, enable igniter.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Ten seconds to thruster ignition. Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Body scan online, heart rate 79 and rising, BP 130 over 70. That's a little elevated for her.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She's having fun.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Almost to the debris field, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Understood. Michael, watch your time.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: 19 minutes, not a nanosecond longer.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm fully aware.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Boost signal.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unable to comply. Scattering field. It must be interfering with comms.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Mission clock at 17 minutes, 30 seconds.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Interference is starting to degrade resolution.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Routing additional power to subspace antennae.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Shenzhou, do you copy?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Distance to object 1,000 kilometers and closing.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Shenzhou, do you copy?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Implementing automatic course correction.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Hello. Shenzhou, are you able to see this?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Michael, can you hear me? Acknowledge. Michael, can you hear me? Acknowledge.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: There's just too much interference.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Shenzhou, do you copy? Data Collection Unit, are you there?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Internal computer on line.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Good. Mission time?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: 12 minutes, 58 seconds.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Plenty of time to take a peek. Even from this distance, it's clearly not debris.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: 12 minutes and 48 seconds until maximum radiation exposure.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The Commander is less than ten metres from the outermost edge of the scattering field.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I can't remember who said sculptures are crystallized spirituality. Headlamp. But I see what they meant. This is Burnham in the blind. I'm above the object, which is old. Centuries old. It's difficult to tell if it was constructed or carved. The only word to effectively describe it is wow. But I'll try to be more precise. Its surface has the appearance of stone with an exoskeleton of metal alloy. Oh, incredibly intricate. The construction and design are nothing short of astounding. I wish you could see what I'm seeing. It is sublime. It's impossible to discern a practical purpose. I'm going to land on it, get a closer look. Nice and easy. Hold on. My presence has triggered some sort of motion response.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Mission countdown, ten minutes, 15 seconds. Warning. Proximity alert.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Scanning for database recognition. Iconography confirmed. Klingon.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm Commander Burnham of the United Federation of Planets.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Still no sign of Commander Burnham. Mission clock runs out in 15 seconds.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: There's still too much interference. I have Number One. Telemetry only. Blood pressure is 70 and falling. She won't make it unless we get her back now.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Transporter Control. Do we have her, Mister Weeton?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Pattern integrity's too weak, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Saru, get a lock on her. Boost her signal.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain, there is no signal.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You better get me a signal. Remotely fire her jetpack.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She's offline.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She's floating free.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Engineering. Tractor beam?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Can't get a lock. We're running manual calculations.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The scattering field is still a problem, Captain. We can't transport her until she clears it.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She'll soon exhibit symptoms of acute radiation syndrome.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She's not gonna last much longer.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Hang on.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander Burnham, Shenzhou, please respond. Commander Burnham? Commander, please respond. Shenzhou to Commander Burnham. Commander, do you read? Please respond.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Witness our brother, our Torchbearer, killed by the Federation interloper on our sacred beacon. I see you, as you see the end. Our Torchbearer honours us. First to die in our crusade for self-preservation.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Our ancestors, welcome our fallen brother Rejac, to their Black Fleet. They fight with us as we fight against our enemy. Remain Klingon.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Pupil Burnham. Pupil Burnham. Klingon social order rests upon?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Inviolable honour-shame dynamic.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Correct. Klingon homeworld Qo'noS.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unwelcoming to the Federation.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Correct. Klingon political order.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Twenty four great Houses.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Correct. Location of the most recent Klingon terror raid. Unacceptable duration between query and correct response. Number of survivors at the Human-Vulcan science outpost at Doctari Alpha.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unacceptable duration between query and correct response. Number of survivors at Doctari Alpha.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: No.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unacceptable response. Number of survivors

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Please. Stop!

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Program paused.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Sarek. I'm sorry. I can do better.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: When emotion brings us ghosts from the past, only logic can root us in the present. Maybe I can try to learn Vulcan, to be quicker with my answers.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Your human tongue is not the problem. It is your human heart.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Good. You're awake.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I was dreaming.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Oh? What about?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Klingons. How did I get here?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We transported you back aboard three hours ago.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Three hours?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Antiproton therapy regimen incomplete.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander, what are you doing?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Session terminated prematurely. Medical Emergency.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: There's no time.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander, wait. The recombination process is nowhere near finished.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I need you back in the antiproton chamber. Do you understand the effect of genetic unspooling? You don't want to die that way. Commander!

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The binaries are kicking off serious QEs up and down the spectrum.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Targeting gets hot, but I still can't tell what I'm grabbing onto.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I want to know what's out there, people.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Okay, let's go around the horn again, by the numbers.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: What's going on?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Number One, you should be in Sickbay.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: What Have they made contact?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Who's they?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: There are Klingons out there. We need to go to red alert.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Michael. Almost no one has seen a Klingon in a hundred years.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I have. One attacked me on that object. Check my helmet cam.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The footage was corrupted.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Internal sensors show that the Commander has entered the Bridge in an irradiated state. Without immediate treatment, her condition will most certainly be terminal.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: He was warrior caste. His... his EV suit bore a Klingon house insignia.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: She also has a grade-three concussion.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I am not delusional. This has nothing to do with a concussion. Philippa, there are Klingons.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Red alert. Tell me what happened.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: He ambushed me. I hit my thruster pack to get away. I somehow knocked him into his blade. I killed him. But that object could be hiding a Klingon raiding party, obscured behind their scattering field.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: If there are Klingons in this sector, they may be responsible for the damage to our relay.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: If there are Klingons in this sector, we should withdraw immediately.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: This is Federation space. Retreat is not an option. Whatever is over there needs to show itself. If it's hiding Klingons, we've got to flush them out.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Target phase cannons on the object.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We cannot destroy another culture's property on a whim.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I didn't say anything about destroying it. Let's make them think we're going to attack.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Target the object.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We're locked on.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Something is scanning us. They've detected our weapons signature.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Wait.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Impossible.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: No warp signatures detected, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Then where did they come from? Mister Gant, disengage phase-cannon targeting. Number One, get to Sickbay. I need you fixed up and back on the bridge, stat. Mister Januzzi, contact Starfleet Command. Send an encoded message. Tell them we have engaged the Klingons.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unidentified Klingon vessel, this is the Federation Starship Shenzhou. Please respond.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: All is as it is meant to be. Who is Rejac's next in line?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Or'Eq.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The honour falls to you to be our new Torchbearer.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: With respect, I find great wisdom in your teachings.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: But?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Can you be sure our brothers and sisters will answer your call?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: They will because the prophecy commands all Klingons must come to the light of Kahless when it shines in the night sky.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Will ships really fly across the galaxy because of a fable?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: So, you doubt? You dishonour only yourself.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: (an albino) I will light the beacon.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Speak your name.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Voq, son of none.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You have no family blade of your own. You cannot assume the birthright of a noble House. You are unworthy.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I am worthy. Not by blood, but by faith. I serve the light of Kahless. (puts hand into flame) I am reborn in his flames.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I recognise you as one who has lived his life on the outside and yearns to be part of something bigger than himself. Some may see the colour of your skin as nature's mistake. I call it a mirror, for I see myself in you.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: My Lord, long-range sensors show the movement, just as you predicted.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Excellent. The time has come. Take my blade, Voq, son of none. The honour of Torchbearer is yours. Light the beacon.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unidentified Klingon vessel, this is the Federation Starship Shenzhou. Please respond.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Unidentified Klingon vessel, this is the Federation Starship Shenzhou. Please respond. Is there any chance they can't hear us?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You're transmitting on every subspace channel there is. Your orders, Commander?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Any response?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: None. Commander, there is something I'd like to show you. Their hull is covered in hollow, ornamental, metallic pods, thousands of them, tightly interlocked, forming a kind of armour.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Not the most efficient defense.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I suspect its purpose is more symbolic than practical. They contain Klingon biological material in various states of decay. Remote dating is wildly divergent. Some bones date back thousands of years, others only hours old.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Their entire ship is covered with coffins.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander, the Captain listens to you. Tell her we must withdraw.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm afraid that's no longer possible.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Your world has food chains. Mine does not. Our species map is binary. We are either predator or prey. My people were hunted, bred, farmed. We are your livestock of old. We were biologically determined for one purpose and one purpose alone. To sense the coming of death. I sense it coming now.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The Klingon flagship has a stealth mode. It's some kind of cloaking screen, unlike anything we've ever seen, Admiral. There may be more vessels out there than we know. We've reached out with every form of friendship greeting Starfleet has. They're blocking our hails.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It feels like a setup. Maybe our relay got too close for Klingon comfort, and they destroyed it to lure us out here.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You remember my First Officer, Michael Burnham?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Next time, you might try not disturbing the property of a warrior race we've hardly spoken to for a hundred years. Our only choice now is to navigate this situation with as much finesse as possible.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Admiral, if I may. The ideal outcome for any Klingon interaction is battle. They're relentlessly hostile, sir. It's in their nature.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The Federation and the Klingon Empire have always been on the cold side of war. We've had only fleeting run-ins with them for a century, and now you presume to know their motivation because it is in their nature? Considering your background, I would think you're the last person to make assumptions based on race.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: With respect, it would be unwise to confuse race and culture.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The Europa and all fleet vessels within range will be at your coordinates in two hours. Hold your position. Do nothing. Absent provocation, understood?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Understood, Admiral.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Signal terminated.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: That went well. What's the mood outside?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Saru is the only one talking. He strongly believes we should about-face.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: There is a space station at Eagle Twelve, three light years away. The Andorian colony at Gamma-Hydra is six. Shenzhou is their only line of defense if the Klingons attack.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Not if. When.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I have to hope that whatever happens here can serve as a bridge between our civilisations.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: That's the diplomat in you talking. What does the soldier say?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Nothing good.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain to the Bridge.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Status? Massive photonic activity on the Klingon object, Captain. Output is over one billion lumens per square metre.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Optical sensors overloading.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Bring plasmatic filters online.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Rerouting power.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Is that a weapon?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It seems to be some sort of signal emitter.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Where are my filters?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: They're at 100 percent, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Initiating emergency shutdown.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: That noise is some kind of electromagnetic subspace wave-form.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Narrowing channel range.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Adjusting orientation to minimise dispersal.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Somebody turn it down.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: All the way down.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Acoustics are muted. That's the ship's superstructure in sympathetic vibration.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It's a signal pulse.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Is there a message?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: This may be the message. Captain, what if they're calling for the same thing we are? Backup.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Long-range sensors to the maximum, Saru. If more Klingons are on their way, I want as much notice as possible.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Permission to leave the bridge, Captain?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Are you kidding?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It's relevant.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Granted. Ensign, get me a status report, deck by deck.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Computer.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Working.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Open dedicated subspace channel 222AA7.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Use of this frequency requires diplomatic authorisation.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Voiceprint authorise. Burnham, Michael.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Confirmed.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander Burnham.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Hello, Sarek. I'm happy to see you.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: So many years, and still you allow emotional considerations to impede your logic.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: They inform my logic. I need your help.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I assume the timing of the call was not coincidental. The quadrant reports a new star in the sky. What have you done out there, on the edge of Federation space?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We've encountered the Klingons.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: How rare to meet one's own demons in the flesh.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I killed one.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: In light of the fact that they killed your parents, some might think that only fair. However, if a death was necessary, I am satisfied it was not yours. I'm most certain you did not call me for emotional solace.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We're facing off. No fire has been exchanged. But they didn't turn on their beacon until Starfleet was on its way to our position. I think they're summoning more of their kind.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: An odd proposition given that their Empire has been in disarray for generations. But you are describing something out of the ordinary. Restraint in the face of conflict. When a civilisation acts in opposition to its instincts, it may be under the influence of something, or someone, new. Great unifiers are few and far between, but they do come. Often such leaders will need a profound cause for their followers to rally around.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: A war.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Be very careful that your assumptions are not being driven by your past.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: This isn't about what happened, Sarek. It's what's happening now. How did the Vulcans achieve diplomatic relations with the Klingons?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: That is a solution particular to us. One cannot assume it would work on a ship commanded by humans.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Sarek, please.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I caution you, be considered with how you use this information. You cannot save lives that have already been lost.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Tell me. How did you keep the Klingons at bay?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Engineering, report.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Internal damage, negative. Core is 100%.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain, we have to fire on them. Hit that ship with everything we've got.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Absolutely not. They haven't powered weapons. They don't appear to pose an imminent threat.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: The Klingon threat is always imminent and inevitable.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Tactical log's ready.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Thank you, Mister Gant. I'd like to remind you, we're wildly outgunned.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: 240 years ago, near H'Atoria, a Vulcan ship crossed into Klingon space. The Klingons attacked immediately. They destroyed the vessel. Vulcans don't make the same mistake twice. From then on, until formal relations were established, whenever the Vulcans crossed paths with Klingons, the Vulcans fired first. They said hello in a language the Klingons understood. Violence brought respect. Respect brought peace. Captain, we have to give the Klingons a Vulcan hello.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: If their intention is to attack, balling up our fists won't dissuade them.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: It would be logical for you to take into account my success rate during our seven years together, and execute my plan without further challenge before we're dragged into war.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Starfleet doesn't fire first. That's all, Number One.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We have to.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: In my Ready room. Now. Lieutenant Commander, you have the Bridge.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Computer, privacy.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: How dare you challenge me?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I apologise for my insubordination.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Don't you realise that kind of talk can destabilise a crew?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Don't underestimate them. I've overseen their exercises. They're ready for battle.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Battle is not a simulation. It's blood and screams and funerals. I taught you better than this. We don't start shooting on a hunch, and we don't take innocent lives. Period. I understand your history with the Klingons.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: My commitment to this course of action is not emotional. We target its neck, cut off its head

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You're still injured. You're not thinking clearly.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Thousands of lives will be lost because of failure to act.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Whose lives? Victims of your imaginary war?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: And your life, Captain. Yours.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Stand down, Commander Burnham. That's an order.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You're right. I may not be myself.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Easy, Michael.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: You're relieved, Mister Saru.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Where is the Captain?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I provided her with Klingon intel from a personal source on Vulcan. She's passing it to the Admiral. Weapons, slot a pair of photon torpedoes in the tubes and compute a firing solution targeting the neck of that Klingon ship.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Is the plan to fire on the Klingons, Commander?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We have to be ready in case that's what the Captain decides.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Are you acting on the Captain's orders?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: I'm your superior officer. We are in a high-risk scenario. Question chain of command again and I'll remove you.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Commander, it's just... your breathing is elevated. Perspiration's visible at your hairline. I fear what you are doing betrays the wishes of our Captain.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Target phasers. Take your station, Commander.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: This is mutiny.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Move, Saru. Tactical.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: We're locked on.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Fire!

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Belay that order!

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain, please. I'm trying to save you. I'm trying to save all of you.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Stand down.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Captain! Incoming. Warp signatures detected.

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: Is it Starfleet?

Title: the-vulcan-hello
Dialogue: No. Those ships are Klingon.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Ambassador Sarek, it's good to see you again.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Thank you for receiving us, Captain Georgiou.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The pleasure is ours.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: As discussed, this is my ward, - Michael Burnham.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Hello, Michael. Welcome to the USS Shenzhou. And congratulations on your recent commencement.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Respect is earned, as is friendliness.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Yet diplomatic niceties must be observed.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: This is hardly a negotiation.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: First contact, then. The only human to attend the Vulcan Learning Centre and Science Academy rejoins her own kind. You can see my analogy, more or less.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Less.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I will leave you now. Live long and prosper. (sotto to Burnham) Behave.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Energizing.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: On Vulcan, lateral vector transporter technology has been discarded due to the massive amount of power it requires.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Starfleet has phased out that design as well. Shenzhou is old, but she gets us where we need to go.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Attention, all personnel, stand by to

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Is this vessel not up to your standards?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I have no standards when it comes to this ship. It was always my intention to join the Vulcan Expeditionary Group.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Sometimes the universe allows for the making of unexpected memories.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Emotional platitudes are not what I was hoping for.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Well, you've really been away from humans for a long time.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Doctor Nambue.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I'd say you're too confident for your own good, but I've seen your record.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: As I have seen yours.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: And your confidence is justified.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: As is yours.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Ready to see your new home?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain on the bridge.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Not too shabby, huh?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: It appears to be functional.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I understand your hesitation, Michael. It's hard leaving Vulcan and everything you've known behind. But I assure you, this can be your new home, if you want it to be.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Thank you Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: How many Klingon vessels have entered the system?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Tracking. 24, Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The Klingon High Council consists of 24 houses. That can't be a coincidence. The number of ships. It suggests that someone is attempting to unify the Empire again, against us.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Commander Burnham, you have endangered your vessel and your shipmates. You have attacked a superior officer. You violated the chain of command. You are relieved of duty. Security, remand her to the brig.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Where is T'Kumva? I heed the sacred call of the Beacon of Kahless and the one who sent it ignores my presence?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Your leader delays me from my voyage. Why?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: What threat to the Empire spreads across the stars?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Bring your leader at once. Do not waste any more of my time.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: My presence. My voyage. My time. No one speaks of my duty or my honour.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Show respect, T'Kumva. You are nothing. You have not earned a seat on this Council.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: And yet I am the one who leads the way to our Empire's resurrection. As a child my destiny was illuminated by the light of Kahless. This ship belonged to my father. Upon his death, it lay until I discovered it and vowed to restore honour to my house.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: This is not your playground. You will show respect.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: But there is no honour without unity. There is no home for any of us, unless it is shared by all.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: You speak of unity yet you disgrace this ship with outcasts and vermin.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Look around! This holy vessel soars once again because of my lord. He has even devised a way to hide it behind a cloak of invisibility

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: My House is open to all, including those discarded by you, Kol. But my House is bonded by a single doctrine. Remain Klingon.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We are done listening to this fool.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The House of D'Ghor will hear more.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: As will House Mokai.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: One day soon, I will put you back in your place, T'Kuvma. (hologram disappears)

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: How do you propose to unite us?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We have become complacent in the time since we last battled the Federation at Donatu V. Our purity is a threat to them. They wish to drag us into the muck where humans, Vulcans, Tellarites and filthy Andorians mix.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Their ship is but a fleck. What threat does one ship pose?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Great leaders, everything I say will come to pass. Look to the stars. Our destiny has arrived.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Starships Clarke, Shran, T'Plana-Hath, Kerala, Sioux, Ride, Earhart, Dana, Edison, Yeager dropped out of warp

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Where is the admiral?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The Europa is still 800 AUs out.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain, the Klingons are no longer jamming ship communications.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Januzzi, open a channel.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Unidentified Klingon vessel, this is Captain Philippa Georgiou of the USS Shenzhou.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We are on the outermost borders of Federation space, but make no mistake, you and your artefact are in our territory. We regret the situation has resulted in the death of your warrior. We offer you two choices. Leave immediately or open a dialogue with us. Hopefully, it is the latter, so that we can reengage with the Klingon Empire and prove to you that now, as always

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Here it comes. Their lie.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We come in peace. (hologram ends)

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: No! They do not! The come to destroy our individuality. Shall we rise up together and give them the fight they deserve?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Remain Klingon!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Fire!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Battle stations.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Ops, damage report.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Ensign Connor?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Transferring ops to this station, Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Direct hit. Hull breaches, decks 13 through 15. Emergency force fields in place, bulkheads holding.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Get her to sickbay.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Secondary tactical off-line.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Shields.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: At maximum, Captain, and holding for now.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Helm, evasive manoeuvre seven alpha.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Connor, can you make it to sickbay?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The USS T'Plana-Hath is under heavy attack from three Klingon vessels.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Detmer, make your heading 219 mark 6.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Mister Gant.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Phasers armed and ready, Captain. Locking on target.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Fire.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Computer, how badly have we been hit?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: You have been confined to the brig. Query denied.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Who's there?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Where are the medical officers?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Connor, what happened?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The bridge was hit.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Who else was hurt? Is... is the Captain all right?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: She told me to go to sickbay. But this isn't sickbay. We're at war. You should be on the bridge.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I can't help. I'm locked up for mutiny.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Why are we fighting? We're Starfleet. We're explorers, not soldiers.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Connor, you took a blow to the head. Activate that comm panel and call Doctor Nambue.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Yes, I... I need help.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Michael. Michael. Michael. My mind to your mind. My thoughts to your thoughts. Come back to me.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Major hull breach. Major hull breach. Deck one, deck three, deck six, deck seven, deck eight, deck nine.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Status.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Additional hull breaches, decks one, three, and six through nine.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The brig.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Shield at fifteen percent. Diverting main power from compromised decks to the bridge. Containment field failure is imminent. All repair personnel evacuate immediately.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Sarek? How is it possible? A mind-meld across a thousand light years?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: More than a mind-meld. Ever since you were a child, ever since the bombing at the Learning Centre, that act of terror that forever changed your destiny, a part of me, my katra, has been with you. It also allows us this unique form of connection. I see by your imprisonment that my counsel concerning the Klingons did not yield the results you hoped for.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I couldn't convince Captain Georgiou to strike the Klingons first, so I took matters into my own hands. You're disappointed. As you should be.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I did not come here to judge your actions. I came because I sensed your your despair.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Communicating with you in this manner. The physical cost is significant.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Then leave me. Please.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Do you think I came here just to say farewell? I would not put my well-being at risk for such sentimentality. The death and destruction raining down on Starfleet, that was to be expected. What I cannot abide is a waste of resources. You're gifted. You are brave. You must do better. Because I know you can.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: You were never one to bolster my self-esteem.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Perhaps that is where I failed you. No matter your shame, gather your strength. Find a way to help those who need you. Live long and prosper.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Incoming warship on attack vector. They've locked on to us.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Divert all power from nonessential systems to aft shields.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Ops.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Yes, Captain. Emergency forcefield is holding.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: But shields and impulse engines are off-line. We are completely disabled.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: They're still coming. Right behind us, weapons hot. The Klingon warship peeled off. Why didn't they finish us?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: They don't need to. Captain, we're being sucked into the binary stars' debris ring. The gravitational field is pulling us in.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Fire reverse thrusters.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: They're not responding, Captain!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Shields are still offline.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We are bracing for impact.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: All hands, this is the Captain. Prepare to evacuate.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Incoming transmission from the Europa.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Systems are getting back on line.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Thank you for the assist with that tractor beam, Admiral.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: What the hell happened, Philippa?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We hailed, they fired. The Shenzhou, Clarke, and Yeager are down on our side. We've sustained heavy casualties.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: From the looks of it, so have they. Maybe they're ready to come to the table. Open a channel to the Klingon flagship. Attention, Klingon leader. I am Admiral Brett Anderson.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I speak with the authority of the entire Federation when I propose a cease-fire so that we might resolve this conflict with no further bloodshed.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Do you wish to respond, my lord? (nod) Begin transmission.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Admiral, I am T'Kuvma. I am pleased you are here. We have been waiting for someone worthy of our attention. Your offer of a cease-fire is accepted.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Good. Because if we're fighting, we're not talking.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Prepare to receive my envoy.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We'll get ready for your arrival. (hologram off)

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Lest anyone doubt that I can render my own vessels invisible.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Let's end this so we can get (staggers) What was that? (hologram and tractor beam off)

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The Europa has disengaged.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: What's going on?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I can't explain it, Captain. There's an unknown energy source disrupting our scanners.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Get me visuals.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain, I'm detecting a voluntary antimatter containment breach on the Europa.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: They're going to self-destruct.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Shields only 47 percent.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We have suffered losses, but the Federation has suffered far more. Leaders, return to Qo'noS. Declare far and wide that the Klingon race fights as a united Empire once again.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Open your hearts to the one who delivered this great day. Follow the light. Follow T'Kuvma.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: T'Kuvma the Unforgettable!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: T'Kuvma the Unforgettable!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain, the Klingon vessels are warping out of the system.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: All but one.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The Klingon flagship is hailing. They're broadcasting on all open subspace bands.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Members of the Federation. What you call your most remote borders, I call too close to Klingon territory. You only live now to serve as witnesses of Klingon supremacy, to be my herald. We do not desire to know you, but you will know our great Houses, standing as one under Kahless, reborn in me, T'Kuvma!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Computer, implement steps of brig emergency evacuation protocol.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Denied. Ethical protocols state prisoner evacuation to occur in life-saving circumstances only.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: This is a life-saving circumstance. I'm going to die in here unless you let me out.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Speculation. Request to engage ethical protocols denied.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: How long before my cell's containment field fails?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Approximately eight minutes.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: At which point I will die. Confirm?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Confirmed.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Is the corridor outside the brig undamaged and still pressurised?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Affirmative.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Then getting from my cell, through the blast door, and into the corridor ensures my survival.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Negative. Exposure to the vacuum of space for over fifteen seconds would result in respiratory distress, shock and suffocation before you are able to reach blast door.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: But if you open a metre-sized hole in the containment field, the rapid depressurization will shoot me through to the blast door in less than six seconds.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Affirmative. But you will be unable to open the door in your inhibited physical state.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Then ethically you should open the door for me.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Working. Request confirmed. Ethical protocols engaged. Chance for survival estimated at 43 percent.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I'll take it.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Depressurisation commencing now.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: All warfare is based on deception. When you are able to attack, you must seem unable.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Sun Tzu. I recognise the quote. But I fear we are deceiving no one. We are most definitely unable to attack.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We have no weapons, no warp, no countermove at all. The Klingons have us.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The Federation ships are hiding, or scattered in pieces. They pose no threat.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Then the fight is won.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We have photon torpedoes. Now, we can't fire them, but we can load the warheads onto a transport, one small enough to evade their primary sensors. Upon impact, we can deliver a kill shot directly into their hull.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Devious, Saru. I approve.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: And our dead?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: They float untethered on the battlefield, soon to be lost.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Task everyone with retrieving them. I will prepare each of the slain for entombment with my own hands.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We'll use a worker bee to carry the torpedo. It's small enough to be mistaken for debris. Be ready in ten minutes.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I will also run an analysis to determine blast sites for optimum damage.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Make it hurt, Saru.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Oh, there is one problem, Captain. Our worker bees have no autopilot, and our transporter can't penetrate their shields.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: We won't need it. I'll be driving.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain, that's a suicide mission.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Your priority is getting impulse engines back online so that you can get the Shenzhou out of here before I detonate the warheads. T'Kuvma lured Starfleet to a massacre. It's time I repaid him.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain, you can't do that.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: T'Kuvma has anointed himself the next Klingon messiah. If you kill him, you make him a martyr. Someone they can fight for endlessly. That might even be what he wants. But if you capture him, you make him a symbol of defeat, of shame. And if you take him as a prisoner of war, well, you give the Federation leverage to sue for peace.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: How could you have done this?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I believed it was the only way to avoid a full-scale war.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: When you first came aboard seven years ago, I worried your Vulcan training might some day trump your humanity. Do you know why Sarek asked me to take you on? I was a human who had seen a life of loss but still chose hope. What an ego I had thinking I could pick away the shell the Vulcans put around you. I was so sure I could do it. Even convinced that you were ready for the Captain's chair. To think I knew you so little.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: You want to know how I turned on you? I believed saving you and the crew was more important than Starfleet's principles. Was it logical? Emotional? I don't know. Let me deliver the warheads in your place.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: They're gathering their dead.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Saru, forget the worker bee.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Captain?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Spool up the transporters now, and have Engineering meet us there with a torpedo warhead. I know how we take him.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: A warrior who dies in his sleep is no more than flesh and bone.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Tactical advises that they have coordinates on a slain Klingon officer.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: A warrior who perishes honourably in battle is blessed. A hero's demise brings pride for a life

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: given in defence of our race and comfort in the knowledge that new life awaits in Sto-Vo-Kor.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Join your vaunted comrades, brothers and sisters, for you are not alone, and stand watch among the Black Fleet forever.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Sensors confirm loss of environment.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: No weapons activity on the Klingon ship. They're drifting. Their shields are down. I'll beam you to an area with minimal Klingon lifesigns.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Let's go get our prisoner.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Energise.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: This is the aft section of the bridge. T'Kuvma must be close.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Burnham, I've lost the captain's life sign. Burnham? Burnham?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Get us out of here now.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I can't transport her without a lifesign.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: I'm not leaving without her body. More Klingons are coming.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Burnham, if she's deceased and you're in danger, I have no choice.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: No!

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Your life will be remembered forever by all Klingons. Your death will be a cause to unite us all.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Do you hear that?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: No, my lord.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The words we said as children in Kahless' honour. Whom do we seek?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Kahless.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: How do we find him?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Together.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Give us light to see.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Forever.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Will he hide from us always?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Never.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: To the charge of dereliction of duty, to the charge of assaulting a fellow officer, to the charge of mutiny. To all these charges, how do you plead?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: (sotto) Guilty.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: The accused cannot be heard.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Guilty on all counts.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: Is there anything you would like to say in your defence before a sentence is rendered?

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: From my youth on Vulcan, I was raised to believe that service was my purpose, and I carried that conviction to Starfleet. I dreamed of a day when I would command my own vessel and further the noble objectives of this great institution. That dream is over. The only ship I know in ruins, my crew gone. My captain, my friends, I wanted to protect them from war, from the enemy. And now we are at war, and I am the enemy.

Title: battle-at-the-binary-stars
Dialogue: It is our ruling that the defendant, Commander Michael Burnham, be stripped of rank and hereby sentenced to imprisonment for life.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You hear why we're getting transferred to Tellun? Dilithium pocket went piezoelectric. Ripped apart the bottom of the mine. Bam. Fifty cons vaporised. So, lucky us. We get to be miners for the war effort now.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I hear half the screws on Tellun are scumbag Andorians. Andorians are cold in all the wrong places.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The three I killed were cold everywhere. That kind of talk got your shiny little panties in a bunch, Starfleet? What are you in for, anyway? Staying out past curfew?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You don't know who that is? That's Michael Burnham.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The mutineer?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: In the flesh.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: My cousin was on the Europa when it went down. She and 8000 others are dead because of you.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Eight thousand, one hundred and eighty six.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Proximity alert. Scanning.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Starbase 18, we got some bugs in the works out here.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Great.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Hey, where you going?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Um, hey, what's going on? Shouldn't somebody be flying this thing?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: That's species GS54. An organism that feeds on electricity. It's feeding on the shuttle's power systems.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Bay doors open.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Unless the pilot can get rid of the infestation fast enough, they'll drain us of all of our power, and we'll drift until our oxygen runs out or we freeze to death. Whichever comes first.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Er, could you come back? Hello?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Relax. The pilot's taking care of it.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Warning. safety tether disconnected. Warning, autopilot malfunction.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: We're all gonna die.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Ensign Chiefowitz, report to the medical bay. Ensign Chiefowitz, report to the medical bay.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Not a scratch on the floor. This puppy just rolled off the assembly line.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What's a brand-new starship doing so far from the front lines?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: This is the USS Discovery. My name's Commander Landry. I'm Chief of Security here. I see we're unloading all kinds of garbage today. Even Starfleet's first mutineer. On me.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Lieutenant Collins, please report to the bridge. Lieutenant Collins, please report to the bridge.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Ensign Magnus, report to engineering.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What's with the silver shirts?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It's a science vessel.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You ever seen a blank badge before?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Somehow this doesn't feel very scientific.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Mouths shut, eyes ahead. All right, Starfleet says we have to feed the animals. Who's hungry?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: (sotto) I told you that was her.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Keyla.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: How about we make it 8,187?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Captain wants to see you. Come on. Put them in the brig.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Vulcan martial arts, huh?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Suus Mahna.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Vulcans should stick to logic.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No matter how deep in space you are, I always feel like you can see home, don't you think? Maybe it's just me. Forgive the lighting, or lack thereof. Recent battle injury. There's nothing they can do if I want to keep my own eyes, and I do. I have to suffer light change slowly. I like to think it makes me mysterious. No? Captain Gabriel Lorca. Welcome to Discovery. Here, don't be shy.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It was a family business, a century ago. That was before the future came, and hunger, need and want disappeared. Of course, they're making a comeback now, thanks to you. Michael Burnham. The Michael Burnham, on my ship. When I saw your name on the shuttle manifest, I re-read your file. Pulled up your court-martial transcripts and... you're something.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Captain, what am I doing on this ship?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I guess you might have to ask that storm out there.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I received no warning that I'd be transferred to another prison facility, which is customary. Then my shuttle changed course halfway through the journey.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Maybe the universe hates waste.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sir? Question is, what am I gonna do with you? If I put you in the brig someone's gonna die, and I don't have the time for that kind of distraction. You have training in high-level quantum physics, don't you? My engineers tell me it's gonna take three days to clear the lightning bugs out of the prisoner shuttle. I have something on deck that requires every trained mind available. You're gonna help us out.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No, thank you. Respectfully, I owe a debt for my crime and it'd be best... I'd prefer to serve my time without getting involved.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Huh. You think I care what your preferences are? Until your vessel's repaired, you'll be assigned to quarters and put to work. I'm not a chauffeur. There's no free rides on my ship. You were once a Starfleet officer. I will use you or anything else I can to achieve my mission.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: And what mission is that, sir?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: To win the war, of course. To send everyone home, safe and happy. Dismissed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You're on day shift. Escort at 0800 hours. When you're not working, you're confined to quarters.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Working on what?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Lights. This is so neat. They er, they told me, because of my special needs, that I couldn't have a roommate, which was kind of a letdown, because a roommate is like an automatic built-in friend, and then they told me I was gonna have a roommate, and so now I guess that's you, and er... Hi, I'm I'm Cadet Sylvia Tilly. I talk when I'm nervous. My instructors advised me to work on that.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Why are you nervous?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm trying to decide if I should tell you that you took my bed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Seriously?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I know, they look the same, but, er, I'm allergic to polyester, and viscoelastic polyurethane foam. It results in chronic snoring. This is why I wasn't supposed to have a roommate.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: (crosses to the other bed) No problem.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What's your name?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Michael.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I never met a female named Michael before. Do you think that suits you? I'll call you Mickey. I think that's more approachable.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No, you won't.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: (sotto) Oh yeah, no I won't. (normal) The only other female Michael I ever heard of was Michael Burnham, the mutineer. You're not her, are you? Are you?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Black alert. Black alert.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What's going on?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You weren't briefed?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, then I can't tell you. I'm sorry.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Tilly, what the hell is going on on this ship?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Matter synthesis complete.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Attention, all personnel. Battle drills on Deck 9 have been cancelled until further notice.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Saru.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: First Officer Saru. With me, please.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You're famous. They all want a peek.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Congratulations on your promotion.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: (eating) Mmm. Thank you. The powers that be were impressed by my actions at the Battle of the Binary Stars, but upon my own reflection of that day, my only wish is that I could've done more.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I understand.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Blueberries. (she takes one)

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The ones in prison don't taste the same. I suppose that is a function of the environment your eating them in instead of a food synthesiser issue.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I suppose so. So many people with so many places to go.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: On Discovery, our facilities can accommodate 300 discreet scientific missions. A Starfleet record.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: So, this is a science vessel.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Er. Oh, you've been assigned to Engineering. Lieutenant Stamets will task you with specific duties.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Saru. First Officer Saru. I saw a recording of the speech you gave at the Captain's funeral. It was beautiful. I never thought I'd get a chance to say this to you. I think about what happened every day. All the time. And I owe you. I'm trying to say...

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm sorry?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I believe you feel regret. But in my mind you are dangerous. Captain Lorca is a man who does not fear the things normal people fear. But I do. And you are someone to fear, Michael Burnham.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I just wanna get back on that shuttle, Commander. I won't make any trouble for you here.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, that is certain. But if you try, know that I intend to do a better job protecting my Captain than you did yours.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm looking for Lieutenant Stamets.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: He's in there.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Add it to the list.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: That area's off-limits. No entry without a breath print.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Starfleet doesn't keep its engineering labs classified.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: This is Discovery. I recommend you find a station.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sorry, these stations... Er, we have assigned seats.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Who are you?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm Michael Burnham. I was assigned.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Who gave you an assignment? I'm the only one who gives assignments around here. (brushes something off his shoulder) So you're the one Lorca sent?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The mutineer?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I was told to expect a Vulcan.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: There may be a misunderstanding.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: On my part?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Yes. No.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You're making this very complicated.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I was raised on Vulcan, and I attended the Vulcan Science Academy.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: My Uncle Everett plays in a Beatles cover band. It hardly makes him John Lennon.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm not sure I'm following.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, if Lorca thinks you are such an asset, reconcile these two suites of code. Go somewhere else, please. It's not like we have assigned seats.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Character: (Burnham returns to the station next to Tilly and starts work. She's still there at 22

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What was Discovery's interval?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Last night? Speirein 12.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Why so conservative? Is Lorca holding you back?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No, he's always pushing us for more. I'm sure that our rate of progress is his life's biggest disappointment. By the way, 12 is a perfectly robust number, Straal. Where's the Glenn?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Speirein 240.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I hate you. How?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: A recent breakthrough.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I hate you. How?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: All I can say is there are unexpected benefits to not growing your own. Right now, we have to finish getting ready. Tonight we're going for Speirein 900.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: That's not possible.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Don't be like that. You're one of my oldest friends. We've been working on this for 12 years. When we succeed, both our names are going on the Zee-Magnees Prize.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm not jealous, oddly. I'm worried. That displacement is too massive. It's not safe.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It is now. I worked out the kinks. Lurker.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I despise lurkers.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm struggling with these equations. Initially thought I was dealing with quantum astrophysics. But as I got deeper in, biochemistry came into play. Maybe even a form of gene expression. It'd be helpful to know what I'm working on.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Why would I tell a prisoner of the Federation, who is essentially a temp, the details of my top secret research?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It's your call. But either way, this line here? It's a mistake.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You can go, lurker.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Submit breath scan for entry. Lieutenant Paul Stamets.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Submit breath scan for entry.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Cadet Sylvia Tilly.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Incoming transmission. Designee Lorca, Gabriel. Classified Above Top Secret.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: During the last hour, while performing black alert manoeuvres, there was an incident on our sister ship, the USS Glenn. The entire crew was lost.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What happened? Was it a bloom failure?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: We're sending a boarding party to find out. Lieutenant Stamets, you'll accompany Commander Landry and ensure that everything related to the project returns to this ship.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Why not just transport what we need from the Glenn over to us?
