Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The room holding the equipment is shielded.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Shielded? That's curious.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Indeed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Let's not indulge that curiosity. It went down by Klingon territory. Let's get in and get out.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Really? We're running drills near Klingon space.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: We are at war, Lieutenant. I'd appreciate a day without me having to remind you of that.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, Captain, I will need to take a team with me. You know, for the cumbersome, annoying science part.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Pick a team. Do it quickly. And take Burnham with you.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sir, it's one thing to make her a data cruncher in my lab, but to integrate her into this project at such a deep level...

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I understand that you lost a friend today, but this is not a democracy. You understand?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Number One, you sailed with Burnham aboard the Shenzhou. What is your assessment of her abilities?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Her mutiny aside, she is the smartest Starfleet officer I have ever known.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Huh. And he knows you.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I can't believe he picked me. I mean, I'm the best theoretical engineer on the ship, it's why I was fast-tracked at the Academy, but this is my very first boarding party. Kind of hard to believe, right?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Not really.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: So, er, I need to apologise to you. Yesterday I didn't want you to take the station next to me because, er it's really important that I make a good impression here, and I was afraid that if I was seen with you, that would get in the way of it.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I understand. It's okay.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: No, it's not okay. It's... I have this character flaw. I care too much about what other people think about me. But you don't care if, like, everybody hates you. No, that came out wrong. Er, I... I think that you could help me.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You're a nice kid, Tilly, but I'm not staying long enough to make friends.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: We're dropping out of warp. Approaching the Glenn.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Disco 1, confirm visual acquisition.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You see the etchings on the hull? That's evidence of catastrophic basidiosac rupture.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Basidiosac? That's an unfamiliar term.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You're out of your depth here, non-Vulcan number cruncher. Seen and not heard, please.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Basidia refers to spore-producing structures. The numbers I've been analysing have been consistent with organic structures. You mentioned the term bloom. That typically refers to biologicals.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Are you trying to show everyone how smart you are?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm trying to get up to speed, so that I can help with this mission. In what is our problem based, biology or physics?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Are you really so naive as to see them as different?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sir?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: At the quantum level, there is no difference between biology and physics. No difference at all. And you talk about spores. What are they? They are the progenitors of panspermia. They are the building blocks of energy across the universe. Physics and biology? No. Physics as biology.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: All right.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I became an astromycologist because of awe. Awe at the miracle of life. I met Straal, and we formed a partnership. We would get to the veins and muscles that hold our galaxies together. We would find truth. And we were happy in our lab, then your war started, and Starfleet co-opted our research. They split us up, put us in charge of different teams, so we could work twice as fast. Not for truth, or to further Starfleet's mission statement of diplomacy and exploration, but for war. And now my friend and his colleagues are dead because of our research. And I have to live with that, but if you think I'm okay handing my life's work over to that warmonger Lorca, you're wrong.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets, I sincerely have no idea what research you're involved in.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Long-range sensors are clear. You are authorised

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I never even intended to be here.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Disco 1, adjust course

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, if Lorca wants you to be here, I'm afraid your intentions are less than moot.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Activating shuttle bay containment-field override.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Pilot, stay with the ship.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Affirmative.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Kowski, let's move out.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: All the power relays and redundancies must be shot. Is that normal?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Nothing's normal after an accident like this.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I never anticipated injuries like this. Cadet, scan to determine if the helical trauma to the body is related to the spiral markings on the ship's hull.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: There's correlation.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Engineering is this way.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Look.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Klingons.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Could this mean that they know about the device?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: If they do, it's all over.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Why aren't their bodies braided up?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Because they didn't die in the initial accident. They probably boarded after spying a crippled Federation ship with no lifesigns. They beamed on to steal our tech.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What the hell could do this to a dozen fully armed Klingons?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Over here. This hull is double-reinforced. What could tear through this metal?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You in the shadows, show yourself.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Shh.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Is he shushing you?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Run.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: To Engineering!

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Set phasers to kill!

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: In here.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Kowski, no!

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What was that thing?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Burnham, download the ship's logs. Tilly, pull all telemetry and check the spore-containment status.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Oh, God. I'm sorry, my friend.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Log data's corrupted.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sir, there's some kind of navigational hack over here.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Get what you're getting, please.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: This is coming with us. Help me get it off.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Jammed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Nah.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: There's some kind of device in the reaction cube.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, we'll take it with us. Can we go now, please?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Not gonna burn through this in time.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: One Federation ship is pretty much like another, I hope. I need a phaser.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Mutineers don't get phasers.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It won't kill it.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm not trying to kill it, I'm trying to piss it off.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Hey.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Shit, that worked.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: We're through. Move, move, move.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The rabbit-hole went straight on like a tunnel for some way, then dipped suddenly down, so suddenly that Alice had not a moment to think about stopping herself, but instead found herself falling down a very deep well.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Burnham, we're in the shuttle. What is your location?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Jefferies tube. Elevate the shuttle 200 feet, rear quarter, above the shield replacement units. Open the top hatch. (turns into a smaller tube) She was now only ten inches high. Her face and body brightened up. She was now the right size to go through the little door into that lovely garden.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Go!

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Permission to enter the bridge, Commander Saru. The Captain requested my presence.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Permission granted. Commander Airiam, you have the conn. The other prisoners are being transferred to the shuttle now. It's scheduled to leave within the hour.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'll be on it, sir.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It has not gone unnoticed that during your time on this ship you conducted yourself in a respectable manner. And from what I understand, you were invaluable to the boarding party, which I was pleased to hear, since I was the one who recommended your involvement.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I appreciate your faith in me.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You were always a good officer, until you weren't. If only you hadn't... You are a valuable asset. It is a loss for Starfleet.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Thank you.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Well, there she is.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Captain.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Michael Burnham, I would like to extend an official invitation to you to join the Discovery and be a member of our crew.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sir, I've been court-martialed and convicted...

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Don't worry about Starfleet. They gave me discretion to fight this war however I saw fit.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm afraid I can't take you up on your offer.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Are you hell-bent on self-persecution?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: That's not it. Not all of it, anyway.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Why wouldn't you stay?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Let me answer your question with a question. Why do you want me to stay? I'm not here by accident. I think you brought me here. I think you've been testing me.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: And why would I do that?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: You're developing some kind of experimental technology. Some kind of spore-based biological weapon.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Oh.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The kind of weapon that is explicitly forbidden by the Geneva Protocols of 1928 and 2155. And you need someone to help you. Enter, me. A mutineer who intended to wage unsanctioned war on the Klingons. A trained officer who's been banished from Starfleet. And someone who would presumably do anything to get out of their life sentence in prison, including illicit weapons tests, like whatever went wrong on the Glenn.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Enter, you indeed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm not who you think I am. Before I was a mutineer, I was a First Officer in Starfleet. I'll never bear that rank or any other again. But it is who I am, and who I will always be. It is by the principles of the United Federation of Planets that I live. And by them I will most certainly die.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I know who you are, Michael Burnham. I know exactly who you are. I know you love being right. But I suspect that you hate being wrong even more, so, let me stop you going down a path you'll regret. Computer, two for site-to-site transport. Captain's Ready Room to Engineering Test Bay Alpha.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Confirmed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Energise.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: If you'll be so kind.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Mycelium spores. Harmless. Harvested from the fungal species prototaxites stellaviatori, which we grow in our cultivation bay. But you know that, because you broke in.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: We're not creating a new way to kill. We are creating a new way to fly. An organic propulsion system. The Glenn was travelling on these when disaster struck. You yourself have jumped across a mycelial network. Nothing bad happened, just ship's walls got a little damp, that's all.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Discovery's leaps have measured only in the hundreds of kilometres. A sad statistic which is the source of some tension between myself and Lieutenant Stamets. But our more advanced sister ship, before she crashed, was travelling back and forth from the Beta Quadrant, 90 light years away, in 1.3 seconds.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: How do you travel on spores?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Imagine a microscopic web that spans the entire cosmos. An intergalactic ecosystem. An infinite number of roads, leading everywhere.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: The veins and muscles that hold our galaxies together.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Now, if the Discovery can be anywhere, and gone in an instant, that's how you beat the Klingons. That's how you win the war. And we must win the war. But that's just the beginning. Imagine the possibilities. Wanna see where they're going? Where they've been? Or where they could take us? Hold tight.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Blink, you're in Ilari. Blink, the moons of Andoria. Blink, you missed Romulus. All those planets, all those places, all those species, seen and yet to be seen. And you're home like it never happened.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I did choose you. But not for the reasons you think. Your assumption that the Klingons were waiting in ambush at the Binary Stars was predictive. You chose to do the right thing, over and above what was sanctioned, even at great cost to yourself. And that is the kind of thinking that wins wars. The kind of thinking I need next to me. Universal law is for lackeys. Context is for kings. Now, what's it to be, Michael? What's in your future? What do you wish for? Atonement? Redemption? Maybe the assurance that the Captain you lost didn't die in vain? You helped start a war. Don't you wanna help me end it?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Shuttle for prison colony cleared for warp.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I thought you were on a prison shuttle.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm still here. Hope you don't mind.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: I'm glad. Here's a thing most people don't know about me. I'm gonna be a Captain someday. The thing is that there are still some things I need to learn. And I know that you were one of the most highly regarded first officers in Starfleet. And I have read everything there is on Georgiou.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Captain. Captain Georgiou.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Of course, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to...

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It's okay.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Wow, is that a book?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: When I was a kid, after my parents were killed, my foster mother on Vulcan used to read it to me and her son. She and I were the only humans in the house. That's how I learned that the real world doesn't always adhere to logic. Sometimes down is up. Sometimes up is down. Sometimes, when you're lost, you're found.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: What was her name?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Amanda.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: And the USS Glenn is no more.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Sad to see a ship like that go.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: It's just a ship. So, is our new guest settled in?

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Aye, sir. Snug as a bug in a rug.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Then I think we will spend some time together this evening. Thank you for beaming it aboard.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Anything, anytime, Captain.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Dismissed.

Title: context-is-for-kings
Dialogue: Here, kitty, kitty.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Burnham, Michael. Temporary assignment to science division, USS Discovery. Rank, none. Uniform synthesis is complete.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Computer, cancel mirror.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You look smart. It's a lot less scary than your convict suit. Like a clean slate, right?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It's not quite as easy as that.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Oh, this was sent for you. You were in the shower when the, er, ping went off and I... I was fully clothed so, I thought, well, I'll save you a trip to the depot.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Tilly.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Yes. Less. Less extraneous words. It's not gonna shut up till you open it.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Burnham, Michael. Do you accept the last will and testament of Captain Philippa Georgiou?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I didn't know.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Michael Burnham to the bridge.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I'll see you in Engineering.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Bridge. Direct.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: As first officer, I take pride in knowing every name and assignment on the crew manifest. You were to be on the prison transport shuttle that left yesterday.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Captain Lorca offered me an opportunity. I can tell by your threat ganglia that you weren't consulted.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The captain keeps his own counsel. Had he inquired, I'd have suggested the duty roster lacked any opening for a mutineer.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: A valuable asset. That's what you called me.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I was speaking hypothetically. Politely. And as someone who was certain I would never see you again.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You can tell your threat ganglia to relax. I'm only here to help.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: My ganglia remain unconvinced.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Scanners. Expedite my targeting sweep. Multi-spectrum, laterals included.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Aye, sir. Scanners confirm two Klingon Birds-of-Prey.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Targets heading away at offset vectors.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Charge main phasers to full and take 'em out before they know we're here.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Charging. Vectors received.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We've been located and are being scanned.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Keep the warp engines topped hot. Landry, we're waiting.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Solution calculated. Firing main phasers. First target destroyed. Second Bird-of-Prey still in.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I see it! Take it out!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: They're firing torpedoes.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Shields to max.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Diverting power.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Commander.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We're all dead. (sarcastic applause) Very nice. Very polite. The Discovery is now the only Starfleet ship with a displacement-activated spore hub drive. Which means, when it's up and running, we will be able to materialise anywhere in the known universe. Behind enemy lines, above the Klingon homeworld. Anywhere. But we will be alone. We will not have backup. There's just us. And we get one chance to get it right.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We'll do better next time, sir.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It would be hard to do worse. Mister Saru, run the simulation again. And again. Burnham, with me.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You heard the captain. Computer, reload simulation.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Working.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We're the tip of the spear in a science vessel filled with wide-eyed explorers. You know what they need us to do, don't you?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: They need us to win.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: They need us to survive, Burnham. Wanna know how you're gonna help me do that?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I'm happy to assist Lieutenant Stamets with the refinement of the spore drive.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Said the xenoanthropologist.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I also studied quantum mechanics at the Vulcan Science Academy, sir.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I know. But I'm gonna put you to better use.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: These are some of the deadliest weapons in the galaxy.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I study war. And this is where I hone my craft. I try to learn from the best. Here. Now this I think you'll find uniquely interesting. You've met once before.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It has a natural aversion to light, same as me.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Why would you keep something so dangerous onboard your own ship?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: That thing killed a dozen Klingons on the Glenn, and there's not a scratch on it from their bat'leths. If we're gonna win this thing, if we're gonna have a chance of saving the Federation and everyone in it, we need the best weapons available. So what material is in a claw that can shred the hull of a ship? What's a hide made of that can withstand the firepower of a phaser set to kill? I need you to find out. And weaponise it.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: T'Kuvma my lord, it has been six months since your ship was disabled and the war began. We are left behind in disrepair. Your followers are hungry. Help me guide them to nourishment.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You are an artist now?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: This is the orbit of every object we have scavenged through in the debris field. There are no Birds of Prey that we require to restart our engines.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: There is one ship.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We will not have this discussion again.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The Shenzhou is within range. It may have been abandoned, but it still has an intact dilithium processing unit.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: This is the very ship that felled T'Kuvma. To fuse its technology with our own would be blasphemy.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You had no such outrage when we ate its Captain. I saw your smile when you picked the meat from her smooth skull.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: As T'Kuvma perished in my arms, I swore to keep his fire lit. To resist assimilation, to lead his followers. But now they die slowly of hunger on this ghost ship. His legacy dies with them. I cannot allow it.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: What good is purity if it only leads to death? My father was T'Kuvma's blood kin, but my mother was House Mokai, the watcher clan, the deceivers, the weavers of lies. When I was a child, she gave me a bat'leth and told me to cleave my own heart. To choose one House over the other. Instead, I built a bridge to serve both. Now it is your turn to build, to go into that graveyard and bring back the Shenzhou's processing unit for the good of your people. You must go to that ship.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Scans indicate a diet likely based on foraging for vegetation or other passive means of obtaining nutrition.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Lorca thought you and I would make a good team. Your science, my tactics. Together we can deal with Lorca's little monster.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: How do you know it's a monster, Commander?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Because I've seen what it's capable of. So have you. Let's call it Ripper. That's what it looks like. That's what it does.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Your Ripper appears to share some natural traits with the Tardigrade species, a docile creature that lives in the waters of the Earth. A micro-animal capable of surviving e xtreme heat and subfreezing temperatures.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Did you say microscopic?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: In our case, somehow, macroscopic.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Huh. How did it get on the Glenn?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: All the recent logs were corrupted, but the Glenn's captain made an earlier entry that security detected a stowaway. There was no hull breach, and no unregistered microbiota in the transporter's pattern buffer, but this was found rummaging around in the lower cargo decks.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We need to find something Lorca can use on this thing. Poison sacs, pain inducers, rage glands.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You judge the creature by its appearance, and by one single incident from its past. Nothing in its biology suggests it would attack, except in self-defence. Commander, this creature is an unknown alien. It can only be what it is and not what you want it to be.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It's amazing how much I hate Vulcan proverbs. You're new here, so let me share a piece of wisdom. Lorca isn't interested in what you are. He's interested in what you can do for him. And if he needs us to make that thing useful in his war effort, that's what we're gonna do.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Admiral Cornwell.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I didn't realize you were eating, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Excuse the breach of protocol.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We just received a distress signal from the planetoid Corvan 2, a mining colony

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Near the Aneto system. I know it.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Sending it through now.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Find cover!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I can't find Andy!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Corvan 2 generates 40 percent of the Federation's dilithium.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: If the pipeline's cut off, that's half the fleet grounded.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The Klingons ambushed the blockade that was protecting the colony, and now the closest Federation ship is 84 hours away. Yours is the only ship in the fleet with a chance of getting there on time. Is the Discovery ready to jump?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I told you we'd be ready when you called, and we are. Discovery's made dozens of small jumps with no issues. We can make it the full distance.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You have no doubts?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: None.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: There's no way we'll be ready to jump that far.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You told me you knew why the Glenn failed.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The Glenn crashed into an undetectable Hawking radiation firewall when it exited from a mycelial plane. As a result, all the biologicals onboard spun out.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You can prevent that from happening again, right?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: So what's the problem?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Captain, as I've explained to you, every time we try a long jump, we lose navigational stability. Remember? Jumping is probabilistic. The longer the jump, the more possible outcomes.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I get it. It's trial and error. Let's try something.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We lack the processing power to make the requisite number of calculations to hold a course.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: So what were they doing that we're not?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We took this tech from Straal's lab on the Glenn. It was an augmentation to their navigation system. I've incorporated it into our drive unit. But it won't load completely. To function optimally, it would appear to require some kind of supercomputer.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You must have missed that on the Glenn.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Sir, being chased by a lethal monster in a death trap surrounded by Klingon bodies is distracting, but, no, I would've noticed an extra supercomputer. That's just me.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: What's that thing? That thing is what we took off the Glenn. It interacts with the spore drive somehow, but I think it's missing a part or something. I can't get it to activate.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Ahem. In exactly five hours, 49 minutes and 46 seconds, the Klingons will take Corvan 2.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Captain, this can't be rushed.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Now you listen to me, Mister Stamets. They need us. Now.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: There are some things I could try to extend the jump range.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Get it done.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You're welcome.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Kol. What is the reason for your welcome visit?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The last time I was here, on the eve of the war, I hurled disrespect. Now I come with humility.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: T'Kuvma teaches that in a united Klingon Empire, no one kneels but our foe.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: (stands) Wise words. But words don't win wars. Your House's ship has what no one else has. Cloaking technology that can crush Starfleet. We need you back in the fight.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We have scavenged the dead vessels floating around us in the graveyard left by our battle with Starfleet. Six months since that fight, we are almost operational again. But we still lack a dilithium processor. We are almost out of food too. But as T'Kuvma taught us, what belongs to House T'Kuvma belongs to House Kor.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: May the words of your messiah, our messiah, also sustain us. Remain Klingon!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Remain Klingon. tlhIngan maH. taHjaj!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Captain, be advised, the spore drive is online and primed.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Primed? Can you control where we're going or not?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It's possible, maybe even likely, but

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Done. Open shipwide communication.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Attention all personnel. Stealth protocol. Run silent. Black alert.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Black alert. Black alert.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: All crew to battle stations. We need to be ready for whatever's on the other side of that jump.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Disengage shields.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Shields are offline. standing by.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Loading spores into the drive.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Drive?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Excess energy cavitation initiated.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Tactical. Reroute all available power from impulse over to phasers.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Weps are double hot.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Engineering?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Spore drive is online. Plot destination for Corvan 2.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: At your pleasure, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Go.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Sensors indicate external temperature of... They went offline. It's too hot.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: That is not Corvan 2.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: No, sir, it is not.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Stuck in a gravity well of an O-type star. Collision is imminent.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Collision is not an option. Shields up. Full reverse. Wrong off-ramp, Lieutenant Stamets.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: My nav buffer overloaded. I couldn't hold the plotting. (a judder makes him bump his head against the console) Ow!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Rear thrusters engaging.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We are clear of the gravitational well.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Re-engage warp drive. Get us the hell out of Dodge, Mister Saru.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Aye-aye, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: This had better be good. Lorca's on the warpath.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Look. The moment the spore drive came online, the creature's central nervous system showed micro-patterns of activity in the frontopolar cortex.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You said it hates light. Maybe it didn't wanna crash into the sun.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It reacted before we jumped. I saw it cry out in distress. It's more likely a connection to the spore drive itself.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I don't see how that's relevant to Ripper's aggression.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It may not be, but it helps us understand its motives and behaviour.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Understanding how it feels was not our mission. The Captain needs to know how it fights and kills. Lorca told me to keep you on track. That your curiosity might lead you astray. We're not letting him down.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Hold still or you'll wind up looking like a Tellarite.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: How's the patient, Doctor Culber?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Well, I took care of the skull fractures first. Another millimetre, and the palatine bone would've pierced his cortex.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The frontal lobe is overrated. It only contains memory and emotional expression. It's completely unnecessary.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Well, I'll save it. You know, just in case you might wanna have a feeling one day.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Gentlemen. Every starship in the galaxy, Klingon or Federation, runs on dilithium crystals. If we can't protect Corvan, the war is lost. So, can you fix the Lieutenant's inability to get our ship to go where it's supposed to go?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I warned you, Captain. Time is an essential component of good science.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Discovery is no longer a science vessel. It's a warship.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: That is not the mission I signed on for. I'm not a soldier.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Well then, get off. Leave the ship.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: If I go, I'm taking everything with me. My spores, my drive. This entire ship was designed around my scientific specialty.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Everything on this ship is the property of Starfleet, Lieutenant. How do you want to be remembered in history? Alongside the Wright Brothers, Elon Musk, Zefram Cochrane? Or as a failed fungus expert, a selfish little man who put the survival of his own ego before the lives of others.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Are you done?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Well, you have some blood on your face.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: And your hands, Lieutenant. Get back to work. Fix the problem.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Er, computer, open a shipwide hail.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Working. Confirmed. Broadcasting shipwide.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Computer, play the audio transmissions from Corvan 2.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: This is my last message. Another round of bombs just struck. Zaphod is dead. Our bunker is collapsing.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Mommy, Mommy, wake up. Wake up.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Please, save my children. Anyone. Help them.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We've lost mine 4 and mine 7. Two hundred and ten souls, all gone. Particulate venting is offline. My team can't breathe. I don't know if anyone is listening to this, but if you are, goodbye.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We're doing this. Computer, release a localised oneirogenic penthrane mist into the containment pen.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Wait, wait. Why are you sedating it?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I'm gonna lop off its claw so you can figure out what makes this thing so good at killing Klingons.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I do not think that's a good idea. We have no idea what effect sedation may have on it. And we've seen how it responds to aggression.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Sedation protocol complete.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Computer, open containment pen.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Computer, lights to maximum.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Computer, seal containment pen. Emergency transport. Sickbay.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Find a use for that creature. Don't let her death be in vain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Atmosphere pressurisation complete.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Crew manifest accessed.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: L'Rell, there is nothing worth taking on this deck or in the Captain's Ready room.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I have located the dilithium processor. The coupling unit is covered in crystal residue. Unplugging the processor could cause an explosion. One sudden move and we join the Black Fleet.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I will free it. L'Rell, we do not always view things the same way, but I have come to know you as one who is astute. More astute than I.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Thank you, my lord.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Why do you call me that?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: T'Kuvma made you his successor.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Surely you doubted his choice. T'Kuvma barely knew me, while you served at his side for years.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: T'Kuvma saw something in you. A purity of devotion. I do not want the mantle of leadership. Standing behind you I am free to move, able to be your enforcer, defender, campaigner.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I am fortunate to have you.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Shall we uncouple?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Thank T'Kuvma. With this, our ship will fly.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Door.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I received your message. What is it you so urgently need my help with?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I've been thinking about the way I treated you on the Shenzhou. At times I was very unfair.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You often undermined me, dismissed my opinions out of hand.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You wouldn't be wrong to call me out for being selfish. But I can't help notice that your threat ganglia are quiet now. Fascinating.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You're trying to gauge my response to that thing in the pen, aren't you?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Commander Landry was about to attack the creature, and I believe her death was an act of self-defence on its part. And now, based on your lack of threat response, I'm ready to submit that the creature's primary drive is not aggressive. It's not a predator.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You have not changed an iota, Burnham. Your contrite words were insincere.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: They were necessary.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I was wrong to question your place on the crew. You will fit in perfectly with Captain Lorca.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Why were you on the Glenn? What were you looking for?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Spores are the thing the Discovery and Glenn had in common.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Stamets would kill me if he knew I was bringing these.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You should probably go. I appreciate you taking the risk, but this could be dangerous.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Unless we get the drive online, we're not gonna make it to Corvan 2. All those people are gonna die, and I can't help them. I can help you.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Stay back. Keep still. (to the Tardigrade) I brought you something I think you might like. If you don't, well, they can blame whatever happens on my curiosity. Computer, open containment pen.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Hello.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: These are Tilly's tricorder images from our mission on the Glenn. Look. The doors to the Engineering room were blown outward. The shatter pattern of the reaction cube, the destruction, like something inside was going crazy. A very big something. Then there's excess shielding surrounding the room. It's as if the crew was trying to keep something in.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: What's your hypothesis? That Straal was holding that thing in his lab?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Captain's log said they found the creature in their lower decks. I remember you chided Straal about not growing his own like you do. You were talking about mushrooms. They didn't have a forest on the Glenn like Discovery has. If they stored their mushrooms dry, it would have to be in tremendous quantities in their lower stores, right there, where the creature first appeared.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It entered the ship in pursuit of the mushrooms.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Their spores, actually. This ship's spore drive travels on a network of mycelium that's spread across the entire galaxy. We just can't control where we go. But maybe the Tardigrade can. Straal said he found a way to solve the navigation problem. You said his modifications needed a supercomputer, right? What if its name is Ripper?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The phaser will only piss him off.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Think of it as a placebo for my scepticism. Energise.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: My God, you're right. Look how it interacts with the spores. It's as if they're communicating.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: My tricorder is detecting energy transfer. Some form of symbiosis. It is talking to them.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: That hardly seems fair. I always wanted to converse with my mushrooms.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Not just converse. Maybe even tell them where to go. If we can figure out how to interact with that tech from the Glenn, we may be looking at our new navigator.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: What is this?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Provisions. From my ship. I provided some, and your crew fell in line behind me. The price of loyalty is low for those who are starving. You've failed. You are as useless as you are ugly, son of none.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: T'Kuvma anointed me. I am the Torchbearer.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: And for that privilege, you allowed a human to extinguish his light.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The star of Kahless was lit by T'Kuvma. The great Houses are now together as one.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Only until we defeat the Federation, then we will divide again. But your strange ship, her crew and cloaking technology, will now serve me.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I would sooner die.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It is yours, my lord.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Kill him.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I know a more fitting fate. Dump him in the grave of our enemy.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Let's try this again. Corvan 2. Black alert.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Mister Stamets, are you ready?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Stand by, Captain. Energise. We just transported the Tardigrade into the reaction cube. The tech from the Glenn is activating.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: This is every charted star system. The Tardigrade is holding all these coordinates in its head. Course is set for Corvan 2. We're ready to jump, sir.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Is anybody not ready? Go.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Take cover!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: It's okay.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Targets one and two destroyed.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Full stop.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Captain?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Initiating full stop, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Multiple Klingon vessels converging.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Diverting nonessential power to shields.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: The Birds are at 1,000 kilometres and closing.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Their phasers are locked, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Hold tight, everybody. Steady.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Shields holding at eighty percent. Seventy five. Sixty five.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Engineering?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Spore drive is primed, Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: On my order.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Birds of Prey closing in at 500 kilometres.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Shields at 30 percent.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Coordinates input.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Twenty. Captain.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets advises that the ship is ready to jump.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I need them closer. Wait. Let's send our Klingon friends a message they won't forget. And... go.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Who saved us?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Commander Michael Burnham. Vulcan Science Academy commencement, 2249. Recipient, Vulcan Science

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: T'Kumva my lord, they left me here to die in the nest of the vermin who took your life. My faith tells me this is not the end.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: My faith tells me this is not the end!

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Voq.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You renounced me.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: TO save your life. It won't be long before Kol realises I'm gone.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: We need to go after them, make House T'Kuvma whole again.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: They belong to Kol. Now we must strategise on a grander scale. In order to convince the twenty four Houses to follow T'Kuvma's teachings, you must win this war. Prove to all you are the one true Torchbearer.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: You speak as if you have a way.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I do. I've stolen a raider and will take you to the home of the Mokai. I will leave you with the matriarchs who will expose you to things you never knew possible. But it comes at a cost.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: What must I sacrifice?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Everything.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Computer, open containment pen. Hey, you feeling better? I brought you the good stuff. I'm sorry.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Hi. Long night, huh? Everybody's talking about what you did. You helped save many on that colony. Seems like you're gonna have another reputation to get used to. It's probably none of my business, but my mother used to say, er... That's not true. My mother never really said anything to me unless she was criticising my hair. But you... I don't know, I just think if it made its way across the galaxy to find you, you should open it. And you shouldn't be afraid to open it, because I watched you tame the most incredible creature, and, well you're not afraid of anything. That's none of my business, right?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Identity confirmed. Burnham, Michael. Do you accept the last will and testament of Captain Philippa Georgiou?

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: I accept.

Title: the-butchers-knife-cares-not-for-the-lambs-cry
Dialogue: Hello, Michael. I hope that wherever this finds you, you are well. I imagine you have your own command now. The Captain of your own ship. I have always tried to show you by example. The best way to know yourself is to know others. You are curious, an explorer, so I am leaving you my most beloved possession, handed down through my family for centuries. My hope is that you will use it to continue to investigate the mysteries of the universe, both inside and out, and keep your eyes and heart open always. Goodbye, Michael, and good luck. Know that I am as proud of you as if you were my own daughter. Take good care. But more importantly, take good care of those in your care.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Doctor Culber, I've been studying the creature since it came on board. It's incredibly regenerative, but with each jump Discovery makes, it cries out. And the last 48 hours, it seems sluggish, depressed.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We don't know if it experiences stress or pain like we do.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You think I'm anthropomorphising.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You discovered how to use the Tardigrade for navigation. A victory that maybe isn't a victory anymore, given the creature's deteriorating condition. Let me run some tests.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Thank you.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: In less than three weeks, the Discovery has prevented the destruction of the dilithium mines at Corvan 2, broken the Klingon supply line at Benzar, and routed an attack through the Ophiucus system.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: The reason you've been brought here today is it has become increasingly imperative that we duplicate Discovery's spore-drive technology, and get it into as many Starfleet vessels as possible.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: To that end, I ordered Lieutenant Stamets to release the schematics of our propulsion system immediately after our first successful jump.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Our new classified facility in Jefferson, Iowa received them and is building units according to those specs. We need more Tardigrades to ensure safe, accurate navigation. Every ship, every starbase, every colony is on the hunt for these creatures. In the meantime, we want Discovery to dial back on its missions.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: No, hold on a second.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: There is concern at the highest levels of leadership about taxing our prime asset.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Discovery should be out there, winning battles.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We believe the enemy may have identified Discovery as our secret weapon. You are hereby ordered to rein in your use of the spore drive unless authorised by Starfleet. With respect to the war effort, the fleet will pick up the slack caused by your absence.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: That's a lot of slack.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We'll manage.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Hi, roomie. Oh my God, you look awful.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Thank you, Tilly.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: That's it. We're gonna have lunch right now. I mean it. I mean that you're gonna tell me what's going on with you.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: There's nothing to tell.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Er, okay. Er, that's okay. I get it. It was bound to happen sometime. There are so many interesting people on this ship, I'm sure you've made tons of friends by now.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Tilly, it's not you. It's me.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Well, since that is very rarely the case in my case, I would love to hear how it's not me.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I'm out of sorts, and preoccupied.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: About?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: The Tardigrade. Each time we use the spore drive, it gets weaker.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You're stressed.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I barely have a job here. I've never been less busy.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: But then that gives you the time and space to actually process what you're going through emotionally.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I don't like it.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Really? I love feeling feelings.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Ah! Turn it down.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Sorry. I didn't know you were still in here.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Just saddling up for the ride, Admiral.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Why you didn't get your damn eyes fixed?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Oh you know, Katrina, I don't trust doctors.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Should I take that personally?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: It's punishment for blindsiding me in that pathetic excuse for a strategy session.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Cut the crap, Gabriel. By the way, there's something I didn't bring up, lest you think I was piling on. The matter of Michael Burnham.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: No, no, no. Starfleet regulation 139

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Eight two allows you to conscript virtually anyone in time of war.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: And so I have.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: This organisation's only convicted mutineer is viewed by many, justifiably or not, as the cause of our conflict with the Klingons. To see her avoiding justice does nothing for general morale.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: When I accepted the command, I was given the fullest latitude to fight this war how I saw fit.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: But why give everyone another reason to judge you?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Are you uncomfortable with the power I've been given, Admiral?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I'm your friend.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Mmm hmm. It's my ship, my way.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Warning. Incoming warp signature detected. Klingon class D7 battle cruiser identified. Tractor beam engaged.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Captain Lorca.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: The pilot was killed in the subsequent firefight. Capitan Lorca was captured by the Klingons.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Do we know where he was taken, Admiral?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: No. By the time we responded to the shuttle's distress beacon, the enemy's warp trail had dissipated. Since you're Acting Captain, I'm sending you what little intel we have. This was a targeted abduction. It's possible the Klingons have learned of the existence of Discovery's propulsion system, and taken Lorca to learn more.We need him back, Mister Saru, before they pry those secrets out of him.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We will find him, Admiral.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Good luck. (communication ends)

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Lieutenant Detmer, set course for the shuttle's last known coordinates, maximum warp. Lieutenant Owosekun, establish search parameters sector by sector. Calculate potential escape vectors correlating to all known Klingon bases, colonies, and planets, within five lightyears.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Burnham. What are you doing on the Bridge?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I came to speak to Captain Lorca.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I'm afraid that won't be possible. Commander Airiam, alert Lieutenant Stamets that we may be making multiple jumps in rapid succession throughout Klingon space to see if we can track the ship that made the abduction.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Multiple jumps?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Do you have an issue with that plan?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I just don't know how feasible it's going to be.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I'm concerned that we are negatively impacting the Tardigrade with each jump we make.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I was told it's virtually indestructible.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I disagree with that assessment.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Do you have proof that we are harming it?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Not as of yet.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I am not finding this information to be helpful in any way. We are about to embark on a rescue mission to save the life our Captain. Are you suggesting we forgo that?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: No, of course not. I'm just worried. I don't know how much more the Tardigrade can sustain. The more you hurt someone, the less helpful they become.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Focus on the task at hand. There will be no more discussion of the Tardigrade until the Captain's back safe. Understood?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You may go.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Computer, list Starfleet's most decorated captains, living and deceased.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Working.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Based on their service records, is it possible to identify the qualities most essential to their success?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Characteristics most often cited include bravery, self-sacrifice, intelligence, tactical brilliance, compassion.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Computer, initiate new protocol. Please record all data related to my performance as Acting Captain of Discovery, and cross-reference with success parameters. Note where deviations occur.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: State the purpose of the new protocol.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: There is an element aboard this ship that causes me to second-guess myself. That cannot continue. I must remain clearheaded in pursuit of today's mission.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Alternative solution. Eliminate destructive element.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Not an option.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Who are you?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: The name is Mudd. Harcourt Fenton Mudd. Harry for short. I reiterate. Ouch!

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Where are we?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: On a resort off Antares Minor. You must try the spa. The hot stone massage is delightful.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Where are we?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Typical Starfleet. No fun at all. We are on a Klingon prison vessel. Particularly nasty one.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: What's a civilian like you doing on a Klingon prison vessel?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: The only crime I'm guilty of is loving too much. It's true, Captain. I fell for a woman far beyond my reach. Sweet Stella. Her family didn't approve of me, so I had no choice except to try and buy her father's respect. Scary, scary man. So I borrowed a large sum from some non-traditional lenders, and gifted her with a moon. It worked like a charm, until I fell behind in my payments. Huh. The creditors came after me, chased me into enemy territory, right into the Klingons' arms, who deposited me here, where I await my fate.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Oh, I wouldn't bother with him, Captain. I believe the technical term for his condition is out to lunch. Here comes the floor show.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Choose your pain.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: They may look stupid, our Klingon hosts. They're anything but. They regularly give us the choice to choose our pain. We can accept the beating ourselves, or pass it on to our cellmates. It's our captors' way of keeping us from bonding.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You seem conspicuously free from bruises.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I've learned how to choose wisely. Don't judge. You're gonna wanna stick with me. I'm a survivor, just like you.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You should know that Lieutenant Stamets rarely, if ever, listens to me.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I can handle him.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Please, show me how.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets. Your spore drive is genius. Beyond genius. What you've achieved for the war effort, for the whole of science itself, it's a contribution

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I know I'm brilliant. What are you trying to get out of me? Why are you with her?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Burnham is worried about the physical effects that Discovery's jumps are having on the Tardigrade. I've done my own evaluations, and I must concur. Scans of its frontal lobe show significant cumulative deterioration every time we go to black alert.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We need to find a work-around. Making Ripper the critical component for the s-drive is unsustainable for the creature and your invention.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We could lose them both, and with them, any chance of saving Captain Lorca.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Aren't there actual people on this ship who require your attention, Doctor?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Actually, the CMO does need my help with an Andorian tonsillectomy. (leaves)

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: To be clear, the Tardigrade was your contribution. I never intended to utilise a living creature as a navigation tool.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I didn't, either.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You say portabella, I say portobello. You are the cause of this situation, Burnham. What are you doing with your mouth?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I am swallowing the urge to set the record straight.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: That won't get us anywhere. Do you want to be right, or do you want to fix this?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I didn't realise there were more of us in here.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I've been pulled out of rotation. Sometimes they let us heal up, so we last longer. Shit, you're a Captain? Here, eat.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: No, you go ahead.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Sorry sir, I'm going to have to insist. We never know when they'll feed us. You get keep up your strength. I already lost one Captain, I won't lose another.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: What's your name, soldier?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Lieutenant Ash Tyler.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: And the captain you lost?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Steven Maranville, of the USS Yeager. The finest, sir.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You were at the Battle of the Binaries?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: They gave it a name, huh? That's where I was captured.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: So you've been here seven months. That's funny to you?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Sorry, sir. It's just, er, if that's true, I'm tougher than I thought.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Or a liar. Nobody survives Klingon torture for seven months. What are you doing here? They got a reason to keep you alive? The Captain of this ship, she's taken a liking to me.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You must've picked up a few details. What's the crew complement of this vessel?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Can't be certain. Thirty, maybe forty.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You got a sense of the layout of the decks?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Uh-huh.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I gotta get my hands on an active comm relay so I can signal my ship for extraction.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: We're deep in enemy territory. There's no way a Federation ship can make it out this far undetected.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Oh, my ship can. It's like a ghost.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Mudd, if I see that pet of yours again Come on, come on, come on.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Apologises, Lieutenant. Stuart has boundary issues. And besides, we're both a little hungry.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You'd take food out of the mouths of the only two men standing between you and death?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Damn right I would. Because this is all Starfleet has left me. I used to have a life, Captain. A good one. A respectable business. That all got blown up, because of your goddamn war.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Starfleet didn't start this war.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Of course you did. The moment you decided to boldly go where no one had gone before. What do you think would happen when you bump into someone who didn't want you in their front yard?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: You're siding with the enemy?

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: I'm not siding with anyone. But I sure as hell understand why the Klingons pushed back. Starfleet arrogance. Have you ever bothered to look out of your spaceships down at the little guys below? If you had, you'd realise that there's a lot more of us down there than there are you up here, and we're sick and tired of getting caught in your crossfire.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: So we need the spore drive to save Captain Lorca, but the spore drive is killing the Tardigrade. All right, let's start with our mushroom, prototaxites stellaviatori, a species made up of exotic material found not only in normal space, but in a discreet subspace domain known as the mycelial network. Its fungal roots, a.k.a. mycelium, spread across the universe, fanning out into infinity to create a matrix that serves as our intergalactic freeway system.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Enter the Tardigrade, whose unique genetic makeup allows it to navigate through the network, because of its symbiotic relationship with the mycelium's spores. Like its microscopic cousins on Earth, the Tardigrade is able to incorporate foreign DNA into its own genome via horizontal gene transfer. When Ripper borrows DNA from the mycelium, he's granted an all-access travel pass.

Title: choose-your-pain
Dialogue: Once Lieutenant Stamets conveys the coordinates of a selected destination directly into Ripper he knows exactly where to go. As the Tardigrade's DNA is already sequenced into the computer, can't we build a virtual Ripper? Trick the mycelium into thinking it's communicating with the real thing, and then navigate the ship that way?

Title: choose-your-pain

Dialogue: I have no idea what you're talking about.

Dialogue: Mmm. You suffer from extreme photosensitivity.

Dialogue: Two survivors. One injury. Mission success. Hologram battle simulation complete.

Dialogue: Yeah, third grade.

Dialogue: Issaquah Elementary. Twenty four kilometres outside Seattle, which makes you not exactly from Seattle. I like to split hairs. I do my homework. Think I let just anyone walk on my ship?

Dialogue: Well, I figure I've seen you fly, shoot, fight like a Klingon.

Dialogue: No, most people would've given up. You learned. My last Chief of Security and I went through a lot together. I need someone I can trust. Someone that understands war. What it takes to survive, what it takes to win. I think that's you. Is it?

Dialogue: I'd be honoured to serve on the Discovery. I won't let you down, sir.

Dialogue: Good.

Dialogue: Humiliation is a human emotion.

Dialogue: I'm sorry, Sarek. You were wrong to believe in me.

Dialogue: Sarek and his human wife, Amanda, took you in. Your story's well-documented.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: How could he put that pressure on a child?

Title: lethe
