Title: lethe
Dialogue: Vulcans tried to murder you?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Renegade Vulcans, a small faction. And they didn't try, Doctor, they succeeded. I was dead for three minutes. The katra has a healing power and Sarek used it to save me. A kind of soul graft. It's a procedure that's frowned upon, and rare.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: So, you're linked with him. He gets wounded, you feel pain. Has this happened to you before?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Once. The start of the war. He sensed my distress and came to me. But this is different. I can feel him slipping away. I don't think this is a conscious effort on his part. Sarek is delirious. He might be dying. Captain, please. Captain, help me find him.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Michael Burnham is correct. The Vulcan High Council has confirmed that Ambassador Sarek's ship was sabotaged by logic extremists. I'm told that the Vulcans were secretly invited to a meeting with two independent Klingon houses, in an attempt to forge an alliance to end the war.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Klingons don't normally send party invitations.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Indeed. But both of these houses were ousted by General Kol's new ruling council. It is their wish to undermine his authority.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: And the Vulcans believe that? TERRAL [hologram] Not without reservation. The meeting was organised on neutral ground by the Elders of Cancri 4. Sarek was chosen to vet the legitimacy of their claims. He's demonstrated a unique ability to forge relationships with races that do not follow logic-based ideology.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Vulcans went behind Starfleet's back because they thought they could clear up our illogical mess. So, where is the ambassador right now?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Lost in a nebula near Yridia. Starfleet Command is assessing the situation to organise a recovery operation.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Well, the longer you assess, the greater the chance Sarek dies. And so does the best chance for peace. I'll go get him.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Absolutely not. There are protocols to be followed, Captain.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You can tell the Vulcans they're welcome. I'm happy to clean up their mess. - Discovery out.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Captain

Title: lethe
Dialogue: We have arrived at the Yridia nebula.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Start scanning for the Ambassador's emergency beacon. (Burnham enters) How are you feeling?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I still sense Sarek, but it's growing erratic. I think he's getting worse.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Don't worry, we'll get him back.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Captain. Scanners detect no signs of the Ambassador's ship. The nebula's radioactive gases are rendering our sensors inoperative.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: All right, we'll send out probes, scan sector by sector.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Considering the size of the nebula, that method could take months.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Well, any other options, Number One?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Now that's my kind of crazy. You're talking about building a synthetic mind-meld augment. Groovy.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Clearly your trip down the mycelium path has lightened your mood, Lieutenant.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Once you're past getting stabbed by needles, it's pretty great.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm guessing from your reaction that modifying this neural enhancer is a viable method to achieve what I need.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Sure. Hey, why not? Now, we boost you neural impulses to reconnect with his katra, then pump those same signals into your noggin and voila. SarekVision. I gotta say, this katra stuff is way cool. An uncharted superhighway connecting all of consciousness and life?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: We have exactly no time to discuss the metaphysical implications.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I can sense that Sarek is unconscious. I want to use this mind-meld to wake him up so he can activate his ship's transponder.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Right. Like a psychic hit of speed.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I was thinking adrenaline shot, but okay.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: There is one wrinkle, though. Radioactive interference from the nebula is gonna diffuse your signal. You will never be able to maintain a strong enough connection with Sarek from out here.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: So we take the Discovery inside the nebula and get closer to him.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Oh, bad idea. Guess what happens if we mix those cosmic gases with our concentration of mycelium spores we have onboard.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Er...

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Ah.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Okay, so we go in with a shuttle.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Oh, you'd have to fly into that soup with nothing but hope and a prayer. Are you really that crazy? Good to know. I know, I know. Get to work.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: As long as I don't overstay my welcome, the shuttle shields can handle it, but I need someone to work the neural enhancer. I'd like Cadet Tilly. She's smart, and I could use the moral support.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: All right, then you'll get it. And you need a pilot who can fly you through that storm and, more importantly, get you out alive. Luckily, I know a guy.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Attention, all personnel. Clear dock 3 for shield test.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Cadet.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Sir.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Bring her back in one piece.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Not a scratch.

Dialogue: I'm talking about her.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Cadet Wells, please report to Engineering.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Or don't come back at all.

Dialogue: Captain. Incoming transmission from Admiral Cornwell.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Transfer it to my quarters.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm afraid that won't do, sir.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What do you mean, that won't do?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Her cruiser just dropped out of warp, and she's requesting permission to land. Here.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: All right. I'll see her in my Ready room.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What the hell do you think you're doing? I thought Terral was gonna throw a fit, and he's a damn Vulcan.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I did what I thought was best.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You launched an unauthorised rescue mission using a convicted mutineer. Not to mention a POW who has barely had time to recover. Can you even trust this guy?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Yes, Admiral. I checked him out. Tyler graduated with honours from the Academy before he saved my life.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You are Captain of the most advanced ship in the fleet, the cornerstone of our entire defence against the Klingons. You cannot treat Discovery like it's your own fiefdom. Is it true what I heard about Lieutenant Stamets? He engaged in eugenic manipulation?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: He got the spore drive working again. Yeah, he saved the ship and the crew.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I appreciate that, Gabriel, but there are rules

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Rules are for Admirals in back offices. I'm out there trying to win a war.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Then don't make enemies on your own side.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What are you doing here? What's really going on?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I came to see my friend.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Okay. Why don't we stop talking like Starfleet officers, Kat, and, er, start talking like friends?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Hey, where's that old Burnham bluster, huh? The bad-ass lady who's always pushing me to be the best I can be? Do you know what helps me when I'm freaked out? Talking.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You know where Sarek's mind is? Where his dying thoughts have taken him? To me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I mean, that's kind of beautiful.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: No. No, you don't understand. I was supposed to be his proof that humans and Vulcans could coexist as equals, but I ended up being his greatest disappointment. That's what he's reflecting on. I was rejected from the Expeditionary Group for being too human. My failure is his last thought. He doesn't believe in me, but I'm supposed to save him.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: All right, we're at Sarek's last known location. Can we do this before we get torn to pieces? Or you can keep chatting away. It's up to you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Okay. Good to go. Provided this thing doesn't fry your brain.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Now, if the bio-readings show something weird

Title: lethe
Dialogue: They will. Sarek is delirious. I can't allow him to push me like that out again. But fighting him is gonna put a massive strain on me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Then how do I know if I should pull you out?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Don't. No matter what the sensors say, you leave me in there. Okay? Go.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: She cannot thrive in the Vulcan service.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Do you remember, on your tenth birthday we took a shuttle and we went to the seventh moon of Eridani D?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I recall. To experience a book exchange. An ancient human ritual.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: This gift comes with a mother's advice.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You've proven that you're as accomplished as any Vulcan, which is going to serve you well, as long as you never forget that you're human too. You need to nurture that side. There's Sarek. He's talking to the Expeditionary Group director.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: She got in, didn't she.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Michael's application was rejected.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: If this is your attempt at humour, you're gonna need a lot more practice, husband.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: It is not.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Why?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: No human has ever been accepted into the Vulcan Expeditionary Group. Success was always an unlikely outcome.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Obviously, I had hoped for better.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I don't want to be here.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Michael.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Please, I want to leave.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Listen to me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Why are you doing this?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I told you before, you're not welcome here.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You called me here. Your katra pulled me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: This is my mind. Stay out.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You're near death. I can help you like you helped me. Give me a chance. Please.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You will fail.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What's happening back there?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I don't know.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Then wake her up.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: She said not to. It'll sever the link.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I outrank you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Damn it. Fine.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Nothing like a single malt, straight from the motherland. I still think about the bottle we killed that night we went to see the Perseids meteor shower. You don't remember?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: No, I was just thinking how long ago it seems.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Yeah. We were so young, with grand plans for the future.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Well, some of us still have.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I know. I worry about you, Gabriel. Some of the decisions you've been making recently have been troubling.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Well, war doesn't provide too many opportunities for niceties.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You're pushing this crew. You're putting the ship in harm's way. You've been ignoring orders.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm in the front line, Kat. You gotta make decisions in a second, sometimes less.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Which is why Starfleet needs you at your best. I'm not sure we're getting it.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm not sure the Klingons would agree.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm not talking about your record. I'm talking about you. I don't think you've been the same since the Buran.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Hmm. I passed every test. Cleared for duty every time. But you know that, don't you, Doc?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Yes, I've read your psych evals. You passed with flying colours.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: So, what's really the problem?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Less than a week ago, you were being tortured. Now you're back in the chair. How do you feel about that?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Are we in session? Because I didn't know you were practicing again. Because if I have your undivided attention for fifty minutes, I can think of a whole bunch of other things we could be doing.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Laying in a course back to Discovery.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: No, you're not.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: He actually is, though.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I said I'm not leaving here without Sarek.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Those are not my orders, Burnham.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Hey.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Sarek keeps blocking me. I can't fight you, too.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: All right. What can we do?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I don't know. His thoughts are fixed on my graduation day, but the emotions from that memory are too difficult for me to handle.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Maybe it's hard for him, too.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Or not. He's a Vulcan.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Why is he thinking of your failure? Where's the logic in that? I've been close to death. Right up next to it. You don't think about who's failed you. None of that matters. You think about who you love. What you wish you'd done differently. What does he wish he'd done differently?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm going back in.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: She cannot thrive in the Vulcan service.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Sarek.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You continue to demonstrate an inability to learn. You cannot defeat me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What are you hiding? (the fight restarts) What don't you want me to see? Is it really worth dying over? I can save you, Sarek, but you have to let me into your mind. Let me in. You had faith in me once. I'm asking you to have faith in me again.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I never lost faith in you. The failure on this day was mine, and mine alone. I will show you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: The Expeditionary Group has examined Graduate Burnham's application with great interest.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Acceptance with honours is her due.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: By conventional decision parameters, yes.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Your hesitation is to do with her nature?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Certainly, her nurture is unquestionable.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I have created in her a being of exquisite logic to rival the best of our species.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: An accomplishment you have achieved not once but twice. Your ward, Michael, and your son, Spock.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What has my son to do with this situation? He has not yet begun his studies at the Science Academy.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Upon completion, he will apply to the Vulcan Expeditionary Group, and then there will be not one but two non-Vulcans in its ranks.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Spock is

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Half-Vulcan. Another of your experiments. The integration of humans into our culture is an admirable goal, but it must be titrated. In honour of your position and reputation I will accept one of your not-quite-Vulcans.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You ask me to make an impossible choice.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Your reaction to this is quite illogical and suggests a conclusion based on emotion.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You chose Spock over me, didn't you? You were forced into that decision. Why not tell me the truth?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Spock went against my wishes and joined Starfleet over the Vulcan Expeditionary Group. The choice I made merited nothing. What would be gained by telling you that?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Instead, you made me believe I failed you. You manipulated me. Do you have any idea what living with that lie did to me?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I did not. But I do now. I failed you, Michael Burnham. And for that, I have so much

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Shame?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Show me how to save you like you saved me.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: My mind to your mind.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: My thoughts to your thoughts. Wake up, Sarek. Tell us where you are.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I've got his transponder. You did it.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I'm not used to having anyone in my bed.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You sleep with a phaser in your bed, and you say nothing's wrong?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Kat

Title: lethe
Dialogue: All these months I have ignored the signs, but I can't anymore. The truth is, you are not the man I used to know.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Of course I am.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: And I'm not like the rest of them at Starfleet, blinded by your victories. You lied on those psych evaluations, and you did it so brilliantly you fooled everyone.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: That what you're doing here? You came to evaluate me yourself?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I have watched you change these last months. It's upsetting.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Kat

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Now I see it's worse than I even thought. Your behaviour is pathological. That's what tonight was, right? Trying to get me to back off?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: No.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: It sure wasn't what it was like before. But this is bigger than us. You said it yourself. We're at war. I can't leave Starfleet's most powerful weapon in the hands of a broken man.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Don't take my ship away from me. She's all I got. Please, I'm begging you. You're right. It's been harder on me than I let on. I lied about everything, and I need help.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I hate that I can't tell if this is really you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Captain, Lieutenant Tyler has just returned.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: They have Ambassador Sarek,

Title: lethe
Dialogue: But he is severely wounded.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: On my way to Sickbay.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: He'll live, but Doctor Culber says he can't meet the Klingons in this condition. The window for the talks closes in a few hours. Even if the Federation wanted to step in, they couldn't get there in time.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Admiral Cornwell could.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Ensign Logan to Observation Deck.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I mean, we're already halfway there. She could take an envoy, small enough so as not to rattle the Klingons. I know her. She'd do anything to keep the chance of peace alive. You did well, Burnham. You should be proud.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Much as it would displease my Vulcan mentor, I'm feeling a lot of emotions right now.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Commander Webb to Security.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm not sure pride is one of them. But I do want to thank you, sir. You didn't have to mount this rescue mission for Sarek.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I didn't do it for him. I need a team around me that's gonna help me carry the day, and that includes you. So I'd like to make it official. There's a post waiting for you on the Bridge. Science specialist. Don't even think about saying no.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I accept.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Good.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I'm grateful to serve under a Captain like you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Any available offload team to Cargo Bay 5.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: it's good to see your strength returning.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: It is unfortunate that I will not be able to continue my mission of peace.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What do you recall of your rescue? Of what transpired between us?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I was unconscious, was I not?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You know what happened. You could talk to me about it, help me understand what you did. It could make us grow closer, not further apart. That's what families do.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Technically, we are not related.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: You can do better. But I won't push you. We'll have this conversation one day, Father.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I don't wanna ruin your career. But when I return, we'll talk about how you step down. And after you get some help, maybe we'll get you back in that chair.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Well, may fortune favour the bold, Admiral. Good luck with your negotiation.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Attention all B deck crew, transpo drill has been cancelled.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Shaving off my time.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I gave you bad advice. There are a million ways to get to the Captain's chair. Find your own.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I have.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Green tea. Exceptional source of antioxidants, alkaloids, and amino acids.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: How's your Vulcan dad?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Stubborn and impenetrable as always. He claims he doesn't remember any of the mind-meld.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Well, good thing I was there, then. Mind-witness.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I always knew I could never be who he wanted me to be. But I realised today that it goes both ways. I'll never get from him what I want, either.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: That's tough.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: It's okay. Part of me feels unburdened.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Still, I'm sorry for that other part of you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Thank you. All my life the conflict inside me has been between logic and emotion. But now it's my emotions that are fighting. I think about him and I want to cry, but I have to smile. And I feel angry but I want to love, and I'm hurt, but there's hope. What is this?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: It's just being human.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Michael Burnham. Pleased to meet you.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Ash Tyler. We've met.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Have we? Let's try it again.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Greetings from the United Federation of Planets. Unfortunately, Ambassador Sarek is unable to attend. I'm Admiral Cornwell and will speak in his place. Thank you to the elders of Cancri 4 for hosting this meeting. We hope it is the first step toward creating new alliances.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: We are certain it will be.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Are you there, General Kol?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I am indeed, Dennas. And I am pleased to see how you have taken care of our Cancri hosts. I was hoping to get a high-ranking Vulcan, but she is so much better. You have proven yourselves worthy. You shall be welcome in my new United Klingon Empire, and will receive the ability to cloak your ships as a result. (in English) I look forward to meeting you, Admiral.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: It was a trap, sir. Klingons have taken the Admiral. Their ships are en route to enemy space now. Shall I

Title: lethe
Dialogue: Notify Starfleet Command. Ask for orders. Is there a problem?

Title: lethe
Dialogue: No, sir. It's just, in the past we have engaged in alternative thinking on these matters.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: What if we go after her and it's another trap, Mister Saru? Did you consider that? Starfleet can't afford to lose the Discovery. She's bigger than all of us. If so ordered, we will try and rescue the admiral, but not without authorisation.

Title: lethe
Dialogue: I will hail Starfleet now, sir.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Personal Log, Specialist Michael Burnham. Stardate 2136.8. Despite my fears to the contrary, I seem to have found my place on this Discovery. An air of routine has descended upon the ship, and even I am a part of it. I've made friends. Well, one, at least. I take comfort in my work. This ship has quickly become the most important weapon in the Federation's arsenal in our war against the Klingons. And because of her, the tide has turned. Because of us, we are winning. Lieutenant Stamets' ability to pilot the ship's spore drive has given him access not just to all of space, but to unseen parts of his personality as well. As we perform our daily responsibilities, I confess I find some members of my fellow crew more interesting than others. Lieutenant Tyler has suffered so much, and still maintains such dignity and kindness. I find him... intriguing. But I fear my personal history interferes with my ability to forge relationships. I am among the others... but also apart. I wish sorely to step out of my comfort zone, yet don't know how. But tonight, I will face one of my greatest challenges so far. Tonight we are having... a party.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: (drunk) One, two, three, go!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Where's the music?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What's your deal?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Starships have power-redundant relays. There shouldn't be any flickering.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No, not work. I'm talking about him. (Tyler) You guys have been on two dates. What's going on? I want the details.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh. I helped him calibrate pulse scope rifles in the armoury. And we ate lunch together because it was the end of our shift.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hey, listen. Tou got to give him a sign that you're interested, otherwise, you're gonna lose your shot.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Duly noted, when I'm actually on a date, which these were not.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, how... how do you see him? How does he stack up compared to your old boyfriends?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: How does he compare to yours?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, I used to exclusively go for soldiers, but I'm kind of going through, like, a musician phase right now.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Everyone, hey! We're all lucky to be here tonight, surrounded by our brothers and sisters in arms. Laughing. Dancing. But let's not forget the sacrifices that have been made by those who still serve alongside us.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hear, hear! Yeah!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And by those who have given their lives for us so we can continue the fight.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hear, hear!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: To the 10,000 souls who are gone but will never be forgotten.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Never forgotten! Yeah!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: My soldier thing is back.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Burnham. Hey, Tilly. What are you up to?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm leaving. You guys have fun!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Your friend's subtle.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Inappropriately so.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Science Specialist Burnham and Lieutenant Tyler, please report to the Bridge.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Look at that. Saved from the horrors of small talk by duty.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Wait. No, I...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: To be clear. I wasn't attempting to be rude. It's just that my experience with parties is limited.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Easy, Burnham, I get it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Left, please.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Vulcans don't party. What about the Shenzhou? You served on it for what, seven years?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Due to my rank, interpersonal fraternisation was... not appropriate.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Not really an excuse anymore. So why are you still hiding in corners?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh! I'm sorry, Lieutenant. I'm sorry, Doctor Culber.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: (hugging her) Why would you apologise for a random act of physical interaction? You know, these are the moments that make life so gloriously unpredictable. (to Tyler) You're a very tall man.

Dialogue: I believe you've met Lieutenant Tyler. He's our new Chief of Security here.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: May I say you are astonishingly grounded for having endured seven months of torture.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I deeply apologise for my partner. Lately he's been, er... different.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Speaking of different, look at the cybernetic augment that my resident genius here built for me.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We're trying to make his connection to the spore drive more comfortable.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You're always looking out for me. By the way, what's the deal with you two?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: There is no deal.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Specialist Burnham would hate to be inappropriate. Coming, Burnham?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What did he mean by that?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Attention officer trainees. Please report to your immediate supervisors.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What did you mean by that?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Okay.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain, the unidentified signal I monitored is directly ahead.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: All right, yellow alert, Mister Saru. Shields up. Phasers to standby.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Copy that, sir. Topping up.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Scanners identify the object as biological. Xenobiological classification gormagander. Its health appears to be compromised.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Cancel the yellow alert, Mister Saru. Thought those things had been hunted to extinction.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hunting isn't the cause of its reduced numbers. It's primarily due to their mating practices, or lack thereof. They spend their lives feeding on alpha particles in solar winds. They're often so consumed by this task that they ignore all other instincts, including reproduction.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: That's as depressing a trait as I've ever heard. Helmsman, plot a course...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain, the gormagander is on the endangered species list. Protocol requires us to transfer it to a xenologic facility.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Then have at it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I hear we've got a lonely gormagander beaming in. Lost cub or old widow?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No matter what she is, she is all alone.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We've got a lock on the creature, and we're ready to transport.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Energising.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: All right, sweet girl, let's see if we can't figure out what's got you down.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Wait a minute. I'm detecting abnormal readings inside the creature.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Look out!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No, don't shoot!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Call the Bridge!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Burnham to the Bridge. Intruder alert. Shots fired. Need immediate assistance.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Intruders on deck six, sir.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I want him locked down. Status on Burnham?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Unharmed. She reports four confirmed fatalities.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Tell her not to engage the hostile.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We have him trapped, sir.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Whoever you are, drop your weapons. This ends now.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Did you miss me as much as I missed you?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Did you really think that you could leave me to rot in a Klingon prison and not suffer any repercussions? As soon as I find out what's so special about your ship, I'm gonna sell it to the Klingons. Do you hear me, Captain? I'm going to sell your ship to your mortal enemy. And in so doing, destroy any chance your Federation has of winning this war! When you left me behind with the Klingons, you robbed me of my dear sweet Stella, the only woman I have ever loved, and I will have my revenge. Also, I'm gonna kill you as many times as possible.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I don't see this ending with you taking my ship.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Not this time. But I have all the data I need for the next. So I will see you later. Or rather, earlier.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Mister Saru?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Sensors read amicium and yurium compound explosion.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hull breach on deck six. Five, four, now three. We can't contain it, Captain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: TNG Cause And Effect?)

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: To the 10,000 souls who are gone but will never be forgotten.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Never forgotten! Yeah!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: My soldier thing is back.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Burnham. Hey, Tilly. What are you up to?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm leaving. Have fun.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Your friend's subtle.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Inappropriately so.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Science Specialist Burnham and Lieu...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: To be clear. I wasn't attempting to be rude. It's just that my experience with parties is limited.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Easy, Burnham, I get it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Left, please.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Vulcans don't party. What about the Shenzhou? You served on it for what, seven years?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yes, but due to my rank, interpersonal fraternisation was inappropriate.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Not really an excuse anymore. So why are you still hiding in corners?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: There aren't always simple answers to those kinds of questions.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And sometimes there are.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, Tyler. Tyler, wait!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Stamets?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yeah. Burnham, both of you. You need to listen to me. There isn't any time. I.. Or rather, there is time, too much time.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Stamets, slow down.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I can't slow down! Don't you see what's happening? We have been here before. All of us. I cannot be the only person who recognises this.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Paul. I'm very sorry. You're ranting.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What I need is for all of you placid people to finally start listening. Wait! Wait! Er, it all starts with a gormagander, okay? A gormagander.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What's a gormagander?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: It's a space whale.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, that explains it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yellow alert. Yellow alert.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Nice of you two to show up. Mister Saru, what's hiding from us out there?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: The object is not an enemy ship, sir. It is an organic lifeform. A gormagander.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, for crying out loud. All right, cancel the yellow alert. Helm, find some way to get around it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Sir, scans show the gormagander's bio readings to be highly unstable. Now, according to regulations, we are required to transfer...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Belay that order.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I can't advise that, Captain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: The Endangered Species Act is quite clear. Ignoring our duties would put us in direct violation of established laws, and subject our Captain to court-martial.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Let's beam this thing into the shuttle bay and drop it off at the nearest sanctuary as soon as we can.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain, I'd like to run point on this, sir. As science specialist, I'm the most qualified to handle the needs of this creature.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I don't give a damn, I just want it done.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I request security oversight of the operation, Captain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I still don't give a damn. Go.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: How could Lieutenant Stamets know we were gonna run into a gormagander?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: There have only been 57 cases of near-misses with starships in the last ten years. The odds are almost incalculable.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I hear we've got a lonely gormagander beaming in.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yeah. Activate transporter.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You thinking this whale is armed?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Medical readings are abnormal, but nothing else is unusual. I'm gonna get closer readings.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You got something?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Faint. An energy pattern. Almost like a transporter beam.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Black alert. Black alert.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Why are we preparing to jump?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Spore drive activated.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I didn't order a spore jump.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I did not activate it, sir.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Computer, show me Engineering.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Denied.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Tyler, get to Engineering. Go, go, go!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Door's locked from the inside. Security override isn't functioning.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Warning, critical drive overload in three minutes.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Welcome, kiddies. Make yourselves at home. I have.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: How the hell did you get out of that prison, Mudd?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You remember my multi-legged friend, Stuart? Well, we performed a feat of magic that would make the most accomplished escape artist blush. Alas, once free, he went his own way. Bugs, no loyalty.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Tyler, you know this man.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: He was my cellmate. Back away from the console. Put your hands in the air. I won't ask you again, Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Actually, you will. But, before then, would you please tell me how to work these controls? I understand that the drive system is what's special about this ship.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Back away or we fire!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: But for the life of me, I can't...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: ...figure out what these contraptions do or what they connect to.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Warning, critical drive overload in 60 seconds.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Can we just jump ahead to the part where you tell me how to make these systems operational, please? I've got some Klingons on the hook. You might want to hurry. We're getting close to that point where, you know...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Computer, beam intruder to the brig.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I've created a containment field to protect me on this side of the room. You really think I would forget to take control of the computer?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Warning. Critical drive overload.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You are mad.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No. I'm Mudd. Now, will one of you tell me how to work this damn system!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: As days go, this is a weird one.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Stamets, the drive.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I know, believe me.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Warning, critical drive overload in 20 seconds.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We've been through all this before. Multiple times, actually. And I hate to tell you, but I have yet to find a way where it ends with a win for the home team.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Warning, drive overload critical.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'll see you again soon.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Stamets, wait!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Because I was gonna ask if you wanted to dance.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Science Specialist Burnham and Lieutenant Tyler, please report to the Bridge.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Saved by the bell.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Excuse me. Excuse me. Hey. Where's Burnham?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I don't know.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: The gormagander is on the endangered species list.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Have at it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Burnham, don't talk, just listen. The ship is in danger. We are caught in a temporal loop. We are repeating the same thirty odd minutes over and over again. The ship can be destroyed, we can all be killed, but as long as the thirty minute window doesn't expire, everything starts over. And every second that you doubt me brings us all closer to death. Do you understand?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Okay. I think we need to get you to Sickbay. think these might be side effects of your...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Exposure to the alien DNA. It's possible we haven't taken into consideration the cognitive variances...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yes, yes, yes. Please stop talking and come with me. I'll explain everything.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Is the fish safely on board yet?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Technically, it's not a fish, it's... (silenced by a Look)

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Shuttle bay reports five by five.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Good.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain, message from Doctor Culber. He's requesting you in Sickbay. It's regarding Lieutenant Stamets. It's urgent.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Sickbay, direct.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Destination cancelled.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Heavy.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Mudd. Computer, red alert.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Override, my dear computer. Come on.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing on my ship?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You ask me that question every single time. You know that, don't you? No. Of course you don't.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Move! I really can't take it from the top for you all over again, Lorca. The message from the doctor was not real. I just wanted some alone time with you. There's an area of the ship I can't access, and I'm hoping you're hiding your secrets to the spore drive inside.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I don't know what you're talking about, Mudd, but if you think I'm gonna help you in any way at all, then you're crazier than I remember.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: There really are so many ways to blow up this ship, it's almost a design flaw. Computer, access self-destruct programme.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Accessed.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Ball's in your court, Captain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Mudd is using some kind of technology that allows him to repeat the same thirty minutes over and over. He's trying to get the spore drive running so he can sell the ship to the Klingons.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, how are you capable of existing outside of the time loop?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, the Tardigrade is a multidimensional creature, so it must be a side effect of combining its DNA with mine.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yes. So you remember everything?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yes. And it's getting really hard to keep it straight. I can't stop Mudd alone, Burnham. And sooner or later, he's going to figure out there's a piece missing from the spore drive. It's me.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: How is Mudd creating a time loop?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I don't know. I'm hoping maybe Tyler might, because they shared a cell together. Tyler mentioned it right before I shot Mudd. Anyway, I need you to talk to Tyler. We're almost out of time in this loop. Tell me a secret. Something that will immediately prove to you we've had this conversation. Something you've never admitted to anyone. I promise it'll be safe with me.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Where is Mudd now?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Now is usually around the time he kills the Captain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Okay. Ooo, I love what you've done with the place, Gabe.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: There's nothing here for you, Mudd. This is my own private research area.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Ah-ha. Why didn't you tell me that you had so many wonderful toys? Ooo. Wonder what this does? I'm thinking it might melt brains. Does it melt brains?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: If you kill a Starfleet Captain, they lock you up forever, you know that.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Do you know how many times I've had the pleasure of taking your life, Lorca?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: 53, but who's counting? And it never gets old. Oh, drat. We're almost out of time. I'll figure out how that little motor of yours works sooner or later. I've got all the time in the world. And in the meanwhile, we still don't know what this does. Let's find out.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Where's the music?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What's your deal?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Starships have redundant power relays. There shouldn't be...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I just spotted the hottest guy over there, and apparently he's in a band. Have fun.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Okay.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I wouldn't take you for this kind of event.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You've never been in love.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Why would you say that to me?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Because I need your help. - You told me that piece of information to prove to you that what I'm saying is true. We have been caught in a 30-minute time loop and I'm the only one who realises it. I have witnessed you and Lorca and Tyler die at the hands of a criminal named Harry Mudd, who is trying to take over our ship. I need to know that you believe me, because if I have to explain this again, I'm gonna throw myself out an airlock.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I believe you.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Good. So please, talk to Tyler and find out if he has any information on Mudd that will help us stop him.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: But what if he won't talk to me either?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, he will. He likes you. Here he comes.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Uh-oh. Xenoanthropologist in the corner. Don't tell me, you're busy studying the coupling rituals of pent-up soldiers.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Because I was gonna ask you if you wanted to dance.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We don't have time for that.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I mean...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Science Specialist Burnham and Lieutenant Tyler, please report to the Bridge.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Saved by the bell.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I am really bad at this.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yeah, you should've gone with him to the Bridge.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And if what you say is true, then Tyler and I don't have any more alone time until the next reset. Our one chance to fix all this, and I blew it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, you like him. That makes things a little tricky.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm out of my element.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Dance with me. For science. I need to see what I'm working with.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: But say I wanted to... step out of my... corner. How do people connect in that way?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hugh and I fell in love after I told him to get lost.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: That doesn't make any sense.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Love isn't logical. Can you let me lead, please? I was in a wonderful caf on Alpha Centauri, when, three seats down, comes this hideous humming. Have you ever heard someone try to hum Kasseelian opera?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I can't say that I have.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, I told him to stifle it or sit somewhere else. Instead, he sat right next to me. And he's been there ever since.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: But after such a rude exchange, why would he do that?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I told him how I really felt, and he did the same. And we liked that about each other.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm good at honesty.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Never hide who you are. That's the only way relationships work. We're out of time. We'll have to figure out how Mudd's resetting the time loop. You'll do better on the next go-around. You have to.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hi.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hey. I was just coming over to see... Want to dance?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I thought you'd never ask. Will you lead, please?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yeah.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: So, I hear you were locked up in that Klingon prison cell with Harry Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Not one for small talk, are you?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I've never understood it, really. But I've realised that relationships are built on honesty. So here it is. Harry Mudd is here. And in a few minutes, he's gonna take over this ship. He wants to sell it to the Klingons. He's already trapped us in a time loop.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Harry Mudd? Wait, is this Vulcan humour?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I wish it were.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And why didn't Stamets come to me himself?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: He tried, in previous loops, but he felt like you'd have an easier time trusting me.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And why is that?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Because I like you.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And he thinks you like me, too.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: This night's gotten weird, but also very interesting. If time really is repeating, this won't matter.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: That was nice.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Science Specialist Burnham and Lieutenant Tyler, please report to the Bridge.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No, please ignore it. We have to.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Okay. Okay. So how can I help?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Did Mudd ever mention having access to equipment that could help him do something this big?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, he did used to brag about robbing a Betazoid bank, heavily secured and fortified, no way in. Volatile encryption, molecular locks, daily DNA password protection. Mudd claimed to have memorised the security patterns. I thought it was just another one of his lies. But I guess if he had an unlimited number of tries...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Did he say how he did it?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Something about a non-equilibrial matter state.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: A time crystal. We learned about these at the Vulcan Academy. But the decay rate of the lattice is too unpredictable. No Federation-aligned species has ever been able to stabilise them. A four-dimensional race must have perfected the technology, and now Mudd has it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Why don't we track Mudd down and see if he's wearing one of these crystal things? Any idea where he is?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Let's go.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Has that fish beamed aboard safely yet?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, technically, it's not a fish, it's... (silenced by a Look)

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Where the hell are Burnham and Tyler?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Mister Saru?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I don't understand, sir. I'm locked out of the ship's controls.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Computer. Computer, respond!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Let me see what I can do. Computer, reduce volume so we can have a normal, adult conversation.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yes, Captain Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain Mudd?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I never thought I would say this, but I'm actually tired of gloating. In any case, this is very much my ship. Your ship? Very much not at all.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: All right, show's over, bud. Back to whatever little hole you crawled out of.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: To the brig.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I do not know how you wrested control, but you are in violation...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Of code 7.5.3. Yes, you've said. Many times. At any rate, tell me, Lanky, have you ever seen one of these?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Of the 823 ways there are to die in space, this is rumoured to be the most painful. I found them in your former Captain's man cave. Apparently, the weaponised dark matter rips molecules apart at the subatomic level. So, if any of you are planning on becoming heroes, including you, random communications officer man, you'll find there's very little I don't know. Now, just sit tight. This will hurt a bit.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Mudd!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh. (laughs) You seem to have missed.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, that was new.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Let us not suffer any more needless losses. Please.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Okeydoke! Listen up. One of you is going to teach me how this damn drive works or the beanpole dies screaming. So, how do I start that engine? Hmm? I will disintegrate every single one of you in a screaming fit of agony, one at a time, starting with you.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Stop! I can't watch you kill any more people.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: It needs me to work.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Delicious. Shall we to the engine room? Computer, pump up the volume. Destination, Engineering. Toodles.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Tilly, where are you?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: So, did I die, too?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We all died. Many times. But now Mudd has everything that he needs, and if we can't find a way to stop him, then he'll let Discovery rejoin the time stream and sell the ship to the Klingons. Anyone who's dead'll stay dead forever. And Starfleet loses the war. I noticed that Mudd was wearing a crystal on his wrist, but it's too small to generate enough energy for chronal displacements. There has to be a larger energy source.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, okay. Er, er, I got something. Yeah, I'm sending it to you right now.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Poor thing. No wonder you feel bad. Mudd hid the ship inside the creature and the crystal inside the ship. This crystal, it has the same orthogonal indices as the device on Mudd's wrist.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Can we beam it over to the deck and try to figure out a way to disable it?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No, because Mudd has control of all the critical systems, and we're running out of time. Now that Mudd knows how to work the spore drive, the only way is to get Mudd to reset time himself.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You said that he has no reason to restart time. He has everything the Klingons want.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No, he doesn't.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain's Log, Stardate 2137.2. Captain Harcourt Fenton Mudd recording. I am about to close the deal of the millennium...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Enter! Hmm.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You seem at home. You should have been a Captain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm neither one for following orders nor giving them. No, the solar winds are my mistress, and I follow her wherever she beckons.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hmm. And what about Stella?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What? Oh, yes. Stella, the love of my life. Ah, Stella. The war took her from me. Never have two souls been so star-crossed. Romantic? Yes. Tragic? Huh, even more so. But the best of romances always are, aren't they?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Are you done?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Almost. Computer, please send our location to the awaiting Klingon ship, courtesy of Harry Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Coordinates sent.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Now I'm done.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: The Klingons will pay a lot to win this war, but there is one thing they would pay more for.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, really?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Me. I murdered T'Kuvma, the Klingon messiah.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: That's absurd. I checked the officer's manifest. You're a nobody.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm not an officer. I'm Michael Burnham.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Computer, confirm.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Identity confirmed. Captain Mudd, the alien ship is hailing.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Quiet!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You'll get a lot of money for this ship, but what would I be worth to them?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh. Oh, yes. More. Much, much more. Why are you telling me this, hmm? What's in it for you?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Lieutenant Tyler.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Lieutenant Tyler is dead.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Not for long.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No. Oh!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Damn it!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: We are being hailed by the Klingons.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Son of a...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What's this?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Your chair.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What's happening? You. Hmm. You've been cheating. Passing notes in class to save your friends. Well, whatever you think you've come up with, I'll find a workaround. I'll keep resetting time until I do. Nobody beats Mudd!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets has shown us your success is a universal certainty.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Using considerable scientific methodology. This must end for all of our sakes.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: So, Harcourt Fenton Mudd, the USS Discovery is yours.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: As am I. You win.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Don't try and con a con man.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm not. I'm negotiating with a businessman. My offer's simple. The lives of my crew in exchange for Burnham, the ship and Stamets.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Why would a Federation Captain do that?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I will not have a repeat of the Buran. We will do whatever our new owners require if I have your word that you will spare the ship's complement. Your word, Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Well, I've never been one to look a gift Captain in the mouth.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You have my word. Excellent. Excellent. Good. Computer?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Working.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Send our coordinates to the awaiting Klingon vessel, courtesy of Harry Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Sending, Captain Mudd.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Now, this is your last chance to stop me. Only got about 30 seconds until we rejoin the time stream and there is no turning back.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain, incoming warp signature detected.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I never thought I'd be so happy to see those pointy-headed bastards. Oh, look at this. Five, four, three, two, one.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Captain Mudd, we are being hailed by the Klingons.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Excellent. Welcome our guests on board.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Acknowledged. Two to beam aboard.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Energise once I reach the transporter room. Come along. Meet your new masters. Ah, ah, ah, ah, ah. Not you, old man. Lorca, I'm gonna really miss killing you. Adieu, mon capitaine.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You seem very happy.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Listen, Petunia, I've been screwed over since the day I was born. I deserve this.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: So, it wasn't about Stella after all. It was always only about you. You keep talking about how you lost her because of the war, but her father's an arms dealer who's made a fortune off it. Finding either of them shouldn't be that difficult, unless you don't want to.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I never told you about Barron Grimes.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No, but Discovery's archives are non-critical systems. You probably should have disarmed them as well. And now that you don't have your time crystal, you can't learn from this mistake.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: It turns out that Stella's been looking for you. So much so that her father put out a reward.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You haven't been running to Stella.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You've been running from her.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You skipped out on the Baron's daughter with her dowry. Stella was too tempting a mark for you to resist. But ripping off her father was a risky move, Harry.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: No wonder you needed the deal with the Klingons so badly. You had to disappear.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: And you almost pulled it off, except for me, because I exist outside the normal time stream.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You think you're so smart. Have you forgotten the Klingons are beaming their way here even as we speak? Hmm? You can forget about that deal I made with Lorca. You geniuses have just condemned your crewmates to a life of servitude.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Harry, the Klingons aren't coming. I rewired the Captain's chair.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Another non-critical system. You didn't send our coordinates to your buyers.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: You sent them to Stella, and her daddy.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Turns out you can con a con man.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Let's go.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Computer, cancel transporter now!

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Denied.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Harcourt. Where have you been? I have been so worried about you.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, it's been, oh, such a tumultuous year. I can't even begin to explain.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Try.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Oh, yes. Yes, of course. Well, you know how much you meant to me. Mean. How much you mean to me. But to be brutally honest, I have led a life marred by, oh, how should we say, poor choices, debt, all kinds of blemishes to my reputation, and I couldn't enter into union with you with those pocks upon my character, so I set out to eliminate them. But alas, my plan was led astray.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Harry, I have always known who you are. nd I've never cared. We could have faced those problems together, and (sotto) Daddy would have taken care of everything else.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Consider it a consolidation of your debt under one lender. I would do anything for my daughter. And she, for better or worse, has taken to you, Mudd. And now, thanks to the action of these officers, you can finally make an honest woman of Stella. As for Starfleet, I don't intend to be in debt to your organisation. How do I repay you?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Just make sure Mister Mudd spends the rest of his days at your daughter's side, and out of Starfleet's way.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Consider it done. Come here, Harcourt, you naughty boy.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hey.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Hey.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Stamets told me in a previous timeline, that we er

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Maintenance to airlock one.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Danced.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, he... he mentioned it to me, too.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: He said I liked it. I can't imagine.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Why? I'm a really good dancer.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I didn't mean...

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Easy, Burnham. I get it.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Cargo bay airlock, repare for rapid decompression.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What I'm feeling is complicated and strange.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: It's okay. I'm not going anywhere.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: What is it?

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: I'm just sad we missed our first kiss.

Title: magic-to-make-the-sanest-man-go-mad
Dialogue: Personal log. Just as repetition reinforces repetition, change begets change. I guess the truth is, we never really know what's coming. Sometimes the only way to find out where you fit in is to step out of the routine, because sometimes where you really belong was waiting right around the corner all along.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: This is Captain T'Shen Kovil of the Federation Starship Gagarin. We are under attack. I repeat, we are under attack by six Klingon vessels. Any Starfleet ship in range, please respond.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: This is USS Discovery. We've got your back.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Klingon vessels locking weapons on us.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Detmer, evasive pattern beta nine.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Acknowledged.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Mister Rhys, could I trouble you to fire at something?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Rhys?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I see them, Captain.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Owosekun, got anything? Owosekun.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Negative, sir. I have power signatures that are off the charts, but our sensors can't seem to isolate the individual ships when they have those invisibility screens up.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: They can't fire till they're visible. Keep our fingers on the trigger. Get ready to move quickly. Understood?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Hard to port, Detmer. Mister Rhys, lock on the Bird-of-Prey targeting Gagarin.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Shields holding at seventy percent.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Thanks for the assist, Discovery.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Doesn't look like a fair fight to me, Kovil. Can you go to warp?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Warp engines are down. Our shields are almost gone.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Sir, a Klingon destroyer just decloaked right under Gagarin.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We've picked up two battle cruisers. They're flanking us, sir.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Just concentrate fire on the destroyer.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Shields holding at thirty two percent.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Two Birds-of-Prey approaching, sir.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Right, get us in between the Klingons and the Gagarin.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Direct hit, Captain. Shields below ten percent.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Did we get both torpedoes? Did we get them both?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I don't know, sir. I can't

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The Gagarin's gone. It's over. Black alert. Get us out of here.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Black alert. Black alert.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Bridge to Engineering, are you ready to jump?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Lieutenant?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I'm ready.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Aye, Captain. Spore drive ready.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Go.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: There will be time to grieve. This is not that time. I want a full damage report immediately. Airiam, you have the conn.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Feel all right, Lieutenant?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What are you doing down here, Captain?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Sorry, what?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Did you just call me Captain?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: That's absurd. Why would I do that?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I don't know. I must

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Are you daydreaming on the job? Are you so bored here that your mind is wandering?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: No, sir. I'm sorry, I didn't, er, mean to...

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Well then, don't.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Where were the other ships patrolling this sector? Why were we the only Starfleet vessel able to render aid?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The Hoover and the Muroc were simultaneously ambushed along with the Gagarin. All were destroyed. How many of the Klingon ships you engaged were equipped with invisibility screens?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: All of them. All six.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Then our latest intelligence reports are confirmed. Kol of House Kor has managed to revive the Klingon Ship of the Dead, and is now sharing its stealth technology with any House that will offer him fealty. Eventually, every ship in the Klingon armada will be able to attack us out of nowhere. That makes your mission at Pahvo Starfleet's highest priority. What is your team's status?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: They transported to the surface eighteen hours ago, and have maintained radio silence to avoid detection by the Klingons.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We lost 462 souls today, Captain. And that number will increase exponentially until we are able to detect those invisible ships. I'm certain I have made myself clear.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Abundantly.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Personal log, Specialist Michael Burnham. Stardate 1308.9. We landed on Pahvo eighteen hours ago. It's a seemingly uninhabited planet, but a unique and, for us, strategic one. Every tree, rock, and blade of grass here vibrates with its own specific tone. Together, these combine to form a kind of music - the signature sound of the planet, heard everywhere on the surface. The sound is even broadcast into space by a towering crystal structure, a sort of naturally occurring transmitter. It is Starfleet's plan to modify the electromagnetic frequency of Pahvo's signal and harness it as a form of sonar that can detect the presence of the cloaked Klingon vessels decimating our fleet, make them visible to our sensors, and turn the tide of war in our favour.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The transmitter's still 8.4 kilometres north-northeast.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You've been setting an accelerated pace since we got here. It's unfortunate that the transmitter's interference meant we had to beam down thirty kilometres away, but look around, it could be worse.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Yeah. It's two days until pick-up. We're making great time.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Perhaps it's a great time for you humans. I, of course, could make it there in fifteen minutes.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Didn't know you were such a sprinter, Mister Saru.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
