Dialogue: Kelpiens pursued by apex predators have exceeded speeds of eighty kilometres per hour. They can also sense predators from as much as ten kilometres.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: And we particularly enjoy being discussed in the third person while present.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: But you are accurate. I possess visual, auditory, and tactile receptors more acute than yours, which is why I am being tortured by this planet's constant noise, and you are not.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Well, I can hear that. What's going on?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Keep this pointed at the ground. Greetings. We are explorers from the Federation Starship Discovery. We come in peace.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Thought this planet was uninhabited.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: It's not registering as a lifeform, sir. According to this, it's actually not distinguishable from the rest of the forest.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I believe it wants us to accompany it.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The transmitter's in the opposite direction.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: General Kol.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The scar is an improvement, L'Rell.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Earned in battle. I wear it with pride. Congratulations. House after House has vowed their allegiance to you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Do not mistake me for your fallen idol T'Kuvma. He sought unity. I seek only Klingon supremacy under my rule.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The dissemination of the cloaking technology has earned you many loyalists. I wish to count myself, my House, among them.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Your loyalty isn't enough. What else can you offer me?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: My skills as an interrogator. My spies tell me you have a prisoner who refuses to speak.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Bring me some information that will add to my glory, and I will consider your request.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What's it saying?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Universal translator's got nothing.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I don't think they mean us any harm.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You can't know that.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: If their intentions were nefarious, I would be the first to sense a threat. We need to establish communication. (he removes his equipment vest) I am Commander Saru. As a First Contact specialist, I would like permission to analyse the sound you are emitting to determine if it is a form of language.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Are you all right?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: It was not painful, just disorienting. I believe I felt their intentions, their desire to converse. This will take some time.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We can't touch that transmitter now.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: General Order 1?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: No. Order 1 restricts us from revealing ourselves to sentient beings that aren't warp-capable. We're well beyond that. Now our duty is to follow First Contact protocol, and we can't borrow or alter their property without them understanding our objective and agreeing to it.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Scream. I said, scream.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: No.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Good. You were convincing. The guard is gone. Now we can talk.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You think Saru can make the Pahvans understand why we need their transmitter?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: He's got to. Convincing them to let us complete our mission is the only way.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Then we defeat the Klingons.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: And the war ends.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Easy.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Easy.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: When all this fighting is over, I've got big plans. I own a little place at Lake Shasta. I take a little sailboat on the water. Lake's full of trout this time of year. Ever had fresh-roasted trout?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I haven't.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What? It's actual heaven. I'll camp on the beach, watch the stars fall.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Sounds perfect.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Our futures look different. You go back to your lake house and I go back to prison. My sentence was life. This is just temporary.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Well, maybe we just leave that transmitter alone. You can't go back to prison if we're still at war.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The needs of the many

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Are worth fighting for. Are worth dying for. But so are the needs of the few.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Or the one?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: (sotto) Come here.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Okay. What is going on with you?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: At first, the Tardigrade DNA booster seemed like a good thing, but now you're back to your old persnickety, grumpy self. So, what's the deal?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Nothing. You're dismissed, Cadet. Okay, I'll admit that something has been happening to me. One minute, I know where I am, who you are, what I'm doing, and then, all of a sudden, what I know changes. It gets jumbled.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Have you told Doctor Culber about this?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: That would put Hugh in an impossible position. As a medical officer, it would be his duty to report the effects of my genetic manipulation. I'd be sent to a Federation lab to be poked and prodded. On the other hand, if he doesn't tell and Starfleet finds out, his career would be ruined. Either way, I hurt him.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Okay. We'll monitor these episodes. Hopefully, they'll pass, right? You don't seem reassured. Usually I'm pretty good at providing that. That's kind of my thing.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What happens to those who Starfleet captures?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: In war? They're imprisoned, interrogated humanely. Eventually, they're returned to their people as part of any final peace settlement.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: So you do not execute them.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The Federation has no death penalty.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I wish to defect. There's nothing here for me now. The p'taQ my people now follow has no honour. It is because of Kol I am alone. I had like-minded brothers and sisters, even the one chosen by Lord T'Kuvma to be his successor. But he was chased away. Forever gone. Everyone is gone. My vessel is in a nearby hangar. Kahless willing, we will use it to both escape with our lives, and you will guarantee me safe passage onto your ship.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: My ship?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Discovery. I know its shuttle delivered you to the trap on Cancri IV.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Why should I trust you?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Because we need each other, Admiral. And what other option do you have?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: How far did you get?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We are still establishing a vocabulary. So, not very far.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Are they native to this planet?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: They are the planet. Everywhere you go, you can feel the symbiosis between nature and the living spirit. Amazing to think that while we fight our war, a place of peace and harmony not only survives, it thrives.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Is the transmitter their creation?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I can't be sure, but they desperately want to know others and to be known, and have been trying to share who they are with the rest of the universe since since the beginning of their existence.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You look exhausted.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: It's the constant noise generated by this planet. It's better when I'm with our Pahvan friend, but still, it is ubiquitous.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Do you think you can relay the details of our mission to it before the Discovery comes back to collect us?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Well, I sincerely hope so. For now, I think it would be best to call it a night.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Can you please make it stop? Even for a moment?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We were biologically determined for one purpose and one purpose alone. I sense the coming of death. I sense it coming now. We have come to Pahvo for your help. We have come to end this war. I'm so afraid. So afraid.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Oh, hello, Commander. Looks like someone got some sleep.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You do seem better.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I am, thank you. I just apprised the Captain of our new circumstances.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: How did you do that? Discovery's not supposed to be in comm range right now.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Oh, a simple modification. I altered the frequency of my communicator, linking it to the planet's transmitter. It boosted the signal sufficiently.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Our new friend was okay with that?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The Pahvans are incredibly hospitable. They will grant us anything we want.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: So you're saying we have permission to complete our mission as planned?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Some parameters of the mission have changed. I require your communicators. Thank you so very much.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Oh, do not be alarmed. These are no longer necessary. The Pahvans have invited us to remain here with them.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We can't do that, Commander.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: In time, you will experience this world as I do. You must remain open to it. Even your limited sensory abilities will improve eventually.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Saru, something has happened to you. You are not thinking clearly.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Not at all. The Pahvans have found a way to exist in perfect balance and absolute harmony with their world. They have already achieved everything we say we seek through our exploratory and diplomatic efforts. The only answers we require for the advancement of all species is here, and it's ours for the taking. I must go tell our hosts we have accepted their offer. They will be so happy.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: One thing's for sure, he lied about the Captain. There's no way he cut us loose.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Obviously Saru has been compromised.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We can't abandon the mission.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I'm not sure we actually have the Pahvans' permission.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You wanna wait for the Pahvans' permission? There won't be any Pahvans if we don't proceed.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You know the Federation has procedures. No starship may interfere with the normal development of any alien life or society.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Saru said they would grant us anything, right? Well, modifying the transmitter is included in anything.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: But we can't trust anything he says.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Michael, this may be our only way of ending the war.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What about Saru?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: This isn't up for debate. Given Saru's condition, I'm the senior officer now.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Certain we can get to your ship undetected?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I know this vessel as if it were my home. It was my home, once. First I am ensuring the end of Kol's days. He neglected T'Kuvma's message. He desecrated this vessel with his fetid presence. Before we depart, I will set the ship's warp core to overload.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: He really disappointed you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: He disgusts me. My only regret is that I will not be able to see his pretty painted face as he takes his final breath.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: L'Rell, where are you taking the prisoner?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You're not what I expected.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Neither are you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: At least you won't die in a cage, Admiral.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: She took my blade and tried to escape. I will dispose of the body.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: There will be no synthetic protein rations tonight, Lieutenant. Where's Burnham?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We had a fight. She's walking it off.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I am sorry. But soon you will know what it means to exist without conflict. I'm going to find Burnham. She must be starving.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Er, Commander? Can I ask you something? When we first came here, the sounds of this place, you said, were like a physical assault. What changed?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I believe I was the problem. I did not understand what I was perceiving. I was not yet in harmony. The Pahvans helped me. Sounds like you were fighting something, then you just stopped.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I don't know how to do that.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What is it you are fighting?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Well, everybody wants to defeat the Klingons. I... I wanna hurt them.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: They tortured you. The feeling is understandable. But all that is past now.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You don't just forget something like that. You can't.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: What's the other option? Allowing it to transform you into something worse than those who did this?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: If it means I can make them suffer like they made me suffer, then yes.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Come here, Lieutenant. The Pahvans gave me something you might find useful.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Understanding requires a common frame of reference. Try to feel the harmony, the peace this world offers.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Your intentions are false. You've been trying to distract me, to delay me.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Where is Burnham? Where has she gone?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Come on, come on, come on.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Yes.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Grafk. Torath. Silrek.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I will end Kol. I will avenge you all. I swear it to you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Come on, come on, come on, come on, come on. Yeah. Michael Burnham to Discovery. Discovery, do you read me?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Saru, please, stop.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Saru, this isn't you. Is this what harmony and balance look like? Where is the peace you say you found here?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You have taken it from me. You won't stop taking.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I would give anything for a second, a millisecond, of peace. But until the war is over, none of us can have it. Saru, staying here, it's not gonna fix anything. We have the power to end this conflict. Saru, we need you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You will not take this away from me, too.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Burnham. Are you okay?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: (to the Pahvans) I am sorry. I was trying to protect you. You have to make them all understand. We were wrong to come here. Our war is not your mistake to correct.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Please listen. Saru told you who we are, and like you, we seek harmony. But we face a threat that doesn't share that same goal. But with your help and our technology, we can put an end to this conflict. Isn't that why you exist? To keep harmony and peace? You have to help me finish what I've begun.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: If the Klingons discover you've helped us, they will hurt you. Please, don't do this.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Discovery to landing party. We have a lock on your coordinates. Prepare for transport.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: No. No, please. No.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Keep it brief.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Thank you. Saru, please look at me. Are you all right?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I lied to you and Lieutenant Tyler. I attacked you. I could have killed you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You weren't yourself.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: But I was. We are born afraid, we Kelpiens. It's how we survive. As such, my whole life, I have never known a moment without fear. The freedom of it. Not one moment. Until Pahvo.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Before her escape, the human confirmed that Discovery possesses a powerful technology. Were it replicated, your conquest could reach far beyond the limits of our Empire.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I had hoped for more. You were reckless.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I was effective.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: She got away from you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Not for long. General Kol, if you don't see my value, I will take my leave now.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Stop! L'Rell. (she kneels) There will be more prisoners before this war finds its end. A skilled interrogator will be crucial as long as you vow allegiance to House Kor.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: My Lord, I would be honoured to serve you.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Did you think I would not see through your deceit? Show her how House Kor treats liars.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: My Lord! We have intercepted a massive signal from a planet called Pahvo.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: A message?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: An invitation.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Set a course for Pahvo.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: You said the adjustment to the Pahvan transmitter was a success.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: I thought it was, sir. The Pahvans repaired our signal inhibitor after Saru destroyed it. I watched it happen.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Mister Bryce?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: The signal strength has increased by a factor of ten to the 12th power. The music's gone. All that's being transmitted now is a massive electromagnetic wave.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Captain, I don't understand. The Pahvans

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Sir, Specialist Burnham integrated our technology exactly as ordered. We should now be able to detect any invisible Klingon ships - within range of the Pahvans' signal.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Apparently not. The transmitter's sending out a new signal, limited to two subspace bands. Ours and the Klingons'. What you did, Burnham, was invite the enemy to join us here.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: No. The Pahvans did that. Their entire existence is an effort to bring harmony to discord, and they know about our conflict. They're trying to bring us together. They think they're helping.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Captain, long-range sensors have detected an incoming Klingon vessel entering the system at high warp.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: Can you identify what it is?

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: It's the Ship of the Dead, sir. The Sarcophagus.

Title: si-vis-pacem-para-bellum
Dialogue: We're the Pahvans' only line of defence. We have to protect them, sir. We have to fight.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: We have ordered all active starships back behind Federation lines. Retreat, Captain. That is an order.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: With the Ship of the Dead on the way here?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Yes. Kol's next strategic move will be to destroy the transmitter, thus eliminating any chance of the Federation gaining an upper hand. But we cannot risk losing the Discovery over this.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Need I remind you the Klingons don't take threats lightly? By seeming to align themselves with us, the Pahvans just became one. That ship can and will destroy an entire planet in the blink of an eye.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Your mission to Pahvo was to give us the advantage we sorely needed, but that mission failed. We have gathered the top scientific minds to devise a solution to crack the invisibility screens that cloak the Klingon warships within the safety of Federation space. Your crew is to join the effort.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You want me to run from a fight and leave a peaceful species to face annihilation.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I'm sorry, but the logic is clear. You will jump to Starbase 46. Immediately.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Lieutenant Detmer. Set a course for Starbase 46. Warp five.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Sir, the Pahvans are more vulnerable than Admiral Terral could possibly understand. Please, if I could only speak with him and relay my experience with their peace-loving species.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: At this speed, they'll be expecting us in three hours at Starbase 46. That's why we're warping and not using the spore drive. I have no intention of reaching our destination. But if you're planning on disobeying a direct order, best not to advertise the fact. So, you all heard the panicked Admiral. Starfleet is tired of fighting the Klingon cloaking devices and losing. So am I. We have just under three hours to find a solution. If we can, we jump back, defend Pahvo. If we can't... Let's get to it. Lieutenant Stamets. I'm gonna need some reasonable explanation for Starfleet as to why we're currently not using the spore drive. I understand you've had some trouble with your interface upgrades.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Now that you mention it, has been a little itchy.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: That's unfortunate. Get down to medical bay, get a full examination.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Is... is that completely necessary, sir?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: It's obligatory. I want Doctor Culber to run every single test possible. We need the data trail.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Two hours before we arrive at the Starbase. Less than that, probably before the Klingons arrive at Pahvo. Tell me you have a solution.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Currently We suspect the Klingon cloak generates a massive gravitational field, one that bends light and other electromagnetic waves around the ship.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Essentially rendering it undetectable to our sensors.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: But the cloak has small imperfections, so what appears like background EM radiation actually contains near-imperceptible shifts that correlate to the cloak's gravitational field.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: If we can determine the exact relationship between the two, we could develop an algorithm to expose any invisible ship's position.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The imperfections are infinitesimal. How do we detect them?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: By placing sensors onboard the Klingon ship to relay data back to Discovery.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: On the ship? With a boarding party? One that has to physically beam over? All right. How do we get our people there?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The Klingons know that Discovery is a valuable target. We use it as bait to draw their flagship away from Pahvo. They'd have to drop the cloak to engage us in battle.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Their shields and weapons are offline when they're invisible, so it gives us a small window to beam over after the cloak is down, but before their shields go up.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The team on board the Klingon ship will install two sensors. Every time it cloaks, we gather readings.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: There is a problem, though, sir. It will take time to gather sufficient data.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: How much time?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Days.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Well, we don't have days, but we do have a spore drive.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Gentlemen. Starfleet brass is awaiting a full report on the Lieutenant's condition.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Well, you wanted evidence of an issue with your navigator? You've gotten more than you've asked for. Lieutenant Stamets' scans show a restructuring of the tracks within the white matter of his medial temporal lobe.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Have you experienced any side effects as a consequence of that?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: No, Captain.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Okay.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Well, I'm not ready to play roulette with his brain.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Duly noted, Doctor. Send the report directly to me.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: To me, Doctor, and I shall read it. Lieutenant, follow me.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You want me to make 133 jumps?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Micro-jumps. Each one performed in rapid succession will provide a three-dimensional snapshot of the cloaked Klingon ship's position. The readings will be received from every necessary vector in under four minutes.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: That will give us the data to calculate the algorithm, but it'll take time to compute something that complex.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I have faith in Mister Saru.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, there has to be another way. You

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I wish there were. I wish I didn't have to ask you to make this sacrifice, but the Klingons won't stop until they've destroyed everything, everyone. And we can't stop them without the spore drive. Without you.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: But you're asking us to use the drive in ways we've never conceived of. The spore-delivery system isn't configured to handle the amount of volume that would be required.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: And that's gonna stop you? I don't think so. I know what drives you, Lieutenant. You're not just a scientist, you're an explorer. You could've stayed in a lab on Earth, but you chose to go where no one has gone before. Let me show you something.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You've been accumulating this data from my jumps the whole time?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Mmm-hmm.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: And these scattered pockets of negative mass, it's... They could indicate alternative parallel universes connected to the mycelial network. And with more jumps, we could find a pattern, perhaps even the coordinates to reach them.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You showed me this invention could take us to places that we never dreamed we could reach. Places far beyond our preconceptions of time and space.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, I didn't know you cared.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: We have to win this war. But then...

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Then the journey continues. If we can save Pahvo, defeat the Klingons, and do all this? 133 jumps it is.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Lieutenant Tyler, prep a boarding party for the Klingon ship. Two people, in and out.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I recommend Specialist Burnham accompany me, sir.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Out of the question. It's too dangerous.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The effectiveness of our sensors depends on their placement at the points closest to the Klingon vessel's stern and bow. But their Bridge is roughly four times the size of any Federation ship. I've been there. Only one location will work. Lieutenant Tyler doesn't know how to access it. I do.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Then you'll tell someone else where it is. You're not going.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Sir, you offered me a place on this ship

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: And now I'm ordering you to stay. Is that understood?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You are the Captain, but you are not using the full resources to ensure the success of your mission. There is no logic to your thinking. Unless this is about me. I'm here on borrowed time. When you asked me to stay, it was to help you win this war. Given the time I spent on that Klingon vessel, I'm the most qualified crew member to place those sensors. Otherwise, I have no purpose here.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Fine. Execute the mission as ordered, and get back here safely.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Thank you, Captain.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I know better than to ask you not to do this, but I will ask you to allow me to take precautions.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I'm so glad he finally told you about the side effects.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Side effects?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Oh my God, oh my God, I'm sorry. I just assumed... CULBER No, it's okay, Tilly. I'm sure the Lieutenant has a good explanation for keeping that a secret.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Hugh.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: There's no time. This cuff will let me treat you while you're in the chamber.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: We are about to face the most difficult challenge we have ever attempted.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Today, we stare down the bow of the Ship of the Dead. The very same ship that took thousands of our own at the Battle of the Binary Stars. When I took command of this vessel, you were a crew of polite scientists. Now, I look at you, and you are fierce warriors all. No other Federation vessel would have a chance of pulling this off. Just us. Because mark my words, you will look back proudly, and tell the world you were there the day the USS Discovery saved Pahvo and ended the Klingon war.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Sir, long-range sensors have detected the power signature of a cloaked Klingon vessel entering Pahvo's orbit.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Transporter room, stand by.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Let's jump back to Pahvo.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: My Lord, It's the USS Discovery. They've appeared in orbit around Pahvo. Their weapons are online.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Hmm. So Starfleet sends their most prized, enchanted vessel to defend the planet alone. The humans are fools. Prepare to drop cloak and fire. We will storm her decks, execute her crew, and take her storied weapon for our own. We will destroy this hideous planet Pahvo and its transmitter. This war will be ours!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: This war will be ours!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Astrometrics to Bridge. Requesting sensor priority

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: These pattern simulators will mask our human life signs.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Locking on. Got it.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Sir, Lieutenant Tyler and Specialist Burnham have successfully beamed aboard the Klingon vessel.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Excellent. Detmer, evasive pattern lambda ten. Let's keep the Klingons engaged so Burnham and Tyler can plant those sensors.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Gonna be a bumpy ride.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Clear.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Pattern simulators are online. Our life signs are masked as Klingon. First drop point is six hundred metres this way.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Let's get moving.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Uplink to Discovery established.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Which way to the Bridge?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Out this door, down that passage.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: One down, one to go.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I'm detecting a human life sign onboard.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: None of our intel on General Kol pointed to a potential Federation prisoner.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: If we have a chance to rescue one of our people, we have to take it.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Burnham, we can't deviate from the mission.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The life sign isn't far from the Bridge. Just on the opposite side. It might even provide us a location to wait out the jumps. I have to bring everyone home.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Mmm-hmm.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You have sixty seconds to crack that, or we proceed to the Bridge. Let me try. Hi. Spent seven months in a Klingon prison?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Admiral.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: It's you.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Admiral, I'm Specialist Burnham. Can you move?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I can't feel my legs.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Tyler.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Tyler! Here. I'm here. I'm here. Here, come on.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Is he injured?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: He was a victim of Klingon torture.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: State your mission, Specialist Burnham.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain Lorca dispatched us to install sensors aboard this ship so we could break the Klingon cloak.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I've treated patients with PTSD symptoms. He's in shock. He's not gonna be of any help to you anytime soon.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I have to make it to the Bridge.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You're leaving me?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I don't have a choice. Here. (gives her a phaser) Discovery'll beam us out when the time comes. Tyler, can you hear me? I'm gonna see this mission through. I meant what I said. Everybody comes home.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Sharper! Anticipate her moves!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Uplink to Discovery established.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, the second sensor is online. Standing by to receive data as soon as the Klingon vessel cloaks.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Then let's make it happen. Black alert.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Mister Rhys, be ready to fire our torpedoes when we come out of the jump. Remember our people are on board, so just a scratch.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Let's give 'em a little taste of what the Discovery is capable of.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: What is it doing?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: My Lord, the Federation ship has vanished without a trace.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: So, this is Discovery's fabled power. Cloak us at once.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, The Ship of the Dead is cloaking.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Right on schedule.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The sensors are transmitting the cloaking frequency.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Commence jump sequence.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Engaging spore drive jump in five, four, three

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Two, one.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I love you.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Go.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Our sensors have begun transmitting the data. Keep it up, Mister Stamets. Just finish the jumps and we'll have what we need.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Heart rate is at 182. Tilly, how many jumps do we have left?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Ninety six more.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Tyler, you need to focus on my voice. You're safe. Burnham will return shortly. What you are experiencing are the effects of past trauma. I know it doesn't feel like that, believe me. What you're seeing is just a memory. You are right here with me.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Make them stop. Make them st...

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: They didn't break you then, so they are not gonna break you now. Normal breath in, slow breath out. Good. Keep that up.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Jump 59. Jump 60. Jump 61. Jump 62.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: How are we doing, Lieutenant?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: There's a clearing in the forest. That's how they go.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Jump 63.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Engineering to Bridge.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: We have to abort.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: We have seventy jumps left, Doctor.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: His sinoatrial node is firing at over two hundred per minute.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Call it off now.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You do what you have to to keep him alive till he finishes the jumps. Trillions of lives are at stake.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Jump 64.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: That's an order, Doctor.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Administering digoxin. Two point four cc's. I love you, too.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Jump 65.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: My Lord, sentry reports signs of possible sabotage. Sector 37, near the burial chamber.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: L'Rell. She must have escaped. Find her, and cut off her legs. She will be dealt with after we leave this place. Engage the warp drive.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: My Lord?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: This display from the Starfleet ship is part of a ruse, and I do not intend to let myself be fooled. Engage the warp drive.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Intruder alert!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: General Kol, I wish to talk.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Who is that? You speak Klingon? Show yourself.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: This device is a universal translator. An example of human ingenuity.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: All I see is another attempt by humanity to rob us of our identity.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: It's proof of our desire to communicate.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Is that why you're here on my ship, Starfleet intruder?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You are Kol. You took T'Kuvma's place.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: And have you come here to take the place of the human that this belongs to?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I thought Klingons were honourable.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: As if you understand honour.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Where is the honour of taking a ship that doesn't belong to you? You had no hand in the battle that caused this war. You were not here when T'Kuvma fell.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: And how would you know such things?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Because I was here. I'm the one who killed T'Kuvma.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Lieutenant, we're about to have company. Tyler, there's only so much I can do when I can't move my legs.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: For the love of God, get up. Burnham is in danger and she needs your help.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You killed T'Kuvma? Hmm. Then this belonged to your Captain.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Her name was Captain Philippa Georgiou. I regret that my actions that day have locked our people into this war.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: While I thank you for it. My rise to power would not be possible if not for the assassination of T'Kuvma. Lock her up. Once I return with the slayer of their messiah, what remains of T'Kuvma's torch-bearing fools will have no choice but to fall in line.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: If you are to capture me, then prove your worth. T'Kuvma defeated the woman whom that belonged to. Do me the same honour.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I accept your challenge, human.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Kill her! Now!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Three, two, one.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Jump protocol complete.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Number One, how's that algorithm coming?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Computer estimates five minutes until data analysis is complete and we're able to break through the cloak.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: We're sitting ducks.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, I suggest jumping to safety until the cloak has been penetrated.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Why aren't they firing? They're thinking of leaving. I would. We're not going anywhere until we have Burnham and Tyler back.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Kol! Kol! Kol!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Your death will secure my place as absolute ruler of the Klingon Empire.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, I've got it. The algorithm is ready. We have their cloaking signature. Transferring to Transporter room control.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Bring them home, Number One.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Locking on. Discovery to Tyler.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Ready to transport.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Tyler to Discovery. I have two to transport. Burnham's on the Bridge.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Confirmed. We'll pull you in first.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Gonna get you out of here.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Is victory to be mine so easily?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Specialist Burnham, prepare to transport.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: No, it's not. And neither is this.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Sir, Lieutenant Tyler and Specialist Burnham are safely back aboard, along with Admiral Cornwell, who's been injured, and a Klingon prisoner who's been taken into custody.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Extra prize. All right. Load all available photon torpedoes. Target the enemy ship.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Target acquired, sir. We can see them.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: And fire.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Character: TERREL  Admiral Cornwell's emergency medical shuttle has successfully arrived at Starbase 88. She is currently undergoing surgery. I'm told she should make a total recovery. LORCA
Dialogue: That's excellent news. Make sure to send her my best. The planet of Pahvo is safe, the cloak-breaking algorithm is being refined for fleet-wide use as we speak, and will be transmitted on a secure channel to you in just under eleven hours. TERREL [on monitor] The sooner, the better. There are reports of cloaked Klingon vessels advancing on our borders, and on you. The war is not won yet, but you have increased the likelihood of a victory for Starfleet, despite your unorthodox methods.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I'm gonna take that as a compliment. TERREL [on monitor] Now it is time for Discovery to return to safety. Report to Starbase 46. You will find that your accomplishments have not gone unnoticed. Starfleet Command would like to award you with the Legion of Honour. I look forward to congratulating you in person.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Transmission ended.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Cadet Decker, please report to the Ready room. Lieutenant Calhoun, please report to the Bridge.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Looks like you cleaned up nicely.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Doctor Culber.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You want to come in?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: It's gone, the Ship of the Dead. The planet of Pahvo is safe. We did that.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: No. You did that. So, thank you for not giving up on me back there.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I need to know something. You put on a facade. Like everything that's happened to you just washes off. I actually envied that about you. But when you saw that Klingon... Who is she to you?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I think you already know.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You were her prisoner.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Yeah. Her name's L'Rell. She's the reason I've had nightmares every night since Captain Lorca and I fled her ship. She's also the only reason I'm still alive. Two hundred and twenty seven days, but it only took one of them to realise I wasn't gonna make it out alive, not unless I made a choice.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: What did you do?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I survived. That... that Klingon was more than just my captor. She was my torturer. One who took a particular interest in me. And I saw a way out. A way to live past day one, day ten, day twenty, day ninety seven. I encouraged it. Her sick affections, her obsession with me, necause if I hadn't, I'd be dead, like all the others. And I got out. I get to keep living my life. But the thing is, if none of that had happened, I wouldn't be here on this ship with you. And that almost makes it worth it. Is that weird?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: No. I'm glad you're here, too. You get to live your life the way you deserve to. Not at war but at peace.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I found peace. Right here.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: They wanted to give me a medal for leading the mission, saving Pahvo, if you can believe the irony. I told them to give it to you.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: That's er, not necessary, sir.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You made the jumps. You risked everything. None of it would've been possible without you. You did it so well, the Klingons are on their way, hell-bent on revenge. I wish we could stay and fight, but Starfleet wants us back at Starbase 46.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Do you need me to jump?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: No, I'd never ask that of you. You've done enough. We'll warp to Starbase 46. We'll be fine.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: But the Klingons. I'll do one more jump to get the crew back to safety. They've risked enough already.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: If you're sure. Thank you. We're gonna win this war on account of you, Mister Stamets. After this, it's a whole new chapter for Discovery. You've opened a door to a whole new era of exploration. The data provided by the micro-jumps will push us closer than we've ever been before to understanding the mysteries of the universe.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: No, Captain, I mean only one more jump. After we get back, I'm done. Travelling the mycelial network is like commingling with the most abstruse blips of our celestial existence. I've seen these stars through a lens no one else has access to, and that has to be enough for me, because I need Starfleet's best doctors to examine my condition and figure out what's been happening to me.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: One last jump, then. You've served the Federation honourably, Lieutenant.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Well, I'll always have you to thank for the view.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: You ready?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: What did you do to me?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Do not worry. I will never let them hurt you.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Command stations. Command stations.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Soon.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Mister Stamets?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Shall we dock this weary vessel?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Yes, Captain. There is a moon near Starbase 46, and I understand they have the most esteemed Kasseelian opera house, where they are currently performing La Boheme. I could be your date.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Are you saying you'll actually sit through that with me?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Just this jump, and then I'm going to have a lot of free time on my hands.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Let's go home.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Talk to me, Cadet.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: The computer is reading it as an incomplete navigation sequence.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: He's crashing. I'm detecting white matter hyperintensity.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: What's wrong with him? What's happening to his eyes?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: So many. I can see them all. Infinite permutations. It's magnificent.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Paul! Paul!

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Ship-wide status.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Some structural damage, but all systems are holding.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Mister Saru, what am I looking at?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: I... I'm not quite sure. But I'm unable to confirm our position using standard procedures. Sensors are going haywire.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Where is our Starbase?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Not where it should be.

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Is that Klingon wreckage surrounding us?

Title: into-the-forest-i-go
Dialogue: Captain, I'm afraid I don't know where we are.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yellow alert.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yellow alert.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: This isn't Starbase 46. Where the hell are we?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Our... our sensors are erh, recalibrating, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What happened here? I don't remember reports of battles anywhere near Organia.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Blast scoring and damage patterns are consistent with Federation weapons, but the hull signatures are a little off.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Off?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Wreckage is Klingon, but hull density analysis is registering outside acceptable margins.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Is anything here a threat?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No life signs or active power signatures.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Small favours.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain, our navigational array is malfunctioning. According to these readings, we've jumped to our intended coordinates, and our position, relative to the galactic centre, is confirmed. But almost nothing else is where it's supposed to be.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Nice of you to join us, Mister Tyler. I know it was only a yellow alert...

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm sorry, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain? A vessel is approaching at sub-light speed.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Seems like a Vulcan cruiser.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: On screen.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, the Vulcans must be the ones who destroyed those Klingons.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Shall we hail them, sir?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, open a channel.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Unidentified Vulcan cruiser, this is the USS Discovery. Please respond.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain. The Vulcans are powering up weapons.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They must have registered an active Klingon ship somewhere nearby.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Red alert. Shields up.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Detmer, evasive pattern beta four pi.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They're doubling back.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm unable to lock on, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Do it manually, shoot in their general direction.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Where did that assist come from?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Incoming transmission from the Cooper, sir. Audio only.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Cooper? Isn't she supposed to be undergoing a refit? Send it through.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Spooked by rebels, Discovery? You're losing your edge. Don't worry, we'll take care of them. Cooper out.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Vulcan rebels? Firing on Starfleet?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Engineering, what's the status of the spore drive?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets is non-responsive.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: He's stabilised, but there's no way he can get back into that reaction cube.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Spore drive is offline, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I may have something. The quantum signature of the Cooper, as well as that of the Vulcan cruiser, are inconsistent with ours.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's not possible. All matter native to our universe resonates with the same quantum signature. Nothing can change it.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's true. Unless... this is not our universe.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Obviously, the idea of parallel worlds has been around since the 20th century.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And you and Stamets believed the spore drive could jump between them?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, it was a theory I was working on. Stamets was keen to chase it with me after the war.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: But, these areas don't correlate to anything in the known universe.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We suspected the mycelial network extended way beyond anything we'd imagined.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: A vast system underpinning all quantum realities.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: But the exact coordinates of some of the more esoteric destinations eluded us. Apparently, the 133 jumps we made filled in the gaps.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: An extraordinarily fortunate coincidence.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'd say unfortunate, wouldn't you, Number One?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It's worse than that. The Klingon cloak-breaking algorithm we'd been refining. There's no way we can send that back to Starfleet now.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's why we have to make it back. Otherwise, the ships are just sitting ducks. The war's as good as lost.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, Stamets brought us here accidentally, so we should examine the spore drive's navigational logs more closely. There could be an indication

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I just pushed Stamets too hard, and the number of jumps scrambled his ability to hold the coordinates for Starbase 46 in his head. Now, what we need to do is understand where we are and how to survive. Then we'll find a way home. Recalibrate the sensors, and you start looking at the records. See if there's something we can learn.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It's a palace. Stay close.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets, please don't hate me, but what is the spore germination rate again? And, erh, I know you always have to remind me, but, er, the ideal moisture level in the cultivation bay, is, is it 85% or 87% relative humidity? I was just, I was hoping I could, um, maybe jog his memory with familiar things. Mainly, how annoying he finds me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: He's in a state of neurological disregulation unlike any I've ever seen.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It's a palace.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Paul.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: To the palace.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Paul, no.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Oh, my God.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm okay.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm so sorry. I should have told you as soon as I found out about the side-effects from the jumps. I shouldn't have kept it a secret.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Paul is your superior officer, he gave you an order. You didn't do this.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Speak of the devil.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Cadet. Excuse us.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: How is he?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Alternately catatonic, and then prone to bursts of nonsensical speech. He's contained for his own safety, and his adrenals are spiking uncontrollably. I don't know if he'll ever be the same, let alone if he'll ever jump again.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yeah, I know you blame me for this, and you're right. I'm his Captain. I'm responsible for his well-being.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes. You were. Fortunately, his well-being falls to me now.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm afraid not. I've decided to hand his case over to another doctor.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Medicine requires professional objectivity, Doctor Culber, and your bias, your personal bias compromises that, and compromises his recovery.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Oh, suddenly, you care about protocol. You wanted me to fake Stamet's medical records as a smoke screen. I bought you time so that you could push him into all those jumps and break the Klingon cloak.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: So he did. So we did.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm the most qualified to care for him. Do you even want him to get better? Or did you want all of this to happen?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You're clearly much too emotional to be able to handle this. Maybe I let my emotions carry me away. My need to win the war. And look where it got us. You have your orders.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm detecting what looks to be a Klingon central data core in that wreckage. It's inside a larger debris array about 200 metres ahead of you.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Glad the sensors are working again. Vulcan high-level math, Specialist?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And some good old-fashioned human know-how, Lieutenant.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Copy that.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Readings are good, Captain. I think the data core is intact. If we can bring it on board, we can get a crash course on what those Klingons knew about this universe.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Proceed with the extraction.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Closing in on the cockpit.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The core is likely part of the main computer located at the rear of the ship. It should be easy enough to extract.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm seeing bodies in there.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Why can't he maintain a course? Is the flight control malfunctioning? Burnham.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: There are no life signs in that wreckage, Lieutenant. You're all clear.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Ready to proceed? Tyler.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What the hell is he doing? Lieutenant Tyler, get in there and extract that data core.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Aye, sir. Proceeding. Approaching the Klingon raider. The bodies are a Vulcan and Andorian.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: A Vulcan and an Andorian? Commanding a Klingon ship?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I've located the data core. Looks intact, but I'll have to clear some of the hull around it with the laser cannon to extract cleanly.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Proceed with extreme caution, Lieutenant. Even the slightest nick could corrupt the data or destroy the core completely.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Debris surface analysis is non-conclusive.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Got it.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Get it to engineering as fast as possible, Lieutenant. (to Burnham) You can relax, too. He's safe now.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Sir?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I need to know that I can rely on my crew to act professionally at all times. Particularly now we're in dangerous waters. So, can I count on you, Burnham?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Good.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What are you doing, standing there?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You can't hurt me anymore.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Now why would I want to hurt you?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What did you do to me, on the prison ship? Tell me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You know what we did. We did it together. So many things. You have such appetites.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You forced me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Does thinking that make you feel better?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm having flashes of things... things I don't remember. Procedures. Surgeries.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Sweet Tyler. Open this cell, and I'll tell you everything you want to know.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Very good. So much more familiar.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Tell me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Whom do we seek?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Kahless.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: How do we find him?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Together.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Kahless, give us light to see.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Forever.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Will he hide from us always?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Never.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What is your name?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What did... what did you do to me? I'm... I'm not myself.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You have another name. Say it!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You know my what my name is! (points phaser at her) If you don't tell me what you did to my mind, to my soul, I'm gonna make you scream it as you die.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The prayer should make you remember. Something is wrong.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You're damn right something's wrong. Now, tell me! What am I doing? What am I doing?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What am I doing?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Wait, wait. (in Klingonaase) You will come back to me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Isik for your thoughts.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What's an isik?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It's an old Vulcan saying. No one actually knows where it comes from.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Must make it hard to cash in.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What happened out there, in the worker bee?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What do you mean? (he gets a Look) It happened again. The flashes of memory. Worse this time. Things I hadn't recalled about my torture. Thanks for covering.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You have to tell the Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I know, but I can't.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Why?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: PTSD regs require full-duty quarantine till you can get treatment. We're in another universe. I mean, how close do you think the nearest Starfleet medical centre is?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Who knows? It might be around the corner.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Maybe. But until that turns out to be true, I need you to trust me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What you went through on the Klingon Ship of the Dead

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Was a one-off. Seeing those Klingons took me by surprise, that's all. I can manage this, all right? You just saw me manage this. You helped me manage... Just let me try and handle things, at least for a little while. At least till we get back home.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And what if you can't?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Then I'll tell you, I promise.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm taking you at your word, Starfleet.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Specialist Burnham, please report to Engineering.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Duty calls.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The data core from the Klingon vessel. I got it open.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well done, Tilly. Strange. The core itself is Klingon, but these data chips are of Vulcan design. They should be compatible with our universal interface. But this fused data technology, and their sharing of ships... Is it possible that in this universe, the Vulcans, Andorians and Klingons have some sort of alliance?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Allied against... against us?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm gonna get into the interface and try to figure this out.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I know. Me, too. It's weird being here without him. But he's gonna get better. He has to, right?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Of course he does. All right, let the xenoanthropologist get to work.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm downloading the Klingon raider's logs Images, battle plans, intelligence that we found from the core. And so far, we can conclude that we are indeed in a parallel universe. But one not governed by the Federation, but by a fascistic, human-only organisation known as the Terran Empire. Most places and ships that are found in our universe, like the Cooper, exist here. The same goes for people.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You mean, we could literally meet another version of ourselves?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Theoretically, yes.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Wow.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The Terrans appear to be the antithesis of us, in every way. They're an oppressive, racist, xenophobic culture that dominates all known space, and they're ruled by a faceless emperor.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And those ships we found?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They're part of a rebellion that is made up, essentially, of all non-human species. They're fighting for freedom. The rebellion fears and mistrusts humans. The Terran culture appears to be predicated upon an unconditional hatred and rejection of anything and everything other.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That means us. There's no way we're asking these neighbours for a cup of sugar.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain to the Bridge. Incoming vessel. It's the Cooper.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We're on our way.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We're being hailed, sir. They're asking to speak with the Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They think we're their Discovery.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: All right, what intel do we have?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Scanning records from the core download. Wait. The rebel logs show their ships being attacked by a vessel with a warp signature matching our Discovery, but with a quantum signature matching this universe.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They're hailing us again, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That signature seems to have vanished at the same coordinates where we popped in.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: So...

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It is possible we switched places with their Discovery.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm gonna run with Mister Saru's theory in the hope that we don't bump into ourselves and blow our cover. Burnham.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Modifying our ship's signature to match that of mirror Discovery.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Hold on, Lieutenant!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They're saying if we don't respond that we should prepare to be fired on.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Open a channel. Audio only.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Belay that. I'm sorry, but you can't take it, sir. I'm examining the crew manifest of mirror Discovery. You're not its Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Who is?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That er, that's me. That's me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's absurd.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They're arming weapons.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Cadet, looks like you're taking this one.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Er, what... what do I say?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You just get rid of them as fast as possible, and you talk as little as possible.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's... that might be a little hard for... Have you noticed that I talk a lot?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Defy your every instinct.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Their phasers are locked on. Should I raise shields, Captain?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No. Mister Bryce, open a channel.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Hello, this is Captain Tilly. What the he-heck hell? What the hell? Hold your horses!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: This is Captain Spoeneman. Why the delay in responding, Discovery?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I was indisposed.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Everything okay over there, Discovery? You made quick work of those rebels, and we got the stragglers. Any reason you're still hanging around? Expecting more kills? Trying to keep them all to yourself?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We're experiencing mechanical issues.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Need a hand? We're not far. And why are you not on screen?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Mechanical issues? Here's my Chief Engineer.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I don't know who you are over here just yet, so conceal your voice just in case.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: How are you doing, Captain? Everything's squared away here. We've got, er we've got a wee bit of trouble with our visual emitters and the starboard nacelle, but a bit tweaking, we'll be good to go, all right?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Very well, Discovery. More rebel nests for us. Happy hunting. Long live the Empire!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Long live the Empire!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Good.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Sor... sorry.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Next time, we might not get away with audio only. If we want to live to get back home, we have to make it so we look and act like we belong here. Mister Saru, while we get up to speed with this universe, see to it that the ship, the crew and its Captain are prepared.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I mean fully prepared.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: To successfully crash a party, you have to look like you belong. You must project confidence.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You gained the rank of Captain by stabbing your previous superior in bed. He was recovering from Crestian flu.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's not... that's not possible.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It's more than possible. Your nicknames include The Slayer of Sorna Prime.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Every detail of this so-called Terran Empire must be replicated exactly.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The Witch of Wurna Minor.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And wherever we may fall short, we have to get creative.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And finally

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain Killy? Well, that's not very clever.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Our very survival relies on our ability to maintain this cover, no matter what. We are now the ISS Discovery.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Are we civilians? Do we get uniforms? What?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We won't be needing them, sir. I finally found the files on our Terran counterparts. We're not here.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Where are we?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm presumed dead, and you're a fugitive wanted for my murder.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What happened?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, the intelligence is fragmented. Looks like most of it's been stolen from classified Terran files. But it appears that you and I both enjoyed immense prestige here. I was the Captain of the Shenzhou, and you had the Buran here, too, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And my crew... they alive?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No. You attempted a coup against the Emperor. I was sent to stop you. In the process, my shuttle was destroyed by one of your followers, and I was killed, and the Emperor laid waste to your ship in retaliation. It's believed you escaped.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, there's me hoping I'd find a better version of myself over here. Look out there. Come on. Amazing, isn't it? A different universe, but somehow the same people had a way to find each other. The strongest argument I've ever seen for the existence of destiny.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm not sure if I believe in destiny.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, is that so? Sitting in that cell all alone, facing a life sentence of solitude, future full of misery. A little part of you had to know that wasn't the end of your story. You were destined for something more.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Destiny didn't get me out of prison, Captain. You did that.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, let's agree to disagree for now. So, who is this Emperor?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: There's no information in the rebel files beyond the fact that the Emperor is savage.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Maybe it's not a bad thing that you and I are ghosts. I found something curious in the data here. A potential way home. Now, I didn't know how to exploit it till right now, but I think you might end up saving us all.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: It's a suicide mission.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No, listen, Commander.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Data from rebel intelligence suggests that we're not the first ship from our universe to find ourselves here. It cites another Starfleet vessel. USS Defiant.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: How is that possible? At last review, the Defiant was patrolling Sector six in our universe.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: There may be some kind of temporal anomaly at play. It's unclear, but data suggests that in the future, the Defiant will encounter a phenomenon that'll bring it into this alternative universe's past.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Regardless, the Defiant is a Constitution class vessel. It didn't get here by spore drive. If we find out how it did make it over, could be our way home.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: But boarding the ISS Shenzhou? Posing as your Terran selves? Well, that plan is an invitation for calamity. Captain, I beg you to reconsider.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Intel on the Defiant is classified. It's only available on a Terran ship to those with high-level clearance, like a captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: But you are an enemy of the empire and no longer a captain, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No, but I am.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: But I thought the other Burnham was dead.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Presumed dead. My body was never found.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm responsible for her death, and I'm still at large, so Captain Burnham will be returning to the Shenzhou with me as bounty.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And I'll explain that my death was a cover that I used to hunt him to the end of the quadrant.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Delightful.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We beam over, Burnham gets the info on Defiant, we beam back. Simple. Every Captain in the Empire has a personal guard. You're gonna be Burnham's.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Am I?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Have long-range sensors scan for the ISS Shenzhou. When you find her, plot an intercept course. Let's get us home.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What exactly are you worried about, Lieutenant?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I just want you to make sure the Klingons didn't do something to me. Some kind of procedure I don't know about.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, of course, you know anything is possible. But you were exposed to a full set of physical scans when you came on board. And random memory sampling, the Manchurian test, is highly effective at detecting what used to be called brainwashing, i.e. the installation of commands or personality engrams underneath a functioning consciousness. What exactly are you imagining they could have done to you?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm not imagining anything.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Forgive me, Lieutenant. I meant the word practically, not pejoratively. As in when one uses the imagination to picture what is not yet known, or seen. Are you suffering from mood swings? Fugue states? Lost time? If any of that is the case, I'll have to ground you.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I just want to make sure I'm shipshape before this mission. The people on this ship, they saved my life. I won't let 'em down.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, let me run a deeper set of scans. What you probably need most right now is rest and some time off of this ship.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Not much chance of that, Doc.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Stay out of the palace!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'll just be a minute. Paul, I'm not going anywhere. I'm gonna stay right by your side. It'll be okay. (kiss)

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Be careful. The enemy is here.
