Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'd say, er, I'm 60% excited, 40% terrified. Actually, it's 60% terrified, 40% excited. Maybe it's 70%

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Tilly.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Sorry. Sorry.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: And stop apologising. Terrans don't apologise.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, my mother would definitely approve. Computer, cancel mirror.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You are a captain now.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No, I'm not. She is. I'm nothing like her, Michael. She's terrifying. She's... she's like a twisted version of everything I've ever aspired to be. I'm gonna have nightmares about myself now.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You don't actually have to be her.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: But how do I project that strength?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I've been trying to understand them better. And Terran strength is born out of pure necessity, because they live in constant fear, always looking for the next knife aimed at their back. Their strength is painted rust. It's a facade. But you have the strength of an entire crew that believes in you. Fortify yourself with our faith in you. That's what a real Captain does.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Impressive.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, let's not keep these assholes waiting. Too much?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No. Not here. Here, it's just right.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Mister Bryce.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Hail the ISS Shenzhou. Now.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Aye, Captain. This is the ISS Discovery hailing the ISS Shenzhou. Shenzhou, do you read? Over.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain Tilly. To what do I owe the pleasure? And how can I return the favour?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The only pleasure I take is from the blood of my enemies staining my uniform, Captain Connor.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You know him?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: He was my Ops officer on the Shenzhou. I watched him die at the Battle of the Binary Stars. I knew we'd encounter familiar faces. But is this what it's gonna be like here?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: While scouring the asteroid belts of Porathia, searching for hidden rebels, I happened to come across a disabled shuttle. Inside, I found something I think you'll find most interesting.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Showtime.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain Burnham. We... we thought you were

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You thought exactly what I wanted you and everyone else to think. Especially him. It was the only way I could capture this traitor.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Most ingenious.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I don't need your compliments, Connor. I need my ship.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Of course.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I expect you've kept her in perfect condition?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Then bring her to me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We have a rebel group pinned down in this system. It would be better if you come to us.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Is that how you treat your long-lost Captain? If you greeted me that way, Connor, I'd cut out your tongue and use it to lick my boots.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We will alter course to the Discovery at once, Captain Burnham, and prepare for your arrival.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Be sure that you do.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You called, Doc? You find anything?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yeah. Er, have you ever received any neurological therapies or marrow-diminution procedures before?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No, not that I know of.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Because there are masses of scar tissue surrounding all of your organs.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Right. From my torture.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Right, that's what the computer concluded when you first came aboard. But I've run more advanced tests, and if I'm reading these chondroblast-cell scans correctly, what the Klingons did to you can only be described as bone-crushing. They opened up your limbs, and they appear to have shortened your radius, your femurs, even your spinal cord.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What are you getting at?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, this is just a theory, Tyler, but remember we confirmed that no personality engrams were hidden under your native identity?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Okay.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well there's some research that suggests that a new personality could be placed atop it, like an overlay, with the original personality still intact underneath. It appears that the Klingons have transformed you, both mentally and physically.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Into what?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: That's what we have to figure out.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Doc, I came here for a solution. Now, you said you could fix it.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Please, sit down.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm needed on a mission!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I'm afraid you're not going anywhere without further examination.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: They need me!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Well, that's just it. As far as I'm concerned, you're not you.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The enemy is here.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Incoming warp signature. ISS Shenzhou approaching.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: My God.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain, we're being hailed.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Open a channel. Inform Shenzhou, three to beam over.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Gonna look after her. Mister Saru, you're in charge now. Well, I guess you're in charge to anybody off the ship, Captain Killy. Maintain a safe distance. Close enough to transport us back as soon as Burnham gets her hands on the Defiant files.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I won't let you down, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I know you won't. Tyler, where were you?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Er, I'm not sure, sir.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: There's no excuse for my tardiness. Sorry, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No more apologies. From now on, we're Terrans. Decency is weakness. It will get us killed. And the lives of everyone on this ship and in the Federation are at stake. So you do what you must. Whatever you must. To anyone. Understand?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Clear, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Guess that's the last time you're calling me Captain. Hopefully, just for a while. You ready? Energise.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain Burnham. Welcome back to the Shenzhou. We've made some modifications and eplaced the lateral-vector transport systems. Let me take this bastard off your hands. He's due for a world of pain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: (draws phaser) Keep your hands off him. You think I'd let just anyone control the fate of the most valuable bounty in the galaxy? I'll take Lorca to the brig personally. There are any number of souls on board looking to serve up his severed head for their own glory.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Of course. I'll escort you, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Only the finest agoniser booth reserved for the treacherous Lorca.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Absolutely not.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Captain?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: What did I say to you? I do not want some overzealous guard killing this traitor before I have the chance. I would punish the entire ship for an error that grave!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: We would never allow him the release of death, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: (to Tyler) See to it that he is installed properly here. I need to access my files. Escort me to the Ready room.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You know, I almost didn't make it to Captain after you were gone. But I still came out on top. The Emperor saw something in me.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Glad to hear it.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The crew, they all bowed after I won. But they didn't bow deeply enough. Not like they did with you. I needed to make them fear me, and now I finally think I know how.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I don't need a blade to kill you, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: The chair is yours, Captain.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Dispose of him.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: With pleasure, sir.-

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Long live Captain Burnham! Long live the Empire!

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Long live the Empire.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: You scared the hell out of me. How did you get in?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Your access code was the same as on Discovery. You know, Head of Security. I know all of them. It's not just yours. So, did you get into the files? Get the information about the Defiant?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: No chance. Everybody on the crew, they're trailing me, trying to sidle up, curry favour. And I didn't want to rouse suspicion.

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: I heard about what happened with Connor. I need to tell you something. Whatever you do, whatever this place makes you do, whatever happens to you, or me. However we change I am here to protect you. Nothing will ever stand in the way of that. Nothing. Do you understand what I'm saying?

Title: despite-yourself
Dialogue: Yes. I'm saying it back.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Harrington to Engineering, I'm still working on that electrical malfunction on deck 12.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Acknowledged. Deck 11, section 6 is reporting the same problem.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Think I've got that bulkhead operational.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Understood. Make sure manual controls are routed to the emergency operational systems.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The forest.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Hold on a minute.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The forest. The forest. The forest.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The forest is dark, but I can see him through the trees. The trees. The trees. The trees.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I can't rest here. Not really. My eyes open and it's like waking from the worst nightmare I could imagine. Even the light is different. The cosmos has lost its brilliance. And everywhere I turn there's fear.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Captain. I have come to perform your daily ablutions.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: What is your name?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: A... A slave has no name.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: It's been two days. But they're already inside my head. Every moment is a test. Can you bury your heart? Can you hide your decency? Can you continue to pretend to be one of them, even as, little by little, it kills the person you really are?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You are all guilty of malicious thoughts against your Emperor. By order of the sovereign Terran Empire, I hereby sentence you to death.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Energising.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Which is exactly what I feared the most.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You can never be one of them.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We're all human here. We all start out with the same drives, the same needs. Maybe none of us, no matter what world we're from, really know what darkness is waiting inside. Thank you for this. You remind me of everything good. Of what I want my world to look like.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: My first year at the academy, I was terrified of open space. I could fly anything, no sweat, but I dreaded putting on that suit. Until I remembered the tether. They're mandatory the first few times a Cadet goes out in an EV and they link you back to what you know, what you love, help you stay strong, even as you head out into that terrifying abyss. And that's you. You're my tether. You bring me back. You did it before we were stranded in this place, and you're still doing it now.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We're done here. Go check on my prisoner.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: This looks good, Saru. I'm gonna call you Saru, in honour of a respected friend.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Yes, Captain. (leaves)

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Computer, accept transmission.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Is this a secure channel?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Low band, zero traffic. I'm alone, Tilly.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I have Mister Saru. Hang in there, friend.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Is your status unchanged?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Yes, sir. I've accessed the classified files, but the data's too massive to decipher from here. The Terran firewall is impenetrable. I'm unable to transmit intel off-ship without being detected.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: An oppressive regime is, by nature, a fearful regime, but I'm afraid you must devise a workaround. The data concerning the USS Defiant's entry into this realm is our last best hope at forming our own plan of escape.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: So I take it Lieutenant Stamets' condition hasn't improved?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I'm afraid not.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I will find a way.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Oh, er, one last question, immaterial to the mission. My kind are few in our universe. I had hoped... Have you encountered any Kelpiens onboard?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No, I haven't, Saru. I'm sorry.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Oh, not at all. It was merely a personal curiosity. Stay safe, Michael, and be wary.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Culber was her friend and colleague. She deserves to know the truth.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The news that we are dealing with an intra-vessel homicide would distract Burnham from her vital mission. The circumstances surrounding Doctor Culber's death are difficult to process, even for me.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I hate seeing him like this.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: If Lieutenant Stamets killed Culber, he may be a danger to all of us.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: He only escaped because the containment field was disabled. Culber probably lowered it. Who could stand to see the person they love in a cage?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Perhaps that was his fatal error.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Stamets didn't kill anyone.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Are you suggesting there's a murderer running free on our ship?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No, I'm saying that this... this is not Paul Stamets. I've analysed the scans of his neurological function. The hyperactivity of the white matter in his brain has increased at an alarming rate. It's redirected blood flow almost exclusively to the frontopolar cortex.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Rendering all other segments of the brain essentially nonfunctional.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: This wasn't a murder. This was an unfortunate consequence of an addled mind trying to reach beyond a cloud of confusion. We are losing him, Commander, and fast.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The Lieutenant's health is in the hands of our medical officers.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Medicine isn't working. This is a spore issue, which means no one is more qualified to treat him than I am. Please? Let me bring him back.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Incoming hail. Captain Maddox of the Imperial Flagship seeks an audience.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Acknowledge.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Michael Burnham in the flesh. Then it's true. The Emperor will be pleased.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Not as pleased as I am to have reclaimed what's mine.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I'm sure. The Emperor has a mission. Your first dip back into the fray.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I'm more than up for the challenge.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Imperial intelligence has uncovered the location of the Fire Wolf.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The Klingon leader of the resistance.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The one who's been marching his witless alien insurgents to their inevitable deaths. His base is located on Harlak. I'm sending you the coordinates now. Your mission is simple.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Terran General Order Four. Any exotic species deemed a threat to the Imperial Supremacy will be extinguished without prejudice.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Kill them all. The Emperor commands it.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Tactical, prep photon torpedoes for launch.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Do not anticipate me, Number One.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Captain, we have our orders.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No. I have my orders. You've all grown soft in my absence. You think it was easy tracking Lorca, bringing him back here alive? We could kill the Fire Wolf and his followers, and lay waste to their operation from above. Or we could get our hands dirty. Prep a landing party. I'll infiltrate the rebel base myself. And return with the intel we need to bury the resistance once and for all.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You have to do it. Give the order. You have to wipe them out.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: But I can't send hundreds of rebels to their death to save myself.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: What about your crew, the Federation, our universe, being massacred by Klingons. Sometimes the end justifies terrible means.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Permission to speak freely, sir? I fear that your suffering has influenced your judgment. I will find a way to get what we need to Discovery, but in the meantime, lives are hanging on my command here and at home. And this rebellion against the Terrans? It's an unshakeable union of species. Klingons, Vulcans, Andorians, Tellarites. It's the closest to a Federation this universe may ever see.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: And your point?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: My point is that a Klingon leads the alliance. A Klingon. They rally behind him. If we can walk away from this with the means to successfully negotiate with the Klingon race, that's real hope for finding peace at home. Please, sir. I no longer have my pips, but I'm still Starfleet. Don't force me to slaughter this coalition of hope.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Maybe you're right. Maybe I'm not seeing things clearly. All right, no landing party. You insist that you and Tyler beam down alone. I can't risk your true agenda being exposed. Hurry back, please.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: He called me Captain. I didn't think much of it at first, save that it had a pretty sweet ring to it. Then we came here, into this universe, where I am Captain.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You hypothesised that Mister Stamets began receiving glimpses of this alternate plane that preceded our physical arrival.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Yes. This scan represents the tardigrade's neural activity when he first came to us. Do you see this?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Micro patterns in the frontopolar cortex. Some sort of undetermined and seemingly ancillary activity.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Neurons firing nowhere, or so we thought at the time. This is Stamets today. The micro patterns are a symptom of mycelial travel, but what we hadn't considered then was that they could also be a neuronal link. A kind of internal transdimensional portal to this universe. Or, theoretically, any dimension accessible via the network.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: And now that segment of the brain is consuming all of the organ's resources to keep the portal open.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We need to restore function to the entire brain, like this. And what organism can symbiotically contribute to the health of its host? Spores. Stamets is inside the network. In order to reclaim his lost neural function, we need to put the network inside him.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Then proceed, cadet.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Think about this. You're gonna get yourself killed.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Better dead than one of them.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Just follow my lead.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Energise.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The rebel encampment is 500 metres from this point.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Why can't we see anything?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Because they don't want you to.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No, no, no. To them, we're the enemy. If we fire back, it confirms that.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: They have us pinned down.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I have a plan, Tyler. Hand me your phaser.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I seek an audience with the one you call the Fire Wolf. We come in peace, against the orders of our Emperor. We come to deliver a message. A warning.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: (Andorian) With me.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Active camouflage. This is how the Fire Wolf kept the base secret for nearly two years.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You're the Fire Wolf.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We finally meet. I am Voq, son of none. My spies have told me you were dead. I must admit, we rejoiced at this news.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The old Michael Burnham is dead. I'm the new Michael Burnham, the one who's betraying her kind, risking her life to save you.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The new Michael Burnham. Are you not the Butcher of the Binary Stars?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: There are two sides to every battle.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: With a single savage order you executed thousands of my kind, establishing yourself as the figurehead of Terran cruelty. Do you deny those actions?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I cannot. But it is not who I want to be. Not anymore.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Then I am happy to relieve you of your

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I understand your urge to fight. The only way that you can see me, determine my true intentions. But I do swear to you, every moment that we square off wastes precious time. The Emperor has discovered your location. I had orders to enter Harlak's orbit and destroy your base.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Try it. The resistance will fight to the death.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I think we can help each other. I want something from you, and in return I will save your followers and ensure the longevity of your resistance.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Your Emperor would never sanction such an act of mercy.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No. But my Emperor will be satisfied when I strafe Harlak with photon torpedoes following the safe evacuation of your people.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I cannot place their lives in human hands. Not without absolute certainty. Bring out the Prophet.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Master Sarek sees all. His wisdom pierces minds. If you truly come in peace, he will find it in your heart.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: My mind to your mind. My thoughts to your thoughts.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: My mind to your mind. My thoughts to your thoughts.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You've proven that you're as accomplished as any Vulcan, which is gonna serve you well. As long as you never forget that you're human, too. JUDGE [memory] To the charge of mutiny, how do you plead?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Guilty.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Sarek, what do you see?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I see a world bursting with potential, a child molded by wisdom, and a seemingly impossible depth of human compassion. She means us no harm.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: If the Prophet deems your motives to be pure, then even I am not headstrong enough to argue. Prepare to evacuate. Leave no trace for prying Terran eyes.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Wait. I told you I wanted something in return.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: And you have earned that right.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You lead this group of vastly different species. A Klingon, whose pride of honour is eternally fused with his identity as a warrior, stands side by side with a Vulcan, who cannot possibly comprehend his need for aggressive emotional expression. And a willful Andorian looks to you not with hostility, but with allegiance. I need to know how. How have you come to compromise and embrace each other?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The light of Kahless guides me in all things.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Kahless. Together under one creed.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: But the light of Kahless demands that you honour the ways of your race, yet here you are speaking in a foreign language, placing your faith in the cultural customs of others.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I am here. I have survived only on the shoulders of my comrades.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Our purity is a threat to them. They wish to drag us into the muck where humans, Vulcans, Tellarites and filthy Andorians mix.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The humans seek Klingon extinction. They have denied us our rituals, our language. That is why I fight.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The Terrans will not stop until all of their enemies are destroyed.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: And a Terran enemy is a Klingon friend.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: So you are united by the common adversary, but does that union not contradict your drive to defend the Klingon honour at all costs?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Klingons stand together, and strong. It is only with our own Houses in order that we can begin to invite others in.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: My House is bonded by a single doctrine. Remain Klingon.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) Remain Klingon or die!

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Tyler, no! Tyler, stop!

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Who are you? How do you speak our forgotten tongue?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No. No.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: So the darkness of a Terran soul can now suppress a Vulcan mind-meld?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No. My guard has attacked you against my orders.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You dishonour yourselves, even in death.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No!

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Wait. I told you Captain Burnham meant us no harm. I stand by that assessment.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Impossible. Her man tried to assassinate the Fire Wolf.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I do not claim to understand the logic behind his motives, but hers are pure. She is an outsider. Like us, she seeks escape from this world, to reclaim hope, equality, peace. It is only in sparing her life that we, too, will see the fight of another day.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Tell me what needs to be done, then be gone.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You have one hour to flee with your lives. My ship waits in Harlak's orbit. But I do need to prove that my mission here was successful.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Shukar.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The location of each of the rebel listening stations within this quadrant. By the time your crew have deciphered our code, we will have rendered the intel inactionable.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Thank you for your wisdom.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I will thank you only after we reach safety.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Burnham to Shenzhou. Two to transport.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Have it analysed immediately. It contains the data we need to bring the rebellion to its knees. Tell Tactical now is the time to prep those torpedoes, but I'll give the order to fire weapons at my discretion.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: My apologies, Captain.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I'll be in quarters. Tyler, you're with me.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The laser photon emissions are comprised entirely of exotic matter found in the mycelial plane. And when that matter integrates with Stamets' own neural materials, it should restore his cognitive function.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: A scientist saved by his own specimens.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The veins and muscles of the universe. Fungi are the only organism with the biological aptitude to link death with life.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: His heart rate is accelerating.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: That is, er, an expected side effect. That big brain of his is doing some heavy lifting. Okay, there. The neural patterns in the temporal lobe are returning to baseline. It's... it's working.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Remarkable. Your comprehension of the astromycology behind Mister Stamets' findings is... Well, I'm impressed.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Enough that you'll recommend me for the Command training programme?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Enough that if we ever find our way back to a universe that has a Command training programme, I will consider it. (alarm beeps) Heart rate is dropping again. He can't sustain this level of exertion.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We're nearly there. Come on, Stamets. Come on, come on, come on. Redirecting the brain's resources has affected the autonomic nervous system functions.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: This is your Captain. We need emergency medical assistance in Engineering.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No, no, no. I'm administering something to restart his heart. If we disengage him from the network now, we will lose him altogether.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We already have.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Please stand back.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Please, Saru. Order them to stand down.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Computer, request emergency reaction cube access.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Access granted.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Clear. Again. And again.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Tell me the truth, right now. What is happening to you?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Michael, please.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I have had your back. I've saved your life. I've loved you. You didn't just jeopardise me, you jeopardised our mission. Our entire crew back on Discovery.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The captain warned us that we'd do things out of our nature to survive.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No! We were surviving. It was under control. And this erratic behaviour, it's not because of this new universe. I saw it onboard the Klingon flagship.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Stop. Please, please stop.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: In the worker bee, when you could barely complete a simple mission, you said I was your tether. Ash, I need one, too. What are you hiding from me?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I feel something for her. L'Rell. A reverence, an allegiance, maybe an affection. And when she speaks, I'm forced to listen. And her words, they tell me who I am.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Whom do we seek?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Kahless.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: She brainwashed you. She wanted a spy aboard Discovery.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: More than that. More than just mind games. More than torture!

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: There are masses of scar tissue surrounding all of your organs. They opened up your limbs. As far as I'm concerned, you're not you.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: They reduced a Klingon body to human. I don't... I don't think I'm Ash Tyler, Starfleet Lieutenant. Not really. Not anymore.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You're not making sense.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I feel him inside me. His thoughts, his pain, his rage.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Who? Who? Who?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I tried to shut her out when L'Rell spoke the call. I resisted by thinking of you, the one I want to be human for. The one I love. I tried, Michael. [GASPING] But then I saw him, face to face, down on that planet, and I couldn't fight it anymore. I remember now. I remember it all. We needed to infiltrate your ship, learn your secrets. You were willing to betray your Captain to protect your people. I sacrificed my body and mind to protect mine. I have the human's face, but inside I remain Klingon.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Klingon?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I remain Voq, Son of none. The torchbearer.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No. You're Ash Tyler. We're gonna get back to Discovery and sit with Doctor Culber, and he's gonna...

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Doctor Culber saw past this feeble body into the heart and mind of a warrior, which is why I killed him.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: What?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: A necessary casualty.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I need to contact Saru. (grabs phaser) I don't want to use this. I will.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You. You killed my lord.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Your lord?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: T'Kuvma was a beacon, a messiah to unite us, deliver our race to dominance over a submissive galaxy. I bet the humans hail your bravery. Did they praise you after you martyred his name?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You've lost your mind.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: And you fought like a coward. Scratched at my eyes. But you could not blind me to the truth.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I didn't testify to that. It's you. You were there on that bridge. I remember.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I failed T'Kuvma that day.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I won't fail him again.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) I end you in T'Kuvma's name.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: He made an attempt on the Captain's life.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Captain.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Understood. I'll alert the transporter room. Officer Tyler's swift execution will send a valuable message to the crew. I know that you valued his service, but Terran Law is binding.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Of course. So ordered, Number One.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I'm so sorry. I hope wherever you are he's with you.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Hello, Paul. Ready to get to work? I so hoped you would find your way.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Officer Ash Tyler, you are guilty of the attempted murder of an Imperial Captain. By order of the sovereign Terran Empire, I hereby sentence you to death. Your prisoner, Captain.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Do you have anything to say for yourself?

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) Kahless, give me light to see forever.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Wait. This one dies by my own hand.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Have Lorca delivered to my Ready room. I'd like to soothe the blow of Mister Tyler's betrayal with a private interrogation.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: She should have let me die with honour.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: No. We are stranded in a cruel, anarchic world, but we are still Starfleet, and we still live and die by Federation law, no matter how heinous your crimes. And if she had, Burnham's mission aboard the Shenzhou would remain incomplete.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The Terran Empire's classified data on the USS Defiant. Our key to finding a way home. Lieutenant Ash Tyler, as acting captain of the USS Discovery, I hereby remand you to the brig to await a tribunal.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: We need to leave this place.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Not yet. In time.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: But my mission was successful.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: And what if Commander Saru can't isolate the data? What if the route the Defiant took is not available to us? Where would we run to if we were exposed before the entire Terran fleet? Look, I know this is hard for you. I know you'd come to care for Tyler.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: I don't think I can survive this place alone.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: You're not alone, Michael. We will survive this place together.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Captain, we're detecting a massive power signature within orbit. It seems another vessel is targeting Harlak.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: The rebels haven't completed their evacuation.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Grab Lorca.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Who is it? Why can't we see them? Hail the commanding officer. Tell them to retreat. Now!

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Incoming transmission. It's the Emperor.

Title: the-wolf-inside
Dialogue: Captain Michael Burnham. You've been away too long, though I can't say the same for your prisoner. I do not appreciate having to warp my way across the quadrant to clean up your untended mess. When I give an order, I do not expect to be ignored. Don't you bow before your Emperor?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Course confirmed to Imperial Flagship ISS Charon at classified coordinates. Distance, 27 million kilometres. Engaging engines at warp factor one. Autopilot activated.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I received a transmission from Commander Saru before we departed. He managed to decrypt the Defiant data that we smuggled off of the Shenzhou. The file has been redacted, but there is some data on how the Defiant crossed into this universe. A phenomenon called interphasic space. But where that space is, the exact coordinates, struck from the record.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: All right, well, we just have to hunt down the original report. If the complete archive's anywhere, it'll be in the Imperial Palace which is, fortunately, where we've been summoned. Some people would see that glass as half full.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I synthesised a custom analgesic to numb your nerve receptors, as you requested. It should help with the agonisers.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Much appreciated. Listen to me. You'll get the data we need on the Defiant, and you'll get us out of there. I know you will. Burnham, I need you. You need you. What are you afraid of?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Georgiou.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You mean Emperor Georgiou.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Logic tells me she's not the woman that I betrayed. But this feels like a reckoning.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Your Georgiou is dead. She's a ghost.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Haven't you ever been afraid of a ghost?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Warp drive disengaged. Imperial Palace secure perimeter detected.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: ISS Shenzhou shuttlecraft identity confirmed. You are cleared to approach the Charon.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You said there had been improvement in his condition.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Since restarting spore therapy, Lieutenant Stamets' neural activity has increased across all metrics. Glucose and oxygen consumption is up significantly. Beta and infra-low waves are off the curve, and, I know it's subjective, but he really does look better. I mean, just look at his skin, it's so dewy.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I admire your optimism, but let us call this what it is. A coma.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: We began this course of treatment to reconnect him with his consciousness. Something is going on in that head of his. We just need to let it happen.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It will need to happen far more quickly if he's to help us get home. Not much good came from the Defiant data. If the captain and Burnham cannot unearth the coordinates that tell us where the Defiant crossed over, our spore drive remains our only way home. And it remains inoperable while Lieutenant Stamets is in that state.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Commander Saru, medical emergency. Report to sickbay immediately.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Acknowledged. Forge ahead. Fix him.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Are you in there, Lieutenant? Are you in there?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: What is this? Am I dead? Is this the afterlife? A Are you some sort of narcissistic Virgil leading me to judgment?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yes, Paul. You've been wrong about everything. There is a God, and she's very, very mad at you right now. (laughs) I totally had you for a second there. You can't deny it. Ha-ha! You should've seen your face. I mean our face. Hoo! That was classic.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: So there is no God?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Well, you're still alive, so technically, who knows?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: But if I'm not dead, who are you?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You, in my universe. Nice to meet you.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Hey, this is my ship.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: No, you're still in the mycelial network. But it knows what's familiar to you, and it's trying to make you feel at home. Your comatose physical self is still on board the real Discovery, but your neural energy has taken a little detour.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Interesting. How'd you get stuck here?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Like you, I'm an astromycologist. I was conducting experiments in my lab on the Emperor's palace ship, there was an accident, and my mind ended up here, too. It seems we share parallel fates. From what I can tell, my physical form is also in a catatonic state on my vessel. I was losing hope until you navigated the mycelial highway for the first time. I tracked your comings and goings. I've been trying to make contact, but I haven't been able to transmit more than glimpses, images of my universe.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: That explains what I've been seeing. Visions of a palace. Tilly as a Captain. I thought I was going insane, but it was just you reaching out. Where's the exit?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Well, that's where you come in. You're the navigator. Navigate us the hell out.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Let's get to my lab. Maybe it's there.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: What is that?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: There's something wrong inside the network. Something corrupted. You don't want to get swept up in it. I did once and was lost for days.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Engineering is that way.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Let's go.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: The enemy is here.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's over there.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Welcome to our way out.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Lords of the Empire, privileged guests, all hail her most Imperial Majesty, Mother of the Fatherland, Overlord of Vulcan, Dominus of Qo'nos, Regina Andor. All hail the Emperor, Philippa Georgiou Augustus Iaponius Centarius.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: All hail the Emperor!

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Emperor, I present to you, Captain Michael Burnham of the Imperial Starship Shenzhou.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Captain Burnham. A face I thought I'd never see again in the flesh. Choose one. You should know what you're looking for in a Kelpien.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: That one.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Move.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You brought us a gift.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Captain Gabriel Lorca, delivered to the Emperor's justice. And long overdue.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You think I'm gonna bow to you? I don't bow.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Your life will be long, Gabriel, and every single moment of it will be spent in our agonisers. A fair price to pay for your vaulting ambition.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Take him to Brig C. Only the finest for our new guest.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Let's go.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You could have died hunting that traitor across the universe. I am so happy you didn't.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yes, Emperor.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: There is so much to discuss. Everything will be the way it was, dear daughter.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) Filthy humans! Let me die!

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I don't know what else to do with him, sir. He's damaged a biobed, wrecked our scanning array.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Well, sedate him.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I have.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) I will kill you all in T'Kuvma's name!

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yes, that's Klingon.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Burnham said he claimed to be a Klingon, but how could that be possible?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: His genome matches the one we have for Lieutenant Ash Tyler in our Starfleet database. His brainwave patterns, however, are highly irregular. Unless someone can tell me how they put a Klingon inside a Starfleet officer's body, I don't know how we can treat him.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Commander. Commander. Burnham, is she all right?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: She's fine.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Good. Saru, help me, please. (then starts screaming again)

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Dose him again. Now, please.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: The food is delicious, as always.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: No one prepares Kelpien like the Imperial chef. Here, have my ganglia. You deserve a treat.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You're too generous.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Why would you leave me, then? I gave you everything. Best education, riches beyond imagination, even your own ship.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I earned my command on the Shenzhou.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You were hesitant to use it back at Harlak. Those rebels could have escaped. I had to dispatch them myself.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I had it under control.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You've grown soft.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: And you've grown cruel. If you miss me, then say it. Otherwise, let me be.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I thought you were dead.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Lorca's men are everywhere, even here aboard this ship. If you had known I was alive, they would have known, too. It would have been impossible to ambush him the way that I did.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Never could tell when you were lying to me. Fortunately, this time I know. (draws a dagger) You always tried to outsmart me, Michael, even as a child. Why? Was it the loss of your parents? My attention to the Empire? Or were you just built that way? Why were you never satisfied? I knew you had become Lorca's collaborator, and you were conspiring to kill me and take my throne. Why did the two of you come back here?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Please, Philippa.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's Philippa now? Not so long ago, it was Mother. Guards! Take her to the throne room. Gather my council. She is to be executed by my own hand for treason.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: To map an exit from the network, it's helpful to know exactly where Discovery entered, as a way to get our bearings. And once I know that, we can hunt for the best path out. Huh.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: What?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: The coordinates of our final jump aren't here.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Tell me why you're not useless?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Tell me why you can't stop clawing at your arm.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's nothing.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's nice to know I'm a terrible liar in every universe.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Is that Armillaria ostoyae?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's the network. It's taking me over. I've been here too long.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Paul.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Hugh? Did you see him?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: See who?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He was here. That must mean he's trapped, too.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Oh, no, no, no, no, no, no. If you don't focus on the task at hand, you'll get lost and we'll never escape. Stop!

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Captain Michael Burnham. We have sentenced you to death for crimes committed against the Terran throne. Do you have any last words before we collect our retribution? At least you are showing some steel. I do love you, Michael. I would never grant anyone else in the Empire the mercy of a quick death.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You don't love me. You don't love me because you don't know me. Before today, you and I have never met. I am Michael Burnham, but I am not your Michael Burnham. I'm from another universe. I have proof. It's in my pocket.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Lord Eling, retrieve this proof.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yes, Emperor.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: That piece of metal contains the quantum variance from my world. It's subtle, but it's there. There's absolutely no way to fake it. It belonged to my Captain. It belonged to you. Our bond, it seems, is strong enough to cross universes.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: What a quaint concept. Parallel universes.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Lord Eling, can you keep a secret?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yes, Emperor.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Good. Clean this up. Never speak a word of it to anyone, and I'll make you Governor of Andor.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yes, Emperor.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: This is from the United Federation of Planets, and apparently, so are you.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You must want something.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Lieutenant Tyler is in distress. He thinks he is a Klingon.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Then he has awoken.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I do not know what your people had planned for him, but this cannot have been it. You must be able to help him.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: There is nothing to help. Beneath that man's inferior carriage is a devoted warrior who has sacrificed everything and T'Kuvma's chosen successor. He will light the way for his race. He will win this war.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I guess you didn't hear the news. The Discovey was thrown into a parallel universe. Here, the war is over, and you lost.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Lies.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I wish they were. But the war and all your devious designs mean nothing now. All that remains is the suffering of an individual I suspect you care for. I do not know where your Voq ends and our Tyler begins, but they are both in jeopardy. The question is, will you ease their pain?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: The one you call Tyler was captured in battle at the Binary Stars. We harvested his DNA, reconstructed his consciousness and rebuilt his memory. We modified Voq into a shell that appears human. We grafted his psyche into Tyler's, and in so doing, Voq has given his body and soul for our ideology. If he suffers for that choice, so be it. He accepted that suffering in order to best the enemy. That is what it means to be a soldier. That is war.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Hugh? Hugh?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Hi. I wasn't sure if you'd come home. All the other times I'd try to lure you from work with dinner, wine

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Are you caught in the network, too?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: No. I'm gone.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Gone?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You don't know, do you? Paul, I'm so sorry, but I died.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You have no reason to hold my Captain any longer. He shouldn't have to suffer for your Lorca's crimes.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: The Captain may not be comfortable where he is, but I am, for now.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Emperor, my ship and crew are here by accident. All we want is to return to our universe, but we need your help to do that.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You're interlopers from an alien army. What reason from any universe would I have to help you?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Because you care for Burnham. Despite her betrayal, you said you loved her.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Your people are dangerous. The Federation. I know it well from the Defiant's files. There is a reason why they're classified. Equality. Freedom. Cooperation.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Cornerstones for successful cultures.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Delusions that Terrans shed millennia ago. Destructive ideals that fuel rebellions, and I will not let you infect us again.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: We just need access to the redacted information about the Defiant. We believe that it'll help us get back. Share it, and you have my word you'll never hear from us again.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Those documents will not help you. The Defiant crossed here through interphasic space, which not only resulted in a temporal anomaly, but also had devastating cognitive effects on every crew member. They went insane. They tore each other apart. I'm surprised the same thing didn't happen to your crew.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: We arrived here a different way.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: How?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: An engine malfunction.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Warp engines do not breach the barriers between universes. Tell me what powers your ship.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Our ship jumped here with its displacement-activated spore hub drive.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I would like to see this technology. Let's make an exchange. Your engine schematics for your freedom.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: If I agree, how do I know you'll let us go?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Was your Georgiou a woman of honour?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Entirely.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Then you have no reason to believe I am not as well.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Tyler broke free of his restraints. This is what he did.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He is too violent for Sickbay. None of our doctors can help him. I will ask you one final time. Will you?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: No.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Energise.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You have sealed this being's hellish fate. Human versus Klingon in one body. That is war.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It can be undone. But only my hands can tend to him.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Captain.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I'll take it from here.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Tell me, Gabriel. Where have you been hiding since the Buran was blown to bits?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: With friends.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: What friends do you have left? The Emperor rounded up all your loyalists from every corner of the Empire. We had to fill the aft hangar bay with agoniser booths just to accommodate them all.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yet here we are, just the two of us. Feels like it's getting personal.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It is personal. She was my sister. This is DNA from a Comtaxan parasite on Tonnata VII. Doesn't mix well with ours. Admit what you did.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Or what?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Gabriel? You're alive. I... I thought they were lying.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Chin up, soldier.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: They kept asking us all if you were really dead, and I said no. I said no because I wanted to believe.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: What do you have to say?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: About what?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: My sister.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: There are so many women. It's good to be the Captain.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Say her name. Say her name so I can spare your friend.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Just... just say it. Please?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Leave him out of this. It's between you and me.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) When I see you, I do not see the human. I see the warrior who laid down all for his people.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: (in Klingonaase) Kahless, give me light. Father, give me wisdom. Mother, give me drink. Aargh!

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I saw you die. I watched Tyler kill you. I held your body in my arms. I thought it was a dream.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I wish it were. I remember your arms around me. You made me feel safe. You always did.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Stamets, get out of there! This place is quicksand. If we don't leave, we die.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Computer, play Kasseelian opera. The aria he loves, the one I hate.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: This won't change anything.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I don't want it to change. I want it to be the way it was. Please let it be the way it was.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: This is perfect.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: This was always my favourite time with you.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Did you know I loved you? I don't think I told you enough.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You showed me, all the time. Tell me about your day.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It was awful. My partner is dead. My life's work has been a waste. What I knew to be beautiful is hostile. And the mycelial network is hell.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: No, Paul. You were right. The network is a gift. It's the thread that weaves life through space. But it is in danger.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Yeah, we're in danger. It's eating me alive. Well, the other me.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Well, the other you deserves it. In his universe, that Stamets exploited the network for his own gain. He's the one who corrupted it. I needed you to follow me to warn you. The damage is spreading. Eventually everything, everywhere, will be exterminated. You have to save us by saving the network.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: How? I can't even find my way out.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You're in a coma on the Discovery, and the simplest way back is just to open your eyes.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I don't want to say goodbye.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's never goodbye. Isn't that what you've been trying to teach all of us? Nothing in here is ever truly gone. I believe in you, Paul. I love you. (long kiss) Follow the music, Paul. Look for the clearing in the forest. Open your eyes.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I'm back. He did it. He did it.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Oh, my. Lieutenant, you're back. He's back. And he's leaving. Lieutenant, I don't think this is a good idea. Do you know how long you've been out? Some things have happened.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I know about Hugh. But I need you to come with me right now.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: It's too late. The sickness has already spread to our supply.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Please do not take offense, Burnham, but I would feel better if Captain Lorca were the one making this request for a rendezvous.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Trust me, so would I. But he's locked up. His safety depends upon your arrival.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Acknowledged.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I'm sending you the coordinates to the Emperor's ship now. We'll see you soon.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: The Federation, through and through. They would never abandon you and your Captain. Rules to live by. Rules to die by.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: My sister loved you. Say her name and beg for forgiveness.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Aargh!

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I need to see my Captain. He won't survive your agonisers much longer. He's suffering.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Let him. If your bond to me crosses universes, then so does his treachery. The Lorca I knew was my right hand. I trusted him with the Empire's most sensitive missions. I trusted him with you.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I don't understand.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: When I adopted you, you gained a mother. But despite my constant guidance and affection, something was still missing. In Lorca, you saw a father, until you grew up and it became more.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You're saying Lorca and I...?

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He groomed you. He chose you.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I did choose you. But not for the reasons you think.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He told you that destiny brought you together.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Different universe, and yet somehow the same people had a way to find each other. It's the strongest argument I've ever seen for the existence of destiny.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He said he'd cross time and space itself to take what was rightfully his.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Apparently the 133 jumps we've made filled in the gaps.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Extraordinarily fortunate coincidence.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You're sensitive to light.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Only compared to a human from your universe. It's the singular biological difference between our two races.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Don't die on me, you depraved bastard.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He needed me to get onto this ship. You wouldn't have let him on otherwise.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: I need you to live or I'm as good as dead.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: You're right.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: He needed me to get to you.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: None of this was an accident. My so-called Captain's not from my universe. He's from yours.

Title: vaulting-ambition
Dialogue: Ava. Her name was Ava. And I liked her. But you know how it is. Somebody better came along.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: One year, 212 days of torture, of agony, my friends, my followers, but I have returned to give meaning to your suffering. Today is the day we reclaim our Empire.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Captain?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Welcome back, Commander Landry.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: They told us you were dead.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: And you believed them?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Not for a second, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Sir. (gives Lorca a weapon)

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Let's get you geared up.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Sir, Charon has ten battalions of Imperial guards on station. I don't know how you got here, or how you got us all out alive, but we should withdraw, regroup. We still have supporters on several worlds.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The Emperor's ship is exactly where we need to be. I have been to another universe and back. You think I'd come all this way without a plan?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Clear.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Clear.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Stamets is gone. Coward probably left at the first sign of trouble.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: All his research is still here. I've known more than one Stamets, and they both have one thing in common. They love their work too much to leave any of it behind!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Hello, Paul.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Gabriel. I really hoped you were dead.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Well, you can't always get what you want.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Hi, Doc.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Ironically, I have to thank you for helping me finish what I started. After you sold me out and ruined our coup attempt, I was down on Priors World recruiting allies when the Emperor caught up with the Buran. As I beamed back to join the fight, her torpedoes hit, and luckily, so did an ion storm, which caused a transporter malfunction, and know where I ended up?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Frankly, I'm still stuck on the not dead part.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: A parallel universe.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The ion storm must have swapped your transporter signatures.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Mmm hmm. To me, it was physics acting as the hand of destiny. My destiny. The bioweapon you were developing for the Emperor. Show it to me.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Happily, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Sensors have detected mass casualties on decks 1 through 17.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: He's come back from the grave to stage a revolution, and that's the best he's got? If he keeps doing that, he'll reveal his location. Then he's mine.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Emperor, I've seen firsthand how he operates. He can get inside your head, manipulate you.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: You think I don't know that?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: He is baiting you. He wants you to come to him. Let me contact my ship again. They have no idea they're flying into a battle zone. Please, Philippa.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I'm not Philippa to you. But you are right about one thing. He preyed on my sentiment, my weakness for your face. It will not happen again. Take her to the brig. Your choices have determined your fate.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: No.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: They'll find her, Emperor.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Take your men. Bring Lorca to me alive. I will kill him myself this time.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Captain's Log, stardate 1834.2. Acting Captain Saru recording. We are en route to the Terran flagship, having been summoned by Specialist Burnham. Discovery's spore drive is operational again, thanks to the full recovery of our navigator, Lieutenant Stamets. Yet, despite his best efforts, the Lieutenant was unable to save Discovery's mycelium crop. His fear is that his Terran counterpart has already contaminated the network, and if so, the results could be catastrophic.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What is it that you wish to show me, Lieutenant? We have less than 30 minutes before we reach the Terran vessel.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Airiam flagged it. A massive energy signature coming off the central orb.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: It's mycelial.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: This is what my counterpart has been using his mycelium for. It powers their ship.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: As it does ours.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Not exactly. We ride along the network with the spores. That orb is pulling power directly out of the network.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: But I thought the network could regenerate itself.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Typically it does, but this process is poisoning it, spreading infection back up into the system.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Without a fresh supply of spores, it'll only get worse.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The Terrans must be aware of this flaw. It's not sustainable.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I don't think sustainability is their main objective, but it does provide them with far more energy than I ever thought possible. Enough to run their city-sized ship and power weapons that can destroy a planet.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: As they did on Harlak.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: How can a people be so shortsighted?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Well, the Terrans are egotistical enough to believe that they can replenish this resource before it collapses. The other Stamets must have been looking for a solution when he got trapped in the network with me. If we don't stop them soon, the contamination will be irreversible. The network will continue to deteriorate everywhere. Here, in this universe, back in ours, across the entire multiverse.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: And when it does?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Life as we know it will cease to exist.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Take this shipwide. Hello, Philippa. I've watched for years. You let alien races spill over the borders and flourish in our backyard, then have the gall to incite rebellion. The Terrans need a leader who will preserve our way of life, our race. Try as you might, it's clearly not you. Even Michael knew that. It was her great shame. Well, it's indecorous of me to share pillow talk. To the rest, many of you know me. Some of you served with me. To all, I make this offer. Renounce Georgiou. The Empire is dying in her hands, But you don't have to. Not today. Michael Burnham is not to be touched. She is integral to our future plans. A future where we together will make the Empire glorious again.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Got him. He's in the main labs. Lorca does not control this ship. I do. We take the fight to him.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: All hail the Emperor!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Don't shoot.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Where are your troops, Commander?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We were ambushed.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: How did you survive?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lorca spared me. He said he wanted you to know.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Know what?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That he was here.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Hello, Pippa. Did you miss me?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Light her up. Mister Stamets?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Containment field at 30%. 25%. Five, four, three, two. It's down!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Flash grenade! Cover, cover!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Emergency transport!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: You didn't warn me she could do that, Mister Stamets.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Please tell me we can kill him now.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Well, that depends if he can disable an emergency transport system.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I can. I can do that.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Good. Set up a perimeter around the throne room. Let's tighten the noose.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Burnham to Discovery. Do you copy? Come in, Discovery. Burnham to Discovery. Do you copy? Come in. Discovery, do you copy? Come in. Please come in.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Discovery here. We are receiving you.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: It's good to see you, Saru.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: You as well, my friend. It appears your situation has become dire. Is the Captain with you?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: He's one of them. He's Terran. He used us and the Discovery to jump here, to his own universe. It was his plan all along.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That's impossible. Surely, we would have sensed something. I would have.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That's why we didn't end up at Starbase 46. Lorca altered the coordinates of my last jump.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: How?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: He... he got the data he needed from those jumps I did around the Klingon ship. Then all that was left was to access navigation control. And he can do that from his chair.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lorca's staging a coup against the Emperor. You have to abort coming to the palace ship. Get as far away as you can.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I will not consider leaving you behind.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Saru, he has no need for our crew. He will kill all of you. He might take Discovery back to our universe and bring the whole Terran fleet with him.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Not if the Terrans have wiped out all life already. They have created a super-mycelial reactor on the Charon, and it's destroying the network. When it goes, it takes all life with it, in all universes.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: How do we stop it?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets believes a direct hit from our photon torpedoes on their energy orb would create a detonation large enough to sever the reactor's connection and allow the network to heal itself.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We're running simulations to account for energy dispersal.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: But?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: There's a containment field protecting the orb. Our weapons can't penetrate it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Leave the containment field to me. Stay at warp, so you can't be boarded, and I'll find a way to signal you when I'm in place. Be ready to blow up the reactor when I do. Burnham out.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Believe in destiny now, Mister Stamets?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That's, er, rhetorical, right?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Your lack of vision continues to disappoint me. I used to suffer from that, too. But nothing that's happened to me was an accident. Not ending up in another world, not finding a ship that would help me return here. None of it. I'm living proof that fate is real. Speaking of which, we've reached the tipping point, where your usefulness to me is outweighed by the risk of keeping you alive. I mean, how am I ever gonna trust you? Honestly.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The living core of the mycelial network. It's poetic justice, don't you think? A scientist destroyed by his own creation? Just kidding. I hate poetry.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Sir, I'm getting word of an unauthorised ship-to-ship transmission.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That'll be my Burnham.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Hello, Michael. Judging from your communications hack, you're somewhere on the third deck Where, precisely, I can't tell, but no matter, I'm not gonna hunt you down. I'll wait for you to come to me.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What makes you think I'd do that?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Because you belong here.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: With you?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: In the real world. I know that's hard for you to see right now because you're blinded by your emotions.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The only thing I was blinded by was you.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I know you understand that I had to lie to you, Michael, to get home. Just like you know that the Federation is a social experiment doomed to failure. Childish idealism. Every species, every choice, every opinion is not equal, no matter how much they want it to be. The strong and the capable will always rise. Like you and me. And every living being is safer and happier knowing their place. That's why we have a duty to lead. Like what you did that day at the Binaries. Stay with me. Stay here and help me bring peace to this world through strength and order, the right way. There was no one else like the other you. And what she and I set out to achieve was gonna be remarkable. And then I met you. And the truth is, your gifts far surpass hers. I see you, Michael Burnham. I see your power. And I'm offering you a future. I have since the day I brought you onto the Discovery. Take it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: She rerouted the feed and disabled the carrier address. She could be anywhere.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: She'll come.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: How did you find me? My bracelet makes my life signs undetectable.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: This is your sanctuary. Considering the situation, it made sense you'd come here.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I should have known. Lorca seduced you, too.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Why would you say that?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: He broadcast for everyone to hear. Why else would he protect you?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lorca believes destiny brought me to him. But he doesn't get to tell me what my future is. I'm responsible for forging my own path. We all are. My Philippa taught me that.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: This belonged to my Michael. Now Lorca has taken everything from me.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: You lost a daughter, an empire. I lost a Captain, and a life. Both versions of me betrayed both versions of you. I won't let that happen again. And I won't let you die again.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: So that's what happened to me on your side.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I'm gonna stop Lorca.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I see why he's so enamoured with you. You almost make me believe you can do it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I will do it. For what he's done to me. For what he's done to all the innocent people who have stood in his way. And for the loss of life to come if no one stops him here today.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What is your plan?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I have to disable the orb's containment field.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Those controls are in the throne room. How will you get to them?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: By giving Lorca exactly what he wants.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We have a problem. We knew the orb harnessed exotic energy by blocking the flow of the network, but we didn't know that all those mycelial spores packed in together created hyper-gravitational and SARU magnetic fields, too.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Even a blast from our photon torpedoes won't be enough to free it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Well, then we'll have to create a chain reaction, overload it with potential energy.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What do we have that harnesses that kind of power?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Er, our harvested spores. They hold enough energy to power us across galaxies. We... we should modify our warheads by loading them up.
