Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: And how much of our spore supply would we need to use?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: All of it. We won't be able to jump back home.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We need to get in close for a clear shot. The orb is in the heart of that superstructure.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I don't think we could outmanouvre a blast like that if we're that close.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Er, I just ran the simulations. Discovery's shields aren't strong enough to protect us from the energy wave that will be released when the network is freed. The shock wave will incinerate us. I don't think we can make it out alive.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: It is well known that my species has the ability to sense the coming of death. I do not sense it today. I may not have all the answers. However, I do know that I am surrounded by a team I trust. The finest a Captain could ever hope to command. Lorca abused our idealism. And make no mistake, Discovery is no longer Lorca's. She is ours. And today will be her maiden voyage. We have a duty to perform, and we will not accept a no-win scenario. You have your orders. On your way.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We've executed her Lords and senior officers, sir. The rest of the crew are swearing allegiance to you.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Good. I was just thinking about everyone who's ever said that victory felt empty when it was attained. What a bunch of idiots they were.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: She's here.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Michael. What's this about?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I won't let another crew die on my watch, Gabriel. I've been here long enough to know that if you want your claim to the throne to be legitimate, you have to execute the Emperor.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: And you're prepared to condemn Philippa here to death?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What you said on the shuttle yesterday was right. She's not my Philippa.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That's very Terran of you. But you and I both know that I have her now. What are you really bargaining with?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I think you know. In exchange for my crew, I offer you me. Let them leave safely and I'm yours. Like you said, my future is here. But know this. I'm offering you my mind, nothing more.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Until you've completely settled in. I'm sure you understand.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Well it looks like you are destined to be betrayed by Burnhams in every universe.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: No. I'm destined to kill you.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Wow. That would certainly be an impressive trick. Welcome home, Michael.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The Captain was right.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What about?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Do not accept a no-win scenario. They're may be a way out of this after all. I've reanalysed the simulations. Now, if we blow the reactor core, the resulting explosion will be pure mycelial energy, right?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Right. Right. But not just an explosion. According to this, the mother of mycelial shockwaves.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: If we can stay right on the leading edge, we can ride it long enough for the energy to activate the drive, and then you can navigate us home.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: But the ship's shields still aren't strong enough to protect us, unless we modify the spore drive to run concurrently with the warp drive. The resulting warp bubble may provide a secondary layer of protection. A shield from the blast. If I reverse engineer the coordinates that Lorca used to get us here, I should be able to pinpoint the... the right pathway to take. And... and that will get us to the same point in our timeline, or at least close to it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: There will be infinite pathways opening up in front of you. That... that's gonna be really

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Hard is the word you're looking for. But I don't accept no-win scenarios. Thank you for your inspiration, Cadet. Now, please, inform the captain of your findings. Looks like we may be going home after all.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Message from the Charon, sir. We're advised that it's safe to drop out of warp. The message has Burnham's security code on it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lieutenant Detmer, drop us out of warp.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Captain, we're being hailed. It's Lorca, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: On screen.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Mister Saru. It's good to see you. I'm glad I got a chance to say goodbye to you, and the rest of the crew. I want you to know that my admiration for you was and is sincere. When I look at you, I see the formidable unit of soldiers that I sculpted. If I thought for a second that any of you were capable of relinquishing this cult-like devotion to the Federation, I'd enlist your skills today.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We are not interested in your sentiments. Where is Specialist Burnham?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: She's fine. You don't die today because she chose to stay by my side.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I would like to hear that from her. You are not a reliable source.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I'm where I need to be, Saru. This is my place.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: That is all I needed to see.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Fire! Owosekun, keep your eye on that containment field.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Detmer, get ready to give Rhys a clear shot.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Let's go, people.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Wait. Stop! Don't make me have to kill you.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: You won't.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We would've helped you get home if you had asked. That's who Starfleet is. That's who I am. That's why I won't kill you now.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: But I will!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: We... We could've

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: It was a good plan.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Burnham did it. The containment field is down.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Beam her back now.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I can't get a lock, Captain. I'm working on it.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Work faster.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: You fought well. For a moment I thought I had her back with me.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lorca's troops. I will buy you some time. I am a defeated Emperor. They've seen my neck. I have no future now. But I will die on my feet as fitting my station. Go, Michael Burnham. Find a way home. Live.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Burnham to Discovery.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I've got her.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Get her out of there now.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: She's on board.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Black alert.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Black alert. Black alert.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Lock weapons onto that ship!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The Terran ship is targeting us, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: It's now or never, Lieutenant Detmer.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What the hell are they doing? Is the containment field up?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Locked on, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Fire, Mister Rhys!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Warp speed now!

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Ambient mycelial energy is interacting with the drive.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Cadet Tilly?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Levels look good.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Engage the spore drive, now.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: It's working. The network is regenerating.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Heat shields at maximum.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The pathways are bifurcating too quickly. I don't know where to go.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: The network is a gift. It's the thread that weaves life through space.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: I can't even find my way out.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Follow the music, Paul. Open your eyes.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Wait. It's the clearing in the forest. Thanks, Hugh.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Tilly. Reboot the system and find out where we are. And when.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What have you done to me?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Captain, celestial patterns and subatomic analysis confirm we are in our Alpha Quadrant.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Oh.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: But we overshot by nine months.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Mister Bryce, send a transmission to Starfleet. Inform them we have returned.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Mister Rhys. Update our tactical map. I need to see the status of the war.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Captain, there's no response from the Federation to our signal. Not even an automated one.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: What does that mean?

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: War map on screen, Captain.

Title: whats-past-is-prologue
Dialogue: Well, if the map is to be believed, it appears the Klingons have won the war.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Captain.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Emperor. On your knees, slave.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: This Kelpien is my captain. Sir, I can explain.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Yesterday we dined on the entrails of his brethren, and today you seek his favour?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Transport our visitor to guest quarters on deck three and confine her there now.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You told me there were no Kelpiens in the other universe. You lied.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I hoped to spare you the pain.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The presence of a Terran defector on this ship is to be regarded as classified. Its utterance will carry a penalty of treason. Do you understand?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Captain, your presence is requested in sickbay.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: With me.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I could offer excuses. I was trying to destabilise the Terran Empire. I... I thought Starfleet could benefit from learning about an alternate universe. The truth is that I just couldn't watch her die again, Saru. I wanted to offer her more. I am sorry.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Saving Georgiou may indeed prove to be a grave error in judgment, but no one else could have done what you did aboard that Terran flagship. You are alive, and we are home.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Any news from Command?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Federation ships have appeared on long-range sensors, but none answer my hail.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Doesn't feel much like home.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Discovery suffered damage riding the mycelial shock wave back into our universe. We are running on auxiliary power until repairs are complete.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Deck four. Doctor Pollard has orders to alert me when Lieutenant Tyler regains consciousness. An emergency surgical procedure proved necessary. An attempt to excise the Klingon in Tyler's neurological identity.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: How? What happened to him was completely outside of the realm of sanctioned medicine.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Starfleet did not perform the procedure. It was the Klingon L'Rell.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: His torturer?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And handler. She oversaw Tyler's transformation. None of us are sure what state we might find him in. I am hoping that a familiar face could offer him encouragement to heal. How he reacts to you may offer us insight into who he has become.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Captain, he's awake.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Is that an order, Captain?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I fail to understand.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Is that an order, to see him?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: No.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I can't.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: What are your findings, Doctor?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: By all assessments, the patient now presents as Ash Tyler. Adrenocorticotropic hormonal levels are normal. Cellular mitochondria counts are back within human range. I find no remaining evidence of Klingon aggression or muscular stamina.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: So, is he human or Klingon?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Neither. Both. We can't be sure. Not without understanding the science behind the reassignment procedure.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And how do we do that?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I suppose we could start by asking him.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Tyler?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Mister Saru. Thanks for the save.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And Voq? I can access his memories, but there's a disconnect. Like watching someone else's life or something.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Do you remember what was done to you?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The Mo'Kai call it a choH' a'. Species reassignment protocol. Specifically designed to infiltrate classified Starfleet intelligence.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Are there others?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Voq was the test case. They flayed his skin, cracked his bones open, sawed his heart into pieces. You think that'll be the worst of it, then they start shaving down the tips of your fingers. Voq was T'Kuvma's Torchbearer. He submitted to the torture willingly, at L'Rell's behest. They were the only true believers left. Voq and L'Rell believed taking the ship would bring followers back to T'Kuvma's House. They were in love, you know.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I... Will you cooperate with us? Share everything you know?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Of course. I would do anything to undo what I've done. Is she alive?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Specialist Burnham has returned safely aboard Discovery.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Thank God. Can I

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Focus on your recovery. You both survived a harrowing ordeal.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Saru, I tried to kill her. I murdered Doctor Culber. I belong in the brig.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Voq is responsible for your crimes, and I see no semblance of him before me. Your privileges aboard Discovery will be limited, but I will not take your freedom.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Vessel is approaching, sir. Federation signature.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Hail them at once.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Captain, its shields are up. It... Its phasers are charged and targeting.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Shields up.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I'm picking up an incoming transporter signature. We're being boarded.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Identify yourselves!

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Hands where I can see them!

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I demand an explanation for this intrusion!

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: We ask the questions. Clear for transport.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Where's Captain Lorca?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Sarek, please.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Stand down, Specialist. Now. Computer, initiate command-level override. Authorisation Admiral Katrina Cornwell, pi beta six.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Override confirmed.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Start with him.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Ambassador, what are you doing?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: What the times require. My mind to your mind. My thoughts to your thoughts.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Ah!

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Mister Saru is who he appears to be. The Discovery has been through an inconceivable ordeal.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Then where the hell is her commanding officer?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Captain Lorca is dead.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Bastard. (phasers the bowl of cookies to oblivion) The Lorca I came up with was measured, he was reasoned. But I couldn't have imagined

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: That Lorca was an impostor from an alternate universe was not the most obvious conclusion. We were all deceived.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Discovery was destroyed by Klingons nine months ago. I saw the debris with my own eyes.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: That wreckage belonged to the Terran Discovery. The two ships switched places when we jumped across universes.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: From what you've told us about the Terran Empire, no Starfleet officer could survive that universe alone, so my Gabriel is dead. Lorca sidelined the most vital asset in our fleet. Now, with your return, we have disseminated your hard-earned, cloak-breaking algorithm to the front lines, which will neutralise the Klingons' ability to render their ships invisible. But our fear is it's too late. The war here has waged on for nine brutal months without it. Stardate 4789.6. Klingon vessels launch hypothermic charges at Kelfour VI, burning off their atmosphere and killing 11,000 civilians instantly. Stardate 4851.5. A cloaked raider tails the USS Saratoga into spacedock at Starbase 22, then ignites its antimatter supply in a suicide mission. Days later, similar assaults are carried out on bases 19 and 12, resulting in the loss of one-third of our fleet. Research outposts at the border colonies of Nivalla, Septra and Iridin have also been destroyed. The only children spared are now orphans.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: There's no pattern to these attacks. There's no logical progression to their targets. There's not even consistency of method.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: In the absence of a clear leader, the Klingon Houses are divided once again. At the start of this war, we fought one enemy. Now, we fight 24. They quarrel among themselves, hence the indiscriminate nature of their aggression. But their collective aim seems clear. To compete for dominance by seeing which House can destroy the most Federation assets. We are fodder for their futile savagery. Our deaths, their spoils.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Nearly 20% of former Federation space has been occupied. Discovery will jump to Starbase One immediately. All evidence of your recent journey will be classified and destroyed. We cannot risk the knowledge of this alternate universe leaving the confines of Discovery.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I don't understand.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: There would be too many possibilities.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Of course, Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Starbase One is our only remaining sanctuary. Can you jump us there?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Well, it's, er, 100 AUs from Earth and over a light-year from our current position. We used up the last of our supply of spores to get us home, and I can't jump without them.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The journey at warp will be perilous. Klingons swarm the quadrant.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I'm afraid we have no choice. Saru, take the ship to warp as soon as possible.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Admiral There's one more thing you need to know.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Emperor, the Federation has questions. I need you to answer them.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: What kind of guest would I be if I refused such a simple request?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I'm told that, in your universe, your word is law. Here, we do things differently.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I can see that.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The resemblance is remarkable. What do you know of your counterpart, Captain Philippa Georgiou?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I know that she is dead and I am not. But I will leave you to determine which of us has proved stronger.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Specialist Burnham has assured us that your arrival in this universe is without motive, but your presence here remains complicated.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The solution, however, is not. Send me home.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The Emperor narrowly escaped a violent revolution. She deserves political asylum.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I don't need your protection.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: We have charted a course for Starbase One. You will be held there, humanely, until Command can determine a proper course of action.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: So I am your prisoner.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Look, Your Highness, or whatever you're called, I'll tell it to you straight. I'm not even sure we know how to send you home, and even if we did, we have a war to fight. I'm sorry. Like I said, you're our guest. Make yourself at home. (to Sarek) The resemblance is remarkable.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Stamets, I'm sorry. Words... Words are not enough, and I know that. But I am.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You killed a good man. A man that I loved. Do you remember that?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I do now.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And does it gut you? Does it sicken you? (Tyler nods) Good. Maybe you're still human after all.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You don't have to do this. I'm okay.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: How could that possibly be true? Just eat. And talk, if you want to. I'm here.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Welcome back.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Admiral. Starbase One within range.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Well done, all.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: USS Discovery to Starbase One, permission to initiate docking procedures.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: She'll be a sight for sore eyes.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Admiral, I'm unable to establish contact.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Reset our channels. I'll override the comms restrictions manually.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Detmer, drop us out of warp.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Aye, Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Bring Starbase One on screen.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Aye, Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: No.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Enhancing image.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: That's a Klingon crest. House D'Ghor.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: They've seized a Federation starbase?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Scan for life signs. Now!

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: - Complying. Sensing 274 Klingon life signs aboard.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Federation life.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Er, negative, Admiral. There's nothing.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: There were 80,000 souls on that base. A large contingent of our leadership and at least three starships. The Klingons are practically in Earth's backyard.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Captain, we're being scanned.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Detmer, maximum warp. Get us out of here.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Long range sensors to maximum.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Maintain constant scans of Klingon contacts.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Admiral, Discovery awaits your orders.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Maintain current course and speed. We will make contact with Command. What's left of them.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You live.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And you've finally made it aboard the USS Discovery, though I suspect you've found the accommodations lacking.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Even from a cage, Kahless hears my call.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I do not subscribe to your ideals. And yet, I feel as though you and I understand each other.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: T'Kuvma taught that all humans are without courage. About this, he was wrong.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I want to be truthful with you. Your side is winning. When we met, you had nothing but contempt for the crumbling leadership of the Klingon Empire.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: T'Kuvma sought to strengthen and unify the Great Houses. If he has succeeded in only this, it is cause for celebration.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Your Great Houses are carving up Federation assets among their factions. A captured starbase bears the insignia of House D'Ghor, not of the Klingon Empire. Is that the kind of unity your messiah proclaimed? They think nothing of the collateral damage caused by their brutal attacks. They target civilians, hospitals, food convoys. They slaughter innocents and inspire terror across the quadrant.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: This is war, not a child's game with rules. We fight to preserve Klingon identity.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: No one is looking to destroy your culture. Our laws are founded in equality, freedom.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: T'Kuvma taught us that the Federation cannot help itself. It seeks universal homogenisation and assimilation.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: T'Kuvma was an ignorant fool, and your people are moving closer and closer to my home planet. What are you looking for? More territory? Conditional surrender? I mean, your people won't even make demands. Why? How does this war end?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: It doesn't. Klingons have tasted your blood. Conquer us or we will never relent.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Thank you.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: There's been a change of plans. Another Klingon attack. You'll have to stay on board Discovery a little while longer.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: It makes no difference. One cell in this universe is as good as another. You heard your Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: We mean you no harm. The Admiral was just

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Tell me about the Vulcan. There is a connection between the two of you.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Why would you say that?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The way you look at him is not unlike the way you look at me.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: He's essentially my father. He raised me.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: So you were orphaned here as well.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Another echo of fate between our worlds. Your rule extends through every system in your galaxy. You've conquered places Starfleet hasn't even dared to explore. I see now that the time for peace has passed. I need you to tell me, how did you defeat the Klingon Empire? I started this war, and I need to finish it.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Why did you bring me here? Truly.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I wanted to show you a place of morality, of hope.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Let me tell you, daughter who is not my daughter. In truth, you wished to save me because you couldn't save her. This regret that you have for what you did, it weakens you.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I feel it every day of my life.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The Klingons are like cancer cells, constantly dividing. To root them out, you must destroy the tumour at its source. How much do you know about Qo'noS?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I suppose I don't have to tell you it's the middle of the night.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I have a proposal.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I left Discovery only to learn that a Klingon attack is imminent. They are gathering forces to launch a strike on this whole system.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The Klingons are taking the fight to us. We need to take it to them, to Qo'noS.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Attack the Klingon homeworld?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Not a simple attack. A simultaneous strike on their planetary-defence batteries, immediately followed by the coordinated destruction of all military targets planetwide. A single offensive so destructive, it will force the enemy to retreat from Federation space and head for home.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Our remaining fleet is being called back to defend Earth. Discovery should join them.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Each path of logic leads to the same conclusion. Starfleet tactics have failed us. We must adapt if we're to have any hope of survival.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Qo'noS is uncharted territory.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: We have no idea where their defence batteries are, much less their weapon production systems or shipyards.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The planet's dense upper atmosphere prevents long-range topographical and energy analysis, and no Starfleet officer has set foot there in this century.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Your strategy is a good one, Katrina, but it's not feasible without a map. And by the time Discovery got close enough to begin surveying, they'd blow her out of the sky.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: She's not gonna be in the sky.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Let's go over it again.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Qo'noS is composed of a subterranean series of now dormant volcanoes. It is a planet of caves.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Some of them, according to Specialist Burnham's intel, are big enough to house a Crossfield-class starship.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Rather than surveil our targets from orbit, we can map the terrain from the inside out.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Thereby minimizing our risk of detection.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Jumping a massive starship inside a cave of impenetrable rock does seem... challenging. Travel aboard the mycelial network is, in itself, a sort of advanced detection system of geophysical imaging. I can easily identify the voids in energy that would represent a chasm versus a solid mass.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And once we're in position within the cave system, we'll release our surveillance drone to collect the necessary tactical information.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Good. Because I've assured Starfleet we can do this. And by we, I mean you. It's a good plan, Specialist. Well done.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Thank you, Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: One question. How do we get the spores necessary to make the jump?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: We'll have to grow them ourselves.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: My understanding is that your crop took years to cultivate.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Set a course for the Veda system, and get ready for a show.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Prototaxites stellaviatori. My original sample, and the last-remaining mycelium of this strain. We are headed to an uninhabited class-4 moon in the Veda system. And if this works, I might even let you name it.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You're gonna terraform a moon? Your own research on the success of an organic mycelial harvest was indeterminable. I've studied your data myself

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Straal quashed it. He wanted to keep the crop captive, but if ever there was a time to go wild

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Your child is lost.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Do not confuse my ward with yours.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: My daughter was a singular example of brilliance until one foolish choice doomed her world. Sound familiar?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: If I understand correctly, my ward saw through the man who brought down not just your child, but your empire. Perhaps best not to make comparisons. Why have you requested my presence?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You were summoned, Vulcan, for one reason. I want to help you end this war.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The information you provided Michael has already proved valuable.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I told her as much as she could handle. Our daughters are not so unlike after all. In my world, Qo'noS is little more than a blackened mass of dust. The Klingons fight for scraps and fear certain death. But it took a great deal more than a mapping drone in a cave to get there.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You assured Michael that your plan would prove effective.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And it will, momentarily. But they will regroup. Their longing to destroy the symbol that is Earth runs far too deep. What if I could show you how to bring them to their knees once and for all?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The Federation does not subscribe to what I imagine are Terran methods of combat.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: You face annihilation. Is it not logical to do anything you can to save the lives of your kind? Give me what I want, and I can assure victory for the Federation.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: What are your terms?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Freedom.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I must return to Vulcan. There are evolving details to the plan that must be considered.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: What evolving details?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I sense you are uneasy. During my mind-meld with Saru, I learned of your attachment to the Klingon spy and what he did to you. Such events are clearly troubling.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I'm fine, Sarek.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I remain unconvinced. There is irony here, of course. The man you fell in love with was a Klingon.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: He... I don't know what he was.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: There is also grace. For what greater source of peace exists than our ability to love our enemy?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I've made foolish choices. Emotional choices.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Well, you are human. As is your mother. There is no telling what any one of us may do where the heart is concerned. We are at war. Logic dictates that each farewell may be our last.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Do not regret loving someone, Michael.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Admiral Cornwell requested a status report.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: This is the last of the mycelial transport vessels. We will be able to launch by the time we reach Veda.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I just said goodbye to my father, and it felt different. Final. It won't be, right?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Did you ever think when you signed up for Starfleet, that you'd be forced to see war and death?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Death found me when I was a child. So, yeah, I knew what I was getting into.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I don't think I did. Not really. Does that make me naive?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: It makes you optimistic.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: When we were in the Terran universe, I was reminded how much a person is shaped by their environment. And I think the only way that we can stop ourselves from becoming them is to understand the darkness within us, and fight it. Tyler needs you.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I'm told he's doing well.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: That's not possible, not when you've lost the person you care about the most.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: He killed a Starfleet officer, and he he tried to kill me.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: And those crimes are reprehensible, but Tyler is not the person who did that. At least he's he's not anymore. He is something other, someone new. And what we do now, the way that we treat him, that is who he will become. I know you still care about him.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I do. That does not mean I should.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Michael, he's been stripped of his badge. He'll never fly for Starfleet again. He'll be lucky if he doesn't end up in a lab or a cell. What kind of future can he have? Say what you have to say, even if it's goodbye.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Lieutenant Stamets, your stop.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Locked and loaded, Admiral.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Detmer, put her into geostationary orbit.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Locking in approximately 800 kilometers above the moon's surface.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Copy that.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Initiating mycelial ejection protocol. Engaging agri-transport boosters.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Status, Lieutenant Stamets.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Sensors from the terraforming field show

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Root structures forming in zones 922 and 5041. Ready the EM darts.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Darts calibrated.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Fire.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Come on, kiddos. Come on.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Spore generation at four percent. Eight percent. Twelve percent. Fifteen percent. Nineteen percent. Twenty two percent. Twenty seven percent.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I would congratulate you, Lieutenant, but I'm afraid the work has just begun.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Forty seven percent. Fifty two percent.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I don't know where to start.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I do. I'm sorry. I know there's no way I can prove this to you, but Voq, he's gone.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I believe you. Was there ever really an Ash Tyler? And did he love me? Because I loved him. You lied to me. You said that if it got to be too much, that if you couldn't handle it, you would come to me. And it did. And you didn't. And that wasn't Voq, that was you. Tyler.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Who the hell is Tyler? You think I know anymore? You think I have any idea who I am now, where I belong? This isn't about a lie. This is about you looking for an excuse to end it.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Excuse?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: My crewmates have been kinder than they need to be. Why are you, the person who knows me best, so quick to turn your back?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Stop.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I want you to admit it. Admit that you can't do this anymore because you finally went there with someone and things got complicated. Because your parents were killed by Klingons and you fell in love with one.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Maybe you're right. I know in my head that you couldn't be responsible for Voq's actions, but I felt your hands around my neck. And I looked into your eyes and I saw how much you wanted to kill me. The man that I love wanted me dead. And no matter how hard I try, when I look at you now, I see Voq's eyes. I see him. Your crew may have put it behind them, but I can't.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: I shouldn't be here. I should be an activated Klingon spy, behind bars or dead. Michael, the reason it didn't take, the reason L'Rell couldn't get through to me? That was you. Did Ash Tyler love you? Hell yes, he did. And I can't find my way back without you.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: We created something beautiful today in a desolate wasteland that had never seen life. After the Battle of the Binary Stars I was so lost. I had to sit with myself. I had to work through it. I had to crawl my way back. I'm still not there, but I'm trying. That kind of work, reclaiming life, it's punishing and it's relentless. And it's solitary.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: No, I...

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Ash. It's not easy letting you go.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The mycelial bloom was successful. A spore harvest is underway.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Then the jump to Qo'noS will be possible?

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Yes. Imminently.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: The Federation Council has been briefed on our newly acquired intelligence from the Terran. Despite the extraordinary risk, all are agreed that we have no choice but to proceed. Our very existence hangs in the balance.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Then it's time.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Open a shipwide channel. We have all mourned the enormous loss of life due to this war. The acts of violence committed against us are the acts of a foe without reason, without honour. And they will not stop coming after us in the hopes of destroying everything that we hold dear. These are desperate times, and they call on us to do more than merely protect our people, defend our borders. I stand before you with a mission. At 2100 hours, the USS Discovery will jump for the Klingon homeworld in order to map its surface and isolate vulnerabilities and military targets. This brave team will be the first to visit this inhospitable planet since Captain Archer and the crew of the Enterprise NX-01 nearly 100 years ago. So allow me to introduce you to the person who will chart your course to Qo'noS. Captain Philippa Georgiou.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Thank you.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Though long presumed dead, Captain Georgiou was recently rescued in a highly classified raid of a Klingon prison vessel. She was transported aboard Discovery with my personal retinue. The mission to Qo'noS is a perilous expedition, and Starfleet is confident that Captain Georgiou is uniquely qualified to get you there and to do what needs to be done.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Specialist Burnham, I trust that this will be an auspicious reunion, despite our history. Now take your station.

Title: the-war-without-the-war-within
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: We have acquired the target.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: On the eve of battle, on a cold and windless night, an old general turned to a young soldier. "Tomorrow," said the master, "you will know fear." The young soldier, who had not yet experienced the agony of war, looked at the general with quizzical eyes. "How will I know fear if I do not know what it looks like?" The general replied, "You will know fear because it speaks very fast and it speaks very loud."

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Status, helm?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Bearing 94 mark 21, 12 light-years from Klingon homeworld

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Do not show respect by referring to that green dot as homeworld. Klingons are animals, and they don't have homes. Call it Qo'noS, or the enemy planet. Ops?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Shields holding at 100%. Our scans show

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I have little interest in what we're scanning. I care what's scanning us. Communications?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Discovery is running dark, Captain.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: My favorite way to run.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: If that is how fear acts, recognizing it is easy. But as the young soldier considered the general's advice, she asked the question facing us now. "Once I know fear, how do I defeat it?"

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Specialist, I would appreciate your help with a glitch in the optical-data network.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: (sotto) She does not embody Federation ideals, and we're supposed to follow her orders?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: (sotto) The Federation put her here.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Burnham. I did not give you permission to leave your station.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What's wrong? Are you scared, Number One? Where I'm from, there's a saying. Scared Kelpien makes for tough Kelpien. Have you gotten tough since we served together on the Shenzhou, Mister Saru?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Affirmative, Captain. Very tough. So much so that many find me simply unpalatable.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Hmm. I don't know about that.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Where are you from, Captain? That saying about Kelpiens is so apt, having experienced it firsthand. I wonder where it originated.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Don't be silly, Michael. You know I grew up in Malaysia.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: But where, exactly? I went there with you once, but I can't remember the name.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Pulau Langkawi.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Right. Those beautiful beaches.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Indeed. Let's take a walk.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Try to expose me again and I'll lock you in the brig.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: If Starfleet recruited a Terran to lead the mission, they are desperate.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The Federation had a problem. I offered them a solution in exchange for my freedom. And what's so bad about desperation? You were desperate when you begged me to reveal how my Empire beat the Klingons. You instigate valiantly, then second-guess. I've now read about your actions on the eve of the war. You know your problem? No follow-through. You should have killed my counterpart in her Ready room, attacked the Klingons, and then been a hero.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: (grabbing Georgiou's arm) Tell me the real plan.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Never do that again. Your Federation is losing. (Burnham lets go) The Klingon armada is already headed toward your homeworld. My knowledge is giving you a fighting chance. Are you with me or against me?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: With you, Captain.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You? How? Our Lord pierced your heart. House T'Kuvma feasted on your flesh.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You have the wrong Philippa Georgiou.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Either way, I can tell you require seasoning.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: My home.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: There are seven chimneys on Qo'noS which lead into a dormant volcano system. Of these, which is the best for a landing party to reach on foot?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I will tell you nothing. This war ends when we crush you, united under T'Kuvma's call.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: This war may rage on, but your war, your great dream of Klingon unification? It's already lost.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: (Klingonaase) Go to hell, very small human.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You both talk too much.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No!

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Reactivate containment field. Control to my voice. (hits L'Rell) Tell me where my party should land.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You have already lost.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Enough! There's another way.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Admiral Cornwell briefed me on this half-breed. I can see, from a strategic standpoint, its value as a weapon, but as it's Klingon, it has been neutered. It is benign, useless to them, yet tarnished to the Federation, so what good is it to either side?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: He has access to the Klingon's memories.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: All I can see is a who-knows-what playing with a string.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: This is a bowline, it doesn't run. It doesn't slip. It's the first thing I learned as a kid that made me me. It ties me to my past, who I am. Voq's life, his memories, they're here too. Always with me. I'm willing to share his knowledge. Not for you, but for Starfleet. Do you want my help or not?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What do you know about the surface of Qo'noS?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The plan is to use a drone with rock-penetrating surveillance systems to map the surface and identify military targets, in preparation for a future full-scale attack. Unfortunately, the cave Discovery will hide in isn't connected to the planet's dormant volcanoes. In order for the mapping drone to work, it has to be introduced into one of these. As you're aware, information regarding Qo'noS is virtually non-existent. We're depending on black market surveys acquired by the Vulcans over a century ago.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: This chimney's in the High Council chamber of the First City. All high-bred arrogance, that place. This one's now flooded by the River Skral. Here, this is your best bet. The safest access point for the drone. Centuries ago, when the caldera was active, these vents were shrines. Live sacrifices were thrown in to honour Molor. When Kahless defeated Molor, those temples were abandoned, built over. The ones that remained were shielded to make them impossible to find with sensors. You'll have to transport down there and do the legwork yourself.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What's there now?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The land was given to the Orions, who built an embassy outpost over the ruins.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: In my world, the Orions are delinquents, pirates, slave traders.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It's not much different in ours.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Excellent. He will accompany us and help us sniff out what we're after. Will that be a problem?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No. Captain.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I looked over the crew manifest. There's somebody else I want with us. Enter. (door opens) I am so pleased to see you, Tilly.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Thank you. I have heard and read so much about you. Michael can attest, I'm always asking about Captain Georgiou.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Seeing your face reminds me of the great fun the two of us had, subjugating the Betazoids, Wiping out Mintaka III.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, she's not

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: So she's from

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Mmm.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You're the Terran Emperor.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Don't do that.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You look so much like her. Younger, maybe. But all that killing ages a person.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I know. What is happening?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: She requested you, for the landing party.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh. But just so you're clear, I am not the same person I was in your universe.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Don't be so sure, Killy. You will have the honour of carrying the mapping drone. Go to quarters. Dress as lowlifes. We need items to trade so as to seem legitimate. Gabriel must have found something interesting lying around in this universe.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You gonna be okay down there?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You don't need to worry about me.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Ready, Lieutenant Stamets?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: First an alternate universe, now a Klingon cave on a hundred-year-old map. Ready as can be, Mister Saru.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Black alert. To Qo'noS, please.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Aye, Captain.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Black alert. Black alert.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Shields holding.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Stabiliser beams are compensating for the planet's gravitational pull.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Am I good or what?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: We are aboard and steady.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You are clear to transport.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Energise.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Not a lot of humans around here.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Except the dregs from our race.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Exactly. The Orions here aren't likely to trust us or give up any information.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Keep walking, Federation. No one wants you here.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Tilly.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: (gun to head) Insult her again, and your nose is gonna be able to sniff the back of your head.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: We're here to make a deal. Show her the stash. Tell her what she's looking at.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Nausicaan disruptor pistols. Latest spec. Paralithium cell with beam and a pulse firing mode. Polyalloy casings, making it all but invisible to security screeners.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: 2,000 darseks.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Let's see what else you got.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: All this arms dealing has my appetite up. Anyone else hungry? Anyone? Michael?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Greetings.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Two, please.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What is that?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I have no idea. I'm not actually hungry. I wanted to talk to you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I intuited.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Do you have any idea what she might be up to?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No. All we can do is watch her like a hawk, and make sure she stays on mission.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I er, I realise how hard this must be for you, but I got your back.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Thank you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What is that?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Delicious.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It's a space whale.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Gormagander? (food drops from her open mouth)

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Enough distractions. We're not here for bread and circuses.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: (in Orion) Get out! All of you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: On second thought, the circus is where we'll start.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: So, what should we

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Shh! I knew your whole universe couldn't be boring. (hands a device to Tyler) Use this. We'll be more effective if we split up. Buy information. Whatever gets us to that shrine.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Hmm. How much for a little me time?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Over there.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Bring your friend.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No, no, that, very generous. I think I'll... I'm just gonna stay out here.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: She's not for you. Guard the drone.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Maybe these guys can lead us to the shrine.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: If they'll talk to us.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The game is called t'Sang. It translates to obliterate them.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You know how to play?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I think I do. And I think I'm good at it. I mean, Voq was good at it. He was a decent gambler. He felt the numbers always fell his way, as if the universe was making up for his bad luck with everything else.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Like what?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: He was born with a rare mutation that made his skin translucent white. The others considered him a freak of nature.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What are you doing here, human? Spying for the Federation?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No, I'm looking to take a few hundred darseks from losers like you. Let's begin your humiliation.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Do you have cash to play, little boy with a big mouth?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Out of my way.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Place your bets.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Croupier.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Red. Red.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: New player goes first. Two! Two! Victory! Destroy him! Two! Victory! Owned!

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Join me?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, thank you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Smoke?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, that, that's so sweet. No, thank you. I have, er, I have a very narrow esophagus. It's strange but true, so that's bad for that. I'm not... I'm not trying to be rude

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Get her out.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You know what? I would love some. Just a little bit.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Inhale.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Do you think, do you think I got

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I got nothing. None of them know about an ancient shrine.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You won everyone over quickly.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: A human speaking Klingon is amusing to them. Might as well be a dog on waterskis.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Is that an old Klingon saying?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No, I... I just made it up. I like to waterski.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Yeah, you have a boat. I remember.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You raced out of there pretty quick. You all right?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I never told you about my parents. What happened to them.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No. I mean, I've heard things. I never wanted to push.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: They were stationed at a human-Vulcan science outpost at Doctari Alpha. My mom and dad had planned a family vacation to Mars, but I begged them to stay for three more days so I could witness a nearby star go supernova. Then the Klingons attacked. My dad tried to barricade the kitchen door while my mom hid me in a cabinet. And I couldn't see, but I could hear everything. They killed my dad first. That was quick. They took longer with my mom. And when it was over, they sat down at our table. Ate dinner. Our dinner. And they were talking and laughing. And just now, all that laughter...

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: How could you not hate them? And me, for what I've become?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It would be so much simpler if I could. I look around here and I just I see people living their lives. Maybe it's not normal to us, but in their own way, ordinary. The Emperor was wrong. This is a home. And if we give the Federation targets to attack, it won't ever be the same.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I can see both sides. Literally. The side I've chosen is where you stand, where it's possible to feel compassion and sympathy for your enemy. But I can guarantee no Klingon ever felt that way toward you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You did.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You see that? Pouring an extra drink. Setting it on fire. That's a step specific to the followers of Molor. There's a decent chance they know about that shrine.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Did you enjoy yourself?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Did you?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I learned so many new things. We shouldn't charge you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: But we have to charge you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Perhaps if you teach me something new, it will be fair trade.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Where is the shrine of Molor?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Hey, stop! Hey, stop. Shame on you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You were asleep. I'm Orion.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What did, erh, we inhale? My mouth tastes like sulphur and... and ash.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Volcanic vapour, straight from the source.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Yeah, but not really, right? 'Cause all the volcanoes here are extinct.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, no. They're alive.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Then how's the drone gonna get down there? The heat will destroy it. Give me that.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, shit. That is not a drone. Tilly to Burnham.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Go ahead, Tilly.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: First of all, so, I'm very high, er, but you need to listen to me.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: There are active volcanoes right beneath us right now

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: And the drone, also, that's not a drone. It's a, it's a like a hydro bomb. We keep them on the Discovery so we can reco

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What did you say about a hydro bomb?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Tilly? Cadet, respond.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I know where to find the shrine. What's wrong?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It's Tilly.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: A hydro bomb? What kind of damage can it do?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Detonate it into an active volcanic system, it's just... apocalyptic.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: A phreatic eruption. Water flashes into steam and triggers a massive explosion.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Landmasses directly over the reaction centre will be vaporised.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Ash will fill the atmosphere. Within weeks, Qo'noS will be uninhabitable.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: This was the plan all along. Burnham to Discovery.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Go ahead, Burnham.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Georgiou is about to instigate a catastrophic natural disaster on Qo'noS. She may already be in the shrine. Can you get a transporter lock on her?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Affirmative. However, beaming her out is not an option.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The shrine's shields make it unsafe for biological transport.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What about the bomb? Can you get the bomb?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: We are too late. The signal's fading. We must contact Starfleet.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Saru, I think she's following Starfleet's orders. I need to talk to Admiral Cornwell.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Is this how Starfleet wins the war? Genocide?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You want to do this here? Fine. Terms of atrocity are convenient after the fact. The Klingons are on the verge of wiping out the Federation.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Yes. But ask yourself. Why did you put this mission in the hands of a Terran and why the secrecy? It's because you know it's not who we are.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It very soon will be. We do not have the luxury of principles.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: That is all we have, Admiral. A year ago I stood alone. I believed that our survival was more important than our principles. I was wrong. Do we need a mutiny today to prove who we are?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: We are Starfleet.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What is it you're suggesting?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Change of plans.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Really? Says who?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Deactivate the detonator, Philippa. Your freedom is still granted. Here's the proof.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You talked them out of it, didn't you?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Of planetary slaughter? Yes.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, don't be so dramatic. When I did this in my universe, it didn't wipe out the Klingons. A decent number should be able to save themselves. Plus, they'll have an advantage. No Terran ships firing on them as they try to escape.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Turn it off.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Has it ever occurred to you that I was doing this for you? By ending the war, I'd set you free from the guilt and pain you carry because of it.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Not buying it.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Worth a try.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You really are nothing like my Georgiou, are you?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No. And I never have been. She's dead, Michael. There are no second chances.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No, I suppose not.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I do like you. Why not join me? The bomb is in position. We have the detonator. Starfleet and Klingon alike will be at our mercy.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I had much the same thought. Give it to me.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Take your freedom in exchange for the detonator, or try to escape my ship and its crew and be hunted by the Federation for the rest of your days.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You think your Federation scares me?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Not particularly. But the only way you're gonna get past me is to kill me. So you'll have to watch me die again. And did I mention being hunted for the rest of your days?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The detonator is coded to my bioprint. Would you like it recoded to yours?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Not to mine, no. (into communicator) All clear.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What is this?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: This is the place the Federation crushed the Klingons. We've planted a bomb in the heart of your homeworld. Qo'noS will be destroyed.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You bring me here to gloat?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: No. To offer you an alternative.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Klingons respond to strength. Use the fate of Qo'noS to bend them to your will. Preserve your civilisation rather than watch it be destroyed.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: But I am no one.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: You once told Voq that you didn't want the mantle of leadership.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I'll leave you to it, then.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Be good, Philippa.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Or you'll come for me?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Make sure I don't have to.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Isik for your thoughts.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I always wanted to find out what one was. I never did.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: L'Rell has arranged for a transport to a Makai ship.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: They're in for a surprise.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It's not the human way to make a message heard, but it's the Klingon way. I'm going with her. It's true, what the Emperor said. I'm no good for either side. I... But maybe I can be good for both. I've never been great at goodbyes.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Neither am I. I've had too many of them.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Michael. In spite of everything that happened to you, your capacity to love literally saved my life. I'm gonna miss looking at you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I see you, Ash, in your eyes. Only you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Thank... thank you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Burnham to Discovery. One to transport.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: T'Kuvma knew that the most powerful Empire was a united Empire. Twenty four Houses working as one. He believed the quickest way to bring us together was war with the Federation. But in this fight we have lost our way A new leader is needed to fulfill my Lord's vision. I am that leader.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: In my hand, I hold the fate of the Klingon homeworld. Of the Klingon Empire itself. We are proud. We are honourable. And we will be one again. You will throw down your arms or you will suffer the consequences. The choice is yours. The reunification of our race begins now.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Earth, Andor, Tellar, Vulcan. Every planet of the Federation has made the odyssey out of darkness into light. So too have the Klingons. The war is over. There were triumphs. Victories of spirit. Courage beyond reason. But make no mistake. These were bleak times. Times we cannot repeat. Times we cannot forget.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Isik for your thoughts.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What's an isik, anyway?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. It's something my mother used to say to me.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Thank you for coming. I'm glad to see you.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Is everything okay?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: When I was growing up, you told me not to forget my humanity. I didn't know what that meant. I didn't how to do it. I didn't even know why I would want to. I get it now. So thank you, for not giving up on me.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: That's what mothers do.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Michael.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Father.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: What the Federation chose to do on Qo'noS was unprincipled, and I had a part in it.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: The Klingons made it clear they would fight us to extinction. You were desperate to save us. I know the feeling all too well.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: And yet, you were able to find another way. I am not alone in finding your commitment to Starfleet's ideals commendable. I asked if I may give it to you. Your record has been expunged, your pardon by the president of the Federation is official.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Commander Burnham, the Federation is as grateful to you as I am to my daughter. Your mother will stay in Paris for a few days. I will travel with Discovery to Vulcan. You're picking up your new captain there.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I'm glad we'll be making that journey together.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: We are no longer on the eve of battle. Even so, I come to ask myself the same question that young soldier asked the general all those years ago. "How do I defeat fear?" The general's answer? The only way to defeat fear is to tell it "no." No, we will not take shortcuts on the path to righteousness. No, we will not break the rules that protect us from our basest instincts. No, we will not allow desperation to destroy moral authority. I am guilty of all these things. Some say that in life, there are no second chances. Experience tells me that this is true. But we can only look forward. We have to be torchbearers, casting the light so we may see our path to lasting peace. We will continue exploring, discovering new worlds, new civilisations. Yes, that is the United Federation of Planets.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Today, we honor Ensign Sylvia Tilly. Accepted into Starfleet Command Training Program.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Yes. That is Starfleet.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Lieutenant Commander Paul Stamets. Medical Officer Hugh Culber.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Yes, that is who we are.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Commander Saru. First Kelpien to receive the Medal of Honour.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: And who we will always be.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Never been to Vulcan before.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Well, if there's time, I'll show you around. It's strange that we're not jumping to Vulcan.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Well, Starfleet has committed to finding a non-human interface. Until that happens, I'm happy to go the old-fashioned way.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Captain on the bridge.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Acting Captain. Please take your stations. You may consult with Science Officer Burnham later.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Thank you, Mister Saru, for permitting me this small indulgence. I never tire of seeing home.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Of course. Lieutenant Detmer, have we cleared the Sol system?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Yes, Captain.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Set course for Vulcan, and engage at maximum warp.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Aye, sir.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Character: (They jump to warp. An incoming transmission, Federation
Dialogue: Encrypted priority one distress is detected.)

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Incoming transmission.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: From whom?

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I'm having trouble identifying it. But it's a priority-one distress call.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Identify the source, please.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: I'm getting a Federation ID code. It's choppy. Trying to clean it up, sir.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Helm, slow us down.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Dropping us out of warp now, sir.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: This is Captain Saru of the Federation Starship Discovery. Please identify yourselves.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: Hail's from Captain Pike, sir.

Title: will-you-take-my-hand
Dialogue: It's the USS Enterprise.
